loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 28 años de edad, hace un año se comprometió con su pareja, vive en una casa alquilada. Con su profesión de arte y pintura viajó a la ciudad de Lima, pensando explotar su dones como pintor;  pero no resultó como planeaba, entonces hizo contacto con personas dedicadas a la venta de artesanía, y como él es oriundo de San Pedro de Cajas (ubicado en la ciudad de Tarma, Junín) cuna de artesanos, le propusieron que les abasteciera de artesanía. Entonces decide retornar a su pueblo, y consiguió algo de capital para empezar su trabajo. Ahora está muy contento con la actividad que realiza, asimismo se da tiempo para pintar sus cuadros y una vez acumulada la mercadería viaja a Lima para repartir todos los pedidos y anotar los nuevos requerimientos. Le ha llevado mucho tiempo tener clientela, su mayor limitación era el dinero, pero ahora nota que su negocio está siendo cada vez más rentable. Luis es el presidente de su banco comunal llamado “San Pedro” y da el ejemplo pagando de forma puntual sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su capital de trabajo, para la compra de la artesanía que debe llevar a Lima.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old. About a year ago he got engaged to his girlfriend. He lives in a rented house. Since he is an artist who specializes in painting he moved to the city of Lima. He thought he was going to become a successful painter there. However, things did not turn out the way he hoped. He got in contact with artisans who make a living by selling crafts. He is from San Pedro de Cajas which is located in the city of Tarma, and is known as the cradle of artisans. His contacts helped him to become an artisan. So he decided to move back to his village and he got some money to start his own business. Now he is really happy with the activity he is doing because he gets more time to paint. He still goes to Lima to drop off paintings and his crafts to sell. He has been able to increase the number of customers that buy from him, but his greatest limitation is money. His business is getting more and more profitable and he needs money to invest in it. Luis is the president of his communal bank named "San Pedro". His asking for a loan of $650 to increase his capital for his business. He will use the money to buy the materials he needs for the paintings that he is selling in Lima.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada. Ambos son artesanos, su esposo teje mantas y frazadas en un telar grande, y ella es especialista en tapices geométricos, con un telar pequeño. Lucy no necesita apoyarse de ningún cuadro ni fotografía para realizar las diversas combinaciones de las figuras y los colores, porque dice tenerlo todo en su mente y solo necesita un poco de concentración. Este trabajo lo desarrolla por más de 20 años, lo que le ha permitido ganarse el reconocimiento de sus paisanos por tal habilidad. En el mes de marzo los tapices son muy rentables, pero su dificultad mayor es la falta de dinero para producir en grandes cantidades, por ello teje solo a pedido, por el que le adelantan la cuarta parte del precio. El trabajo de esta pareja de artesanos les sirve para solventar los gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos. En los ciclos anteriores, Lucy tuvo el cargo de vocal en su banco comunal, cumpliendo correctamente con la labor encomendada. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad es sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo empleará en la compra de materiales para la producción de más tapices, debido a la cercanía de las festividades de semana santa, donde hay mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Lucy is 32 years old and lives with her common law husband and their 4 children in a rented house. They are both artisans—her husband makes blankets and comforters with a large weaver and she is a specialist in small wall hangings, made with a small weaver. Lucy does not need the help of any paintings or pictures to make the varied combinations of colors and designs on her wall hangings. She says she has all of the designs in her mind and only needs to concentrate. She has been making textiles for more than 20 years, and her abilities have earned her the recognition of her peers. In the month of March her pieces are very profitable, but her greatest difficulty is that she lacks the money to produce large quantities. For large orders, she only makes custom orders and requires one fourth of the cost up front. The work of this artisan couple allows them to pay their household expenses and to provide an education for their children. In earlier loan cycles, Lucy was the spokeswoman for her community bank, where she successfully completed her required duties. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she has always been responsible with her payments. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy materials to make more wall hangings, since Easter is coming up and there is more demand for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 49 years old and married with six children. She sells eggs. Rita needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She is happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva, She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
AMANDA P. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito” con domicilio en la Urbanización el triunfo Mz. 30 Lt. 13 San Fernando del distrito D. Callería, tiene 51 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo D. conductor D. moto taxi.
La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que afianzó su trabajo en costura.  Ese préstamo le dio un impulso, ya que pudo comprar material para confección y debía D. producir para devolver el dinero, por lo tanto empezó a ver esa actividad, como una empresa.
Actualmente el préstamo D. S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. algodón, telas, hilos, blondas y todo tipo D. lencería, que es necesario para sus acabados, y también está apoyando a su cónyuge con el mantenimiento y reparación D. su moto taxi, ya que el también ayuda con el pago D. las cuotas, tiene una linda familia y está feliz.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda en préstamos a las mujeres, y que estas puedan ayudar a sus familias, es un gusto ser una socia D. su banquito comunal.
texts.en:
AMANDA P. D. R. belongs to the “Mujeres D. Éxito” (Successful Women) Communal Bank, she lives at Mz. 30 Lt. 13 San Fernando in the El Triunfo neighborhood, Callería district. She is 51 years old, has 3 children and her husband works as a motortaxi driver. Her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles financed her seamstress work. That loan gave her her start as she could buy material to make her items and she was able to return the money. So she began to see this activity as a business. Today she seeks a loan for S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles to buy cotton, fabric, needles, silk lace and all kinds of linens, whish are necessary for her clothing, and also this supports her husband in maintaining and repairing his motortaxi; he also help with the payments. She has a beautiful family and is happy. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its help with loans to women, and with them they can help their families. It is a pleasure to be a member of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton, fabric, needles, silk lace and all kinds of linen

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 57 años, enviudó hace 18 años, tiene 7 hijos, 2 de ellos viven con ella en su casa. Su esposo fue agricultor, en vida adquirió varios terrenos de cultivo para la ocupación de ellos y de sus hijos. Pero ahora Lucía se quedó sola, sus hijos mayores migraron a las ciudades, desde entonces sus siembras han aminorado y solo cultiva para su consumo personal, el resto de las chacras las viene alquilarlos para que le generen ingresos económicos. Ahora dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a la crianza de su ganado, tiene principalmente vacas y carneros. Desde las 5.00am prepara sus alimentos y da de comer a sus perros quienes son expertos en el rodeo de sus corderos y sale a pastear. Lucia está muy feliz con la agricultura y el cuidado de sus animales, y si necesita dinero urgente, vende a alguno de sus animales. Para asistir a todas las reuniones de pago de su banco comunal, ese día da de comer a sus animales en su corral y no sale a pastear. Este su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró pagar puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a preparar sus terrenos de cultivo para que estén listos para su próxima siembra, el resto es para arreglar sus corrales y las necesidades escolares de sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Lucía is 57 and has been widowed for 18 years. She has 7 children, two of which live with her in her home. Her husband was a farmer and acquired land to farm and for his children to live on when he was alive. Now Lucía is alone, and her oldest children have moved to the cities. Since then her plantings have decreased, and she only grows enough for her personal consumption. She rents the rest of the land to generate economic income. Now she dedicates most of her time to raising livestock. She mainly has cows and rams. At 5:00 a.m. she prepares her food and feeds her dogs, who are experts in rounding up the rams, and leaves to graze her animals. Lucía is very happy with agriculture and caring for her animals. If she needs money urgently, she sells some of her animals. To attend all of the payment meetings of her communal bank, on those days she feeds her animals in the corral and they don't go out to graze. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and in all of this time she has repaid them punctually. The money that she is requesting will go towards preparing her farmland so it will be ready for the next planting. The rest will go towards fixing up her corrals and towards the educational needs of her youngest children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare her farmland for planting

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda va cumplir 27 años de edad, hace 7 años vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, actualmente habitan en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 12 años produce papa, alverjas y maíz, en su mayoría, en chacras alquiladas, trata de sembrar en diferentes lugares y con temperaturas diversas para que sus cosechas sean alternadas. Su esposo es el encargado de realizar los trabajos más pesados, sobre todo en los meses de cosecha donde es indispensable su presencia. La siembra de papa le ha resultado muy buena gracias al buen precio del mercado, pero el maíz está en una mala temporada, los precios han bajado mucho, por ello decidió aguantar la cosecha hasta que mejore el precio. Asimismo, ya está preparando 2 chacras para sembrar alverjas, sembrará en distintas épocas para evitar que si bajan los precios recaiga en toda su producción. Hilda está muy feliz de ser campesina, y este trabajo le permite el sostenimiento de su familia. Es la secretaria de su banco comunal, y viene ejerciendo este cargo durante dos ciclos consecutivos, donde está demostrando mucha eficiencia. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que viene solicitando Hilda es para la compra de semillas de alverjas, asimismo los fertilizantes para complementar sus siembra.
texts.en:
Hilda will soon turn 27-years-old. For 7 years, she has lived with her partner and father of her 2 children. Currently they live in a rented house. For 12 years, she has produced potatoes, peas, and corn, mostly on rented plots of land. She trieds to plant in different places with diverse temperatures so her harvests can alternate. Her husband is in charge of carrying out the most difficult work; above all his presence during the harvest season is indispensable. Her potato harvest has yielded very good results thanks to the good market price, but corn is in a bad period because the prices have dropped a lot. This is why she has decided to postpone its harvest until the prices improve. This is why she is preparing 2 plots of land to plant peas. She will plant them in different stages to avoid having all of her production earn less money if prices fall. Hilda is very happy with being a farmer because this work allows them to support their family. She is the secretary of her communal bank, and she has had this position for two consecutive cycles. She is working with a lot of efficiency. This is her eighth loan with MFP. During this time she has not defaulted. The money that HIlda is requesting will go towards buying pea seeds and fertilizer to complement her plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift sells kerosene in her shop located at Kasidi, Okoko in Lagos State. Gift has four children and she is 35 years old. Gift is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she has used her loans to buy one deep freezer where she sells frozen food, like chicken and turkey. Toyin is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Sabo-Oniba. Toyin is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
ESTHER L. OLGUÍN, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre” vive en el Jr. José O’Higgins Mz N Lt 15 del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad, 02 hijos, es viuda.

Inició el negocio de abarrotes con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró verduras, frutas y  un poco de mercadería, pero no le fue tan bien, por lo que busco dedicarse a otra actividad. Por lo tanto se dedico a administrar un motocarro, que le resulto mucho mejor.

Hoy, cuenta ella con 2 motocarros y se dedica a su administración, y justamente el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en compras para el mantenimiento y renovación de sus llantas, tapices, y toldos, así como algunos repuestos y seguros necesarios.

Da gracias a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que está brindando a las mujeres de la región, dándoles una oportunidad de generar ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Esther L. O. belongs to the communal bank, "Amigas por Siempre" (Friends Forever). She lives in the city of Pucallpa, is 48, has 2 children, and is a widow. She started her grocery business with her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, and bought vegetables, fruits, and a small amount of other merchandise. It didn't go very well for her, though, and she searched for another activity to do. She started to administer a motorcycle rickshaw business, which went much better for her. Today she has 2 motorcycle rickshaws, which she administers. Now with the loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in their maintenance and replacing their tires, upholstery, and awnings, along with some parts and necessary insurance. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for its support because it is offering the best to women in the region, giving them an opportunity to generate income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and replacing tires, upholstery, awnings, parts, and necessary insurance

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es: Deyci tiene 34 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, por el momento vive en casa de su madrina de matrimonio. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de lana procesada que trae directamente de Lima y vende a 12 soles el kilo. Asimismo, compra tapices y en cada viaje a la capital los ofrece a sus clientes. Su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos las veces que viaja; es por ello que se siente muy complacida y feliz por ser una mujer dinámica y hábil para el comercio. Su meta es ahorrar dinero para comprar su propia casa donde pueda realizar su trabajo, ya que actualmente lo hace en un local que alquiló su madrina. Deyci en una nueva cliente de MFP, ha decidido integrar un banco comunal porque una de las socias la invitó y le contó sobre el método de trabajo que les permite progresar en su negocio. El dinero que solicita en este su primer préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería, para que no le falte ningún color de lana a su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Deyci is 34 years old, she is married and has three children. At the moment she lives at her godmother's house. It has been 5 years since she started making a living by selling processed wool. She brings the processed wool directly from Lima and she sells it at 12 Soles per Kilo. She also buys tapistries and every time she travels to the capital she offers them to her clients. Her business generates a good source of income for her when she travels to and from the capital. She is really happy being a dynamic woman that is capable of running a business. Her goal is to save up some money and buy her own home where she can continue her work. Right now she rents a space for her business from her godmother. Deyci is one of MFP's clients. She decided to be part of a communal bank because one of her friends invited her and told Deyci about the methods they teach that help people to improve their businesses. The money that she will get from this first loan will help her increase her merchandise, so that she will have all of the colors of wool that she needs for her establishment.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, 3 veces por semana en donde vende pescado congelado y fresco, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Alejandra son ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of Banco Comunal Trigales.

Alejandra is married. She is 46 years old. She has 5 children. Alejandra travels to different markets in the region 3 times a week. She sells frozen and fresh fish, which she does with the help of her children.

Alejandra needs a loan of $325 (1000 PEN) which will be invested in purchasing fish.

Alejandra's dreams are to increase her business and provide her children with a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Dorkas

texts.es: Dorkas tiene 21 años, es madre soltera, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Hace 3 años atrás trabajaba como costurera en una empresa de Lima, pero desde su embarazo regresó a su pueblo para cuidar de su hija, ya que al no contar con su pareja, sus padres la acogieron en su casa, por lo que está muy agradecida con sus padres. Empezó a atender el negocio de la familia, que es una bodega, pero al no alcanzarle el dinero su padre le cedió un terreno apropiado para la crianza de cuyes, por lo que se siente muy contenta con esta labor. Cuando empezó invirtió mucho tiempo y dinero, en especial en el alimento necesario para estos animalitos, pero poco a poco fue aumentando la cantidad de cuyes. Ahora se ha dado cuenta que la raza de sus animales no es muy buena, y su carne no es demandada, por lo que está buscando la asesoría de técnicos expertos para que pueda mejorar su negocio y se convierta en una reconocida proveedora de cuyes. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, es la tesorera de su banco comunal, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy eficiente en el cargo y en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar cuyes de una mejor raza, asimismo para pagar la asesoría de un profesional en el campo.
texts.en:
Dorkas is 21 years old. She is a single mother. She lives in her parent's home right now with her daughter. About three years ago she worked as a seamstress in a large company in Lima, Peru, but when she got pregnant with her daughter she returned to her town so that she could take care of her daughter. Her daughter's father left her. Her parents took her into their home and she feels so thankful for her parents. She started to help with the family business, which is a small store that sells groceries. However, she was not able to make enough money so her father let her use some land that was perfect for raising guinea pigs. When she started out raising the animals, she put a lot of time and money into the business. She especially invested a lot of money in purchasing feed for the animals. Little by little she began increasing the number of guinea pigs that she raised. Now she realizes that the breed of guinea pigs that she started raising is not the best and their meat is not the most sought after. This is why she would like to hire a consultant that could help her to improve her business. She wants to become recognized in her area for selling guinea pigs. This is her third loan with MFP and she is the treasurer of her communal bank. She has demonstrated that she works hard, does a good job as the treasurer and that she makes her payments on time. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy guinea pigs that are of a better breed and to pay for a professional agricultural consultant so that she can improve her business.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs that are of a better breed

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
ANA MARÍA P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el AA.HH. Nuevo paraíso Mz. F Lt. 15 del distrito de Callería, tiene 60 años, 09 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como contratista.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 años, con él, empezó a vender abarrotes en su casa, que acondicionó para que le sirviera a modo de tienda, pero en esta actividad no le fue tan bien, por eso después de un tiempo cerro la tienda y comenzó a dedicarse a otras actividades entre ellas la alquiler de un moto taxi.
Hoy en día ella administra 2 moto taxis, y justamente el préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus 2 moto taxis, tales como: cambio de tapizado de los 2 moto taxis, cambio de aceite y afinamiento, reparación de sistema eléctrico, etc.

Manuela Ramos me ha ayudado mucho comenta, ya que pude comprar 2 moto taxis para poderlos hacer trabajar y generar un ingreso mas para mi familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria P. M. is a member of the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives at 15 AA. HH. Nuevo Paraiso Mz. F. Lt., in the Calleria district. She is 60 years old and has 9 children. Her husband is a contractor. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received 2 years ago, she began selling groceries out of a store she built into her house. This business however, did not do so well. Eventually, she shut down her store and dedicated herself to a variety of other endeavours, including the leasing out of a motorcycle taxi. Today, she owns 2 motorcycle taxis, and with this new loan of 1,500 soles, she will invest in their maintenance. Among other things, they need reupholstering, oil changes, realigning, and an upgrade of their electronic systems. Ana Maria says the Manuela Ramos has helped her a lot. Being able to buy and lease her 2 motorcycle taxis has generated a good income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair 2 motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Nancy es soltera y tiene 25 años, Nancy tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Nancy es Enfermera de profesión y trabaja particularmente.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Los sueños de Nancy es tener un consultorio y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank "Trigales". Nancy is single and twenty five years old. Nancy has a store at her parent's house where she sells general groceries such as meats, vegetables and fruits. She works every day. In addition, Nancy is a nurse by profession and she also works for her self at her store. Nancy needs a loan of $325. She will invest the money in purchasing school supplies to sell at her store. Nancy's dreams are to have her own practice one day and to increase business at her store.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell at her store

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 66 años D. edad, está casada hace 45 años y tiene 7 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta D. cuadros decorativos, los cuales hace su esposo y ella es la encargada D. negociarlos; por cada uno gana entre 15 y 20 soles, la dificultad es que demora la venta D. todos. Mientras tanto, cada fin D. mes viaja a la capital llevando quesos y carnes rojas para vendarlas allá, donD. el precio le favorece mucho más. Esta última actividad le resulta muy rentable y pueden sostener sus gastos básicos. El resto D. días, en su pueblo, ofrece los cuadros que arma su esposo, con este negocio ya llevan más D. 15 años, y ha mejorado desD. hace 5 años que empezó a ser la proveedora D. una tienda D. artesanías, por ello, Genoveva y su esposo están muy felices, ya que les permitirá obtener mejores ganancias. Ella es una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos, este es su 3er crédito con MFP, del cual está muy agradecido porque le permitirle trabajar, y se siente feliz con cada uno D. la reuniones D. su banco comunal, porque es un motivo para que se encuentre con sus paisanos. El dinero que solicita ahora es para la compra D. materiales para la producción D. sus cuadros, y D. ese modo ser una proveedora eficiente con la tienda D. artesanías.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 66 years old, married, 45 years old and has 7 children. Along with her husband she sells decorative artwork which her husband makes and she is in charge of selling them. For each piece she earns 15-20 soles. The difficulty is it takes time to sell them all. Meanwhile, each weekend she travels to the capital, taking cheeses and red meats to sell there, where the price is more favorable. This latter business is very profitable and they can meet their basic needs. The rest of the days, in her town, she sells the artwork her husband provides, and they have been doing this for more than 15 years, and the last 5 years have improved she began to proviD. pieces to an artisan store. Genoveva and her husband are very happy as they will be able to generate greater earnings. She is very punctual with her loan payments. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, to whom she is very grateful because it enables her to work. She feels very happy with each one of the communal bank meetings because this is an opportunity to meet her colleagues. The money she seeks now is to buy materials to produce the artwork and in this way be an efficient provider of artwork for the artisan store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for artwork

loans.name: Aquina

texts.es:
AQUINA M. D. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el Jr. Miguel Grau N° 150 del AA.HH. Nuevo Paraíso del distrito D. Callería, tiene 60 años, 03 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo en hojalatería.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 3 años, con él, empezó a vender comida en pequeña cantidad, luego fue aumentando platos, hasta que hoy tiene ya una cantidad considerable D. comensales,  ye que sus clientes están aumentando día a día.

Con el préstamo es D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. vajilla, la que tiene ya no le alcanza, una congeladora D. segunda, que aun está en buenas condiciones, y también se va surtir D. insumos para sus menús diarios, si le sobra un poco D. dinero, también tiene planeado comprar unas mesas con sus respectivas sillas.

Está contenta con Manuela Ramos por la comprensión y ayuda que les otorga, por ello se encuentra con los ánimos para seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
AQUINA M. D. A. belongs to the “Atenas Portillanas” Communal Bank, she lives at Jr. Miguel Grau N° 150 del AA.HH. Nuevo Paraíso, Callería district. She is 60 years old, has 3 children and her husband works in a sheet metal shop. She received her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles three years ago, and she began to sell small quantities of food. She then expanded her dishes, until today, where now she has quite a variety of meals and her customers are growing daily. Today she seeks a loan for S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy place settings, as she doesn’t have enough, a used freezer that is still in good condition, and she is also going to stock her ingredients for the meals she prepares daily. If she has any leftover money she also plans to buy some tables and chairs. She is content with Manuela Ramos for its understanding and help it has provided, and through it she finds the inspiration to continue being punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy place settings, a used freezer, ingredients to prepare food, table and chairs

loans.name: Germain

texts.es: Germain tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus hermanos. De todos los artesanos de su pueblo Germain es el experto en el tejido de ponchos y mantas, con unos acabados impecables, los hilos que utiliza le son enviados de Lima, y aproximadamente usa un cono y medio por poncho. Los fines de mes vienen compradores de otras dos ciudades a su casa para comprarle sus prendas y mantas, para ellos, él elabora los ponchos con hilos más gruesos. Con este trabajo tiene más de 20 años, y en todo este tiempo ha podido comprar varios telares, para que pueda tejer en diferentes grosores, y cuando tiene mayores pedidos, sus hermanos lo apoyan en la elaboración. La meta de Germain es aumentar la calidad y producción de sus mantas y ponchos, además se siente feliz de tener su propio trabajo y en su propia casa. En los préstamos anteriores que tuvo con MFP, fue elegido vocal de su banco comunal, y cumplió con la labor de entregar los comunicados del asesor de crédito. Este es su 3er préstamo, y se compromete a seguir pagando con la misma puntualidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de hilos procesados en Lima, para que sus acabados sean de primera calidad.
texts.en:
Germain is 34 years old, is single, and lives in his parents' home in the company of his siblings. Of all the craft people of his town Germain is the expert in weaving ponchos and blankets, with flawless finishes. The threads he uses are sent from Lima, and he uses about a cone and a half for a poncho. At the end of the month buyers come from two other cities to his house to buy his articles and ponchos. For them, he produces ponchos with heavier threads. He has done this work for more than 20 years, and during this time he has been able to buy several looms, so he can weave in different thicknesses. When he has more orders, his siblings help him with the work. Germain's goal is to increase the quality and production of his blankets and ponchos. Also, he is happy to have his own work in his own home. In previous loans he had with MFP, he was elected member of his community bank, and took on the work of delivering the reports of the credit advisor. This is his 3rd loan and he commits to continue paying with the same punctuality. The money requested is for the purchase of threads processed in Lima, so that his finished products are top quality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prrocessed threads for a better finished product.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Raquel es soltera y tiene 23 años, Raquel se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente en el terminal de una empresa de transporte urbano.
Raquel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños de Raquel son construir su casa y tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Wheat Field Communal Bank. Raquel is single, 23 years old. She sells meals, something that she does with the help of her sister. She makes her sales from an urban public transport station. Raquel needs a loan of $300, which will be used to purchase rice, sugar, and pasta. Raquel's dreams are to build a house and have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Suwbatu

texts.en: Suwbatu is 50 years old and married with 4 children. Suwabatu sells firewood and charcoal and she has been in this business for the past 10 years. Suwabatu has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Roselindo

texts.es:
Roselindo es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Roselindo es soltero y tiene 35 años, Roselindo tiene un restaurante – Polleria llamado Rico Rico, que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de 3 personas.
Roselindo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y una refrigeradora.
Los sueños de Roselindo son ampliar su negocio y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Roselindo is a member of the communal bank "Trigales". Roselindo is single and is 35 years old. Roselindo has a restaurant called "Rico Pico" that is located in a space that he rents. The restaurant's specialty is chicken. He works every day at the restaurant and he counts on the help of three employees. Rosolindo needs a loan of $500 (1,500 Soles) that he will use to buy pots and pans and a refrigerator. Roselindo's dreams are to make is business grow and to open another "Rico Pico" restaurant.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and pans and a refrigerator

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
AZUCENA B. D. RODRÍGUEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio ubicado en el AA.HH. Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 29  tiene 45 anios y 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un Hotel.

	Ella se encuentra trabajando desD. el 2002, con Manuela Ramos, y el primer préstamo que tuvo fue D. S/. 300 nuevos soles, con el que dio comienzo a su actividad en ventas D. comida, y debido a la atención amable que reciben sus clientes, siempre están acudiendo a su pequeño local, en un tiempo comenta ella que estuvo en el negocio D. moto taxis, pero no le resulto, por lo que siguió con las comidas.
	
	El préstamo D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra D. vajilla, mesas, e insumos para sus platos, también comprará mesas, sillas y ambientara su local.
texts.en:
Azucena B. D. Rodríguez is a member of the communal bank “Las Atenas Portillanas”, and resides in the Pedro Portillo Martinez district, Lot 29. She is 45 years old, has four children, and her husband works in a hotel.

She has been working since 2002 with Manuela Ramos, and her first loan was for 300 PEN with which she began selling meals. Owing to the friendly attention that her customers receive, they are always coming to her small location. At another time she tells us that she had a business of motorcycle taxis, but it did not have results, so she started selling meals.

The loan of 1,500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of plates, tables, and food for her dishes. She will also buy tables, chairs and liven up her location.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of plates, tables, and to improve the ambience of her location

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
La sra. Blanca; es socia del banco comunal, ella tiene 68 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos ellos casados y con familia propia, excepto su hijo D. 26 años que aún los acompaña. Ella vive en av. Baja 285 en el cercado D. Cusco.

La socia Blanca, comparte entre sus labores del hogar, la administración D. su panadería, que está ubicada en su casa, ella también tiene sus terrenos D. cultivo, ella normalmente siembra, maíz, trigo, cebada; Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para comprar insumos (harina, levadura, entre otros) para la panadería, ella también comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras.

La sra. Blanca está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado, y se compromete a pagar el préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank. She is 68 years old, married and has seven children. They are married and have their own families, except for a 26 years old son, who still lives with her. She lives on Av. Baja 285 in Cusco.

Blanca takes care of her home and bakery located at her house. She also has land and plants corn, wheat and barley.

The client would like the loan to buy baking ingredients like flour and yeast. She will also buy fertilizer for her land. She appreciates the support given to her and is committed to repay the loan within the agreed time.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and fertilizer

loans.name: Dora Janisa

texts.es:
DORA JANISA SALDAÑA F., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el AA.HH. Telefónica Mz. G Lt. 2 del distrito de Callería, tiene 26 años, 1 hijo, y su esposo es conductor de una moto taxi.

Al principio ella se dedico a la venta de comida en las tardes, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  pero lo dejo por unos inconvenientes que tuvo, más adelante, pudo comprar ropa que venía de oferta de Lima, y así empezó a dedicarse a ese negocio, que le ha sido rentable.

Hoy realiza compras directamente de Lima y los vende al por menor entre su vecinas, amigas y clientes, y el préstamo actualmente de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la compra de ropa, por ello ha planificado un viaje, y juntamente con los ahorros que tiene, traerá una gran diversidad de ropa.

Debido a que no hay trámites engorrosos, y la garantía no es tan exigente, ha podido prestarse y pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, y todo gracias a la ONG  Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dora Janisa Saldana F. belongs to the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She is 26 years old, has one son, and her husband is a taxi driver. At first she worked selling food in the evenings, with her first loan of 300 New Soles, but she left this because it had some drawbacks, later she was able to buy clothing for sale from Lima and she began to really engage in this business which has become profitable. Today she makes purchases directly from Lima and sells them at retail prices to her neighbors, friends, and customers, and the current loan of 1,000 New Soles will be invested in the purchase of clothing, because she had a purchasing trip planned, and along with her savings, she will bring back a wide range of clothing. As there is no cumbersome bureaucracy, and the warranty is not demanding, and she has been able maker her payments on time, and thanks to the Manuela Ramos NGO.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas clothing for retail

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
GRACIELA CHÁVEZ D. GARCÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito” con domicilio en la Av. Bellavista N° 594 del distrito D. Calería, tiene 41 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró un poco D. cosméticos y los empezó a distribuir entre sus amigas y conocidas, encontrando una actividad rentable. Más adelante  se dedicó a compra D. productos alimenticios, como leche, conservas, mermeladas y otros.
Ella, hoy comercializa todo lo que está a su alcance, cualquier oportunidad D. negocio es rápidamente tomada, así el préstamo D. S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra D. un surtido D. cosméticos que ya tiene pedido, yogurt, y conservas, también comprara un poco D. telas que están D. oferta en Lima.
Comenta: “Manuela Ramos da ayuda a las mujeres que quieren progresar pero se debe tener cuidado con no excederse en el monto a trabajar”.
texts.en:
Graciela Chávez D. García belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres D. Éxito" ("Successful Women"), located at Avenida Bellavista No. 594 in the district of Calería. She is 41 years old, has two children, and her husband has his own work. With her first loan for S/.300, she bought a few cosmetics and sold them to her friends and acquaintances, which was a profitable activity. Later she bought foods such as milk, canned goods, jams, and other things. Today she sells anything that is available. Any kind of business opportunity is quickly taken. She will use this S/.1,500 loan to buy an assortment of cosmetics that have already been ordered, yogurt, and canned goods. She will also buy some fabric that is available in Lima. She says: "Manuela Ramos* helps women who want to make progress, but you have to be careful not to take on more work than you can handle." *Manuela Ramos is the name of an organization that offers microfinancing in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted cosmetics. Purchase yogurt and canned goods. Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia María Antonieta; tiene 42 años de edad, ella es conviviente, y tiene 3 hijos de (21, 18, 14) años de edad, ella aún los apoya con sus estudios, ella vive en la Urb. pueblo libre en aracopata.

Nuestra socia, alterna sus actividades domésticas con la confección de todo tipo de prendas, ella es costurera de profesión; La sra. María Antonieta, necesita el préstamo para comprar diferentes telas y otra parte la destinará al mejoramiento de su casa, ella aún educa a sus hijos, el menor aún está en el colegio y los otros hijos están estudiando en el nivel superior, con la realización de sus obras ella podrá seguir educando a su hijos.

La socia valora y agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The client Ms. Maria Antonieta is 42 years old and lives in the housing development Pueblo Libre in Aracopata. She lives with her common-law husband and they have three children, 21, 18 and 14 years old. She supports them with their schooling. The youngest attends regular school and the older ones post-secondary education.

Ms. Maria Antonieta is a seamstress and divides her time between housework and the making of all kinds of garments. She needs the loan to buy different textiles and to improve her home. She would be able to continue supporting her children’s education through her work.

The client values and appreciates the support given to her through this loan, and she is committed to repay the total within the scheduled time.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles and improve her house

loans.name: Darly Luz

texts.es:
DARLY LUZ A. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz. I Lt. 7 del Distrito de Callaría, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, y su pareja es conductor de vehículos mayores.

El primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, los invirtió en abrir una pequeña bodega, tiene un año trabajando con Manuela Ramos y está progresando en su bodega, en este tiempo ha podido hacer buenos clientes, ella esta consciente que una buena atención es lo que hace que el cliente vuelva, y también que no falte nada en su tienda.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300. Nuevos Soles, va realizar sus compras al por mayor, ya que tiene guardado un poco de dinero y con este préstamo va incrementarlo y surtir muy bien su tienda, por lo que ha hecho una lista de todo lo que le está faltando y los productos que ya se están agotando. Siempre está atenta a las ofertas que salen para traerlos a sus clientes.

Le agrada que en la región se haya instalado Manuela Ramos y se siente feliz de que haya una ONG, especialmente pensando en las mujeres.
texts.en:
DARLY LUZ A. C. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives on Miraflores Ave in the Callao District. She is a 35-year-old mother of 2 and her partner is a truck driver.

With the first loan she received of 300 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.), she invested in starting up a small grocery store. She's been working with Manuela Ramos for a year and in that time has been able to grow her business, amassing a loyal clientele. She is conscious of the fact that providing a customer with good service and keeping the store well stocked means a repeat customer.

With this loan of 1,300 soles and her own savings, Darly is going to invest in wholesale merchandise to stock her store. She has already made a list of products she wants to buy and those she is running low on. She's always on the lookout for good offers and products she can pass on to her customers.

She is pleased that a Manuel Ramos is operating in her area and is happy that there is an ONG dedicated to helping women.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Qatun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Qatun Llaqta que significa Pueblo GranD. que inicia el quinto ciclo con 16 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Socos que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, comida, Animales menores, realizan artesanías en telar y la agricultura

Como es el caso D. Modesta que es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Modesta tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general, además Modesta es artesana, realiza tejidos en telar como alfombras, tapices.

Por otro lado Mariluz es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Mariluz venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el parque D. su distrito, además Mariluz venD. verduras en los diferentes pueblos. 

Mientras que Aurora es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Aurora tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Aurora se dedica a la agricultura y crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. leña, arroz, sal, fideo, aceite, leche, quesos, trigo, cebada, maiz y animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Qatun Llaqta" which means "Big Town", has begun it's 5th cycle with 16 associates. The associates are from the district of Socos which is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Each of the associates has a different business. The businesses fall under groceries, food, small animals, farming and handicrafts. For example: Modesta is 48 years old, married, has 3 children and owns a general store. She is also an artist and weaves carpets and rugs. Mariluz is 24 years old, has a partner and has 2 children. She sells food in the park in her district and also sells vegetables in different towns. Aurora is 36 years old, married, has 3 children and owns a store where she sells groceries. She also works in agriculture and raises cattle. The associates need several loans in the amounts of 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles for a total of 9,950 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.) in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans would be used to buy firewood, rice, salt, noodles, oil, milk, cheese, wheat, barley, corn and small animals. The associates wish to one day own their own houses, increase their sales and for their children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, salt, noodles, oil, milk, cheese, wheat, barley, corn and small animals.

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La socia Nemecia; tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos (22,14,,8) años de edad, ella vive en Urb. Pueblo libre C-7 en arcopata.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes (arroz, harina, leche, aceite, granos, galletas, fideos, entre otros), la sra. Menecia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicita el préstamo.

L a socia está muy agradecida y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member Nemecia is 42 years old. She is married and has three children 22, 14 and 8 years old. She lives in the housing development Pueblo Libre in Arcopata.

Nemecia divides her time between doing house chores and working at her store. She has a grocery store, where she sells rice, flour, beans, pasta, oil and milk among other products. She would like to buy supplies to stock the store and this is the reason to request the loan.

The member Nemecia is very grateful and values the support given to her through the loan. She is committed to repay the total amount within the scheduled time

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
ELDITH A. USHIÑAHUA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo N° 354 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, y su pareja trabaja en una panadería.

Desde 3 años de socia en Manuela Ramos, y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, los uso para dar algunas condiciones a su local, y poder trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y seguridad. 
Hoy con la ayuda que ha tenido, ha mejorado mucho el local, con un préstamo hecho pudo cambiar el techo y arreglar algunas maquinas, el préstamo de S/.3,000. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra de harina, azúcar, y todos los insumos para tener un buen stock de materia prima. Es muy optimista y quiere seguir progresando.

Esta agradecida por la ayuda que da Manuela Ramos, le ha  ayudado mucho a progresar con su empresa y cree que las oportunidades están a la mano sin mucho papeleo.
texts.en:
ELDITH A. USHIÑAHUA is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives at 354 Jr. Victor Montalvo in the Callao District. She is a 46-year-old mother of 3 and her partner works in a bakery.

She has been a Manuel Ramos associate for 3 years and the first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in upgrading her business in order to work comfortably and safely. Today, with the help she has received, she has been able to better her locale, including replacing the ceiling and fixing some equipment.

With this loan of 3,000 soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she will invest in flour, sugar, and other items in order to stock up on basic ingredients. She's very optimistic and wants to continue moving ahead.

She is thankful for the help she's been given by Manuela Ramos; it has helped her move forward with her business and she believes opportunities are at hand without much paperwork.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and other items in order to stock up on basic ingredients

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita O. is thirty-five years old. She is married with two children, both males. Both of her sons are in the basic school. Rita’s husband is a farmer while she is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Rita trades in women’s underwear such as brassieres, panties, chemisettes, etc. She buys her goods from the wholesalers in nearby towns and sells in the local market square. She hawks to sell her goods. Rita has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to procure many kinds of underwear in bulk to be able to reach out to more customers and, if possible, trek to other markets to sell. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio JULIAN; tiene 73 años de edad, es casado y tiene 12 hijos, el último hijo del socio Julian tiene 22 años de edad, el vive en el barrio de picchu la rinconada; a 35 minutos de la cuidad del Cusco.

El socio es jubilado, el trabajo en el club Cusco durante 35 años, el ahora se dedica junto a su esposa a atender su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicita el préstamo para así el poder implementar su negocio de abarrotes y tener más variedad en sus productos.

El socio está muy agradecido por la oportunidad otorgada y valora el esfuerzo de este medio, por lo cual se compromete a cumplir con los pagos establecidos, ya que el es una persona muy confiable y cumplida.
texts.en:
Julian is 73 years old. He is married and has 12 children. His youngest child is 22 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of Picchu La Rinconada, which is located 35 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Julian is retired now. He worked for 35 years at Club Cusco. Now he and his wife work together running a small grocery store that they own. He is asking for a loan so that he can add merchandise to his store and have a greater variety of products.

Julian is very thankful for the opportunity to get a loan for his business. He really values the help being offered to him and he promises to be very responsible about making payments on the loan. He is a very responsible and trustworthy person.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add stock to his small grocery store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
ELVIRA P. D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Túpac Amaru N° 202 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 67 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos,  es viuda.
Esta dedicada al alquiler D. maquinaria pesada y D. transporte, el primer préstamo que obtuvo D. S/.300 nuevo soles, le sirvió para refaccionar un vehículo, y ponerlo en alquiler, su condición D. mujer no la detiene para dedicarse al rubro D. maquinaria pesada.

El préstamo D. S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, con el que va realizar el mantenimiento D. sus unidades, y estos estén listos para su alquiler.

Esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos, la ayuda que les da le ha  ayudado a no depender D. un esposo, como algunas mujeres, por el contrario a podido salir adelante sola.
texts.en:
ELVIRA P. D. V. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives at 202 Jr. Túpac Amaru in the Callao District. She is a 76-year-old, widowed mother of 5.

She rents out heavy machinery and transportation. The first loan she received of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she used to refurbish her truck in order to put it up for rent. Being a woman has not stopped her from being in the business of heavy machinery.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will tune up and upgraD. her machines in order to rent them.

She's very thankful for the help she has received from Manuela Ramos; it has enabled her to move ahead on her own, instead of depending on her husband, like other women.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tune up and upgrade her machines in order to rent them

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-nine years old. She is a divorced mother of seven children, one female and six males. Three of the children are learning trades while four are in school: junior high school and the basic schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader and trades in maize. She buys maize in bags from farmers in villages and treks to markets to sell. She says most of her customers are food vendors. She has been in this business for three years. Afia wants a loan to procure more bags of maize to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Alicia Martina

texts.es:
La socia ALICIA; tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y aún  no tiene hijos.

La socia es economista de profesión y recientemente se caso, ella y su esposo pusieron un gimnasio, el cual ahora desean implementarlo un poco más, para esto ella necesita este préstamo para comprar máquinas de gimnasia.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado para la realización de su negocio, y valora y agradece el préstamo y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda y más adelante solicitar otro préstamo para implementar su gimnasio a medida que la gente vaya conociéndolo.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and is married but she has no children.

She is an economist by profession and she recently married. She and her husband set up a gym which they would like to continue expanding. For this to happen she requires a loan to purchase exercise machines.

She is grateful for the loan to imparted to her for the development of her buiness. She values it and is grateful for it and she promises to repay the loan. Later on she hopes to apply for another loan as her business grows.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase exercise equipment.

loans.name: Tawiah

texts.en:
Tawiah A. is twenty-six years old. She is a divorced mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Currently, all her three children are in school. She works very hard to cater for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Tawiah is a trader. She trades in groceries such as rice, vegetable cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, and other food items in a small kiosk in front of her house. She buys her goods from the wholesalers in the nearby cities at cost-effective prices. She says most of her customers are food vendors and her neighbors. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more varieties of goods. She hopes to save enough to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure more varieties of goods for sale

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jeannette tiene una pulpería ubicada en el barrio Naciones unidas, la cual inicio desde hace tres años con dinero de la liquidación de su trabajo que laboraba en zona franca y con ayuda de su esposo, el cual trabaja en servicios de seguridad, doña Jeannette tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos que estudian la secundaria uno de 15 y16 años. Uno de sus planes es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos y que tengan una oportunidad en la vida diferente. Este es el tercer cicló en Afodenic de sus préstamo que son de muchos beneficios por que ha incrementado su inventario y en lo personal se siente respaldada por los créditos, con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de insumos diarios como pollo, carnes, grano básicos que es lo que el cliente consume mas, lo espera incrementar las ventas como captar mas cliente. A futuro es poder hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Jeanette has a grocery store in the Naciones Unidas neighborhood. She started it three years ago with the money she liquidated from her job in the French neighborhood and with the support of her husband, who works in security. Jeannette is 36 years old and has two children in secondary school, aged 15 and 16. One of her plans is to be able to give them a good education so they will have an opportunity for a different life. This is her third loan cycle with Afodenic. She has benefited greatly in her inventory and also personally, as she feels supported by the loans. She will invest this loan in the purchase of consumer goods such as chicken, meats, and basic grains, which are what her customers consume the most. She hopes to increase her sales as well as bring in more customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meats, chicken and other daily consumer products

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is forty-three years old. He is a married man and has two children, both girls. Both of his daughters are in the basic school. He says that, as the man of the house, he needs to work very hard to make income to support the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Kofi’s wife is a trader. She runs a cold store in the local market to support him financially.

Kofi deals in second-hand textiles and unisex clothes. He buys bales of second-hand clothes from Kumasi and treks to sell in markets in the nearby communities. He has been in business for three years. Kofi wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. He is hopeful to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand textiles and clothing

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
INOCENCIA C. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con domicilio en la Segunda etapa Urbanización Primavera Mz. 24 Lt. 9 Manantay, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, y por ahora está separada de su cónyuge.

Se dedica a la venta de comida al paso y al primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que compro una sombrilla y una cocina, con lo que pudo dedicarse mas a fondo en su negocio.
Actualmente el  préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la implementación de una bodega, por lo cual tiene una lista de los artículos que son necesarios, para empezar con el negocio. Tales como: azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, fideo, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, verduras y frutas.

Desde que ingreso a  Manuela Ramos los préstamos han sido  gran ayuda dado que lo dan de manera mas rápidos y esto es un factor importante   para   las mujeres que trabajamos.
texts.en:
Inocencia C. V., is a part of the Banco Comunal "Mujeres de Exito", or the Community Bank "Women of Success." She lives in the Segunda etapa Urbanización Primavera Mz. 24 Lt. 9 Manantay. She is 54 years old and had has two children. She is currently separated from her husband.

She sells food to go. Her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles. With that she bought a sun umbrella and a stove, with which she expanded her business. The loan she is currently seeking is for 3,000 Nuevos Soles, to invest in the building of a small grocery store. She has a list of the necessary items for the store, in order to begin the business. Some of the items are sugar, rice, milk, oil, pasta, soft drinks, candy, vegetables, and fruits.

Since Manuela Ramos joined this group, the loans have been a huge help. They are distributed in a very timely manner and this is an important factor for working women.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, milk, oil, pasta, soft drinks, sweets, vegatables, and fruits

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en:
Awudu M. is 26 years old. He is single but lives his younger siblings who are under his care. He says he works very hard to make income to provide for his siblings in school. He lives with them in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Awudu deals in livestock such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc. He buys the live animals from all the way up in the northern part of the country and sells them in the south. Awudu supplies the animals to the butchers in the local abattoir and also treks to nearby towns to sell. He has been in this business for six years now. Awudu wants a loan to procure more of the livestock so as to increase his profit margin. He is hoping to improve his life and give his siblings needed support.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Rosy

texts.es:
La socia ROSY; tiene 26 años de edad y es casada ella tiene 2 hijos de (6 y 3) años de edad; la socia es natural del Cusco.

La socia Rosy, alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio de compra y venta de ropa y artículos de decoración par el hogar, ella viaja hasta la frontera con Bolivia y trae ropa al por mayor, y artículos para el hogar, lo cual ella vende en las ferias semanales (sábado y domingo), en el mercadillo llamado el “altiplano”, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer ropa para implementar su pequeño negocio.

L asocia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a realizar con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Rosy is 26 years old, married and has two children, aged six and three. She is a native of Cusco. Rosy alternates her domestic activities with the buying and selling of clothing and home decor. She travels to the Bolivian border, bringing wholesale clothing and home items, which she sells at weekly fairs (Saturdays and Sundays), at the "Altiplano" flea market. She seeks this loan so she can travel and bring clothes to carry out her small business. She is grateful for, and values, this loan and promises to pay her debt in the allotted time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell clothing and home decor

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
MADELEINE P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el Jr. Atenas de Ucayali N° 100 AA.HH. Pedro Portillo del distrito de Callería, tiene 40 años, 04 hijos, dos de ellos aun esta estudiando y su esposo tiene trabajo como chofer.

La primera vez que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos se dedicó al rubro de comidas, y obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 7 años, tiempo después cambio de actividad, dedicándose a la administración de moto taxis, actividad que le da el tiempo necesario para dedicarse a su familia.

El préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la reparación y poner en marcha un moto taxi que está casi desarmado en su casa, y dejarlo en actividad, cambio de tapizado y motor así como afinamiento y reparación de sistema eléctrico, etc.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos de la ayuda recibida, ya que no exige demasiado tramite solo DNI, y ser responsable y sale rápido el préstamo, estoy eternamente agradecida, acotó.
texts.en:
Madeleine P. M. is a member of the community bank "Atenas Portillanas". She lives in the district of Callería. She is 40 years and has four children, two of who are still studying; her husband works as a driver. When she first started working with Manuela Ramos seven years ago, she was selling food and borrowed 300.00 soles. She later changed businesses and began managing mototaxis which allows her more time for her family. She will use this loan of 1,500.00 soles to repair a mototaxi which has been taken apart with the pieces at her home and make it roadworthy. She will change the upholstery and motor, have it tuned up and repair the electrical system and so on. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the help she has received because they did not require too much paperwork, only her identity card and that she be responsible and repay the loan quickly, I am eternally grateful, she noted.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and make a mototaxi roadworthy as it is currently in pieces at her home, to change the upholstery, and motor, have it tuned up and repair the electrical system

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M., 30, is a married mother of five children, three males and two females. One of her children is yet to start school. The rest are in the junior high and basic school. Rose lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Rose works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. Rose prepares and sells a local dish called “Ga-Kenkey,” produced from corn dough. The cooked dough is balled in corn husks and cooked again. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She sells by the street in the evenings. Rose has been in this business for barely one year. She wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Doña Camila, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores y casados, su negocio  es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos y perfumes, lleva muchos años en este comercio el cual inicio a mucho esfuerzo vendiendo en los departamento a kilómetros de su hogar para poder alimentar a su familia. La señora Camila tiene siete ciclo trabajando en Afodenic que ha beneficiado a su familia a su desempeño, al comercio, y prosperacion, con este crédito quiere comprar ropa, perfumes y unos electrodoméstico que son encargo, ella vende al contado y al crédito dando oportunidad como se la brindan a ella a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es crecer en ventas como en la captación de clientes para apoyar siempre a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Camila lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, is 56 years old, and has three grown and married children. Her business is the sale of clothing, home electronics and perfumes. She has been in this business for many years, and started with much effort selling in departments kilometers away from home in order to be able to sustain her family. Camila has worked with Afodenic through seven loan cycles, and it has benefited her family, her personal performance, her business, and her prosperity. With this loan, she hopes to buy clothing, perfumes and some home electronics which are in demand. She sells for both cash and credit, giving her customers the same opportunities she is given. Her plan for the future is to increase sales and bring in new customers to keep supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes and other products to offer her customers

loans.name: Susana Tatiana

texts.es:
SUSANA TATIANA C. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con domicilio en el Jr. Inmaculada N° 287 del distrito de Callería, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos a su cargo, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Inicio su negocio en el rubro de repostería, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró insumos necesarios para preparar tortas para toda ocasión, este negocio le da tiempo para atender a su familia tranquilamente.

Actualmente ella, está implementando una Fuente de Soda en su propio domicilio, por lo que el préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en los pisos, techo, separaciones, vitrinas, conservadora e insumos para su local, también está mandando a diseñar e imprimir sus propagandas, debido al buen carácter que muestra a sus clientes, está segura que el negocio ha de salirle muy bien.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es una ONG que da ayuda a las mujeres, aunque estos sean limitados, son los necesarios para seguir adelante y están al alcance de los pagos.
texts.en:
Susana Tatiana C. C. is a member of the “Mujeres de Éxito” (“Successful Women”) Community Bank and lives at 287 Inmaculada Lane in the Callería district. She is 40 years old, has three children, and her husband is self-employed.

Susana started a baking business and with her first loan, for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, she purchased the supplies necessary to prepare cakes for all occasions. This business leaves her enough time to take care of her children.

Currently, Susana is building a soda fountain in her home. She will invest this loan for 3,000 nuevos soles in new floors and a roof, as well as display cases, a cooler, and other supplies for her shop. She will also design and print advertisements. Because of her good nature and relationship with her customers, Susana is sure that her business will be successful.

Susana says that Manuela Ramos is an organization that helps women, even if they are have limited resources. They do what is necessary to get ahead and stay on top of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new floors, a roof, display cases, a cooler, and other supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is 48 years old. She is married with eight children. Both of her sons are in the university while the ladies are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Gladys’ husband is farmer. She is also a farmer and trader as well. She trades in onions. Gladys procures her goods (bags of onions) all the way from Ejura and sells in the local market square. Gladys also treks to sell her goods in other markets. She has been in business for five years. Gladys wants a loan to procure onions in bulk to reach out to more customers. She hopes to support her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Procure onions in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A., 42, is a married mother of four children, two males and two females. According to her, two of her children are in the tertiary level – university and the training college while the rest are in junior high and the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Rose works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She runs a provisions store in her community. She also sells vegetables on a table top in front of her store. Rose has been in this business for eight years. She wants a loan to procure more goods. Rose is hopeful to support all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: Procure provision.

loans.name: Mirsa

texts.es:
MIRSA F. F., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con domicilio en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley N° 490 del distrito de Callería, tiene 45 años, 4 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo de tapicería.

En conjunto con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, iniciaron el rubro de tapizados, especializándose en moto taxis, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compraron materiales para incrementar su pequeño negocio.

Hoy en día, su taller es muy conocido y los clientes llegan recomendados o por cuenta propia, lo que hace necesario que tengan sus materiales listos para cualquier pedido, por lo que el préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra de madera, Marroquín, pernos, tachuelas y otros.

Con el apoyo que tubo de Manuela Ramos que fue bastante por cierto, ha podido salir adelante, ella y su familia, por lo que esta contenta con esta ONG.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirsa F. F. is a member of the Successful Women Communal Bank. She lives on Guillermo Sisley Jr. No.490 of Calleria District. She is 45 years old and has four children. Her husband works in upholstery. Along with her husband and children she opened the workshop: “Rubro de Tapizados”, which specializes in Motorbike-Taxis. They bought materials for their business with their first loan of S/300.00 Nuevos Soles. Presently, their workshop is known and the customers are recommended or arrive of their own accord, so it is important for the F. F. to have materials in stock to be able to take orders on the spot. Mirsa will utilize the requested loan of S/1.500.00 Nuevos Soles, to buy wood, bolts, nails, tacks and other materials. With the great help from Manuela Ramos Credit for Women, Mirsa and her family have been able to progress and she is very pleased with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, bolts, nails, tacks and other upholstery materials

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia ALBERTINA; Tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, tiene 3 hijos (27,25, 23)años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el cercado.

La socia ayuda a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y alterna sus actividades del hogar a la administración y a la cocina en su restaurante, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más muebles e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, la socia educa  a sus hijos con este oficio.

Nuestra socia esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo que le otorgan mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo y nuevamente agradece a ustedes.
texts.en:
Our member ALBERTINA is 43 years old, married with 3 children ages 27,25, and 23. She lives within the city limits of Cuzco.

Albertina helps her children with their advanced studies, and alternates her homemaking activities with managing and cooking for her restaurant. She needs a loan to buy more furniture and ingredients used to prepare her dishes. Albertina supports her children’s education with this occupation.

Our member is very grateful and appreciative of the loan granted to her through this means, and therefore, commits to repaying the full loan amount. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her restaurant

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
LUCILA C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 174 Lt. 3 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura.

El primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, y desde 3 años de socia en Manuela Ramos, al inicio tubo una tienda de abarrotes, pero por infortunios lo tuvo que cerrar, mas adelante se dedico con sus hijas al rubro de la belleza e instalaron en su casa un pequeño salón, con el tiempo están obteniendo clientela y ganas de seguir adelante.
El último préstamo que recibió de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en espejos, sillas, juegos de peines para implementar su  salón de belleza y una parte invertirá con su esposo en el cultivo de yuca. Aunque los problemas de salud siempre aquejan, está decidida a seguir adelante y cumplir con sus letras.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, y se siente contenta, ya que de tal modo también colabora en su hogar, con sus hijas y esposo.
texts.en:
Lucila C. R. is part of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas." She lives in Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 174 Lt. 3 del Distrito de Callería. Lucila is 59 years old and has 7 children. Her husband works in agriculture.

The first loan she received was for 300 Nuevo Soles, after 3 years of membership in Manuela Ramos. At first she had a grocery store, but unfortunately it had to close. Later, with her children she sold beauty products and built a small salon in her house. Over time she has gained clientele and wants to continue moving forward. Her most recent loan is for 2,000 Nuevos Soles. This will be used to buy mirrors, chairs, and a comb set for her beauty shop. Additionally, part of the loan will be invested by her husband for yucca cultivation. Although people always suffer from health problems, she is dedicated to moving forward and complying with the loan agreement.

She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for believing in her. She feels very satisfied because there has been collaboration in her home, with her daughters and husband.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer
