loans.use: To buy mirrors, chairs, and a comb set

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of one child, a girl. According to her, her daughter has completed vocational training school. Martha lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Martha works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She sells cosmetics such as creams, pomades, body spray, powder, etc., in her community. She has been in this business for eight years. She buys the cosmetics from Kumasi and hawks to sell. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Martha wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es: La señora Jenny tiene 45 años de edad, casada, residen ene. Bo la fuente, tiene dos hijos  de 18 y 12 años de edad, los dos estudiantes, su esposo se desempeña en docente de secundaria y ella también es docente de secundaria con veinticinco años de experiencia, con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en infraestructura en el cambio sistema eléctrico que le ha estado dando problema. Lo cual quiere prevenir y proteger a su familia. Sus planes  es poder seguir estudiando el magisterio para ser una profesional y poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos, también poder seguir haciendo mejora a su casa
texts.en:
Jenny is 45 years old and is married. She lives in Bo la Fuente, and has two children, aged 18 and 12 years old, both of whom are students. Her husband is a high school teacher. She is also a high school teacher with 25 years' experience. With this loan request she will invest in the repair of the electrical system that has recently been problematic. She wants to protect and provide for her family. Her plans are to be able to keep her Master's degree studies to become a professional and to give her children a good education, and to be able to keep making improvements to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electrical wiring to repair their home.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort N. is thirty-five years old. She is married with five children, two males and three females. All of her children are in the junior high and the basic schools. Comfort’s husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 
 
Comfort prepares and sells Fante kenkey. It is produced from corn dough. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages and sells the kenkey in the local market square. She distributes mostly to retailers. Comfort has been in this business for five years. She wants a loan to procure maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
MARÍA ROSARIO A. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz. C Lt. 9 AA.HH. Cesar Vallejo del Distrito de Callaría, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 1 hija, y es madre soltera.

Ella tiene 6 años en Manuela Ramos y su primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, al inicio los utilizo en la compra de golosinas y bebidas, que los ofrece en su casa, aunque tuvo algunos inconvenientes ha logrado seguir con su pequeño negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500. Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc. Cuyas compra le permitirá  establecer una bodega que tenga todo lo necesario para atender a sus vecinos, y ellos encuentren todo lo necesario.

Se encuentra llena de optimismo y está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por los prestamos que le has confiado, por eso no va a fallar en sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
MARÍA ROSARIO A. G. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives on Jr. Cesar Vallejo of the district of Callaría. She's a 55-year old single mother of 1 daughter.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for 6 years and when she received her first loan of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she invested in candy and drinks, which she began selling in her home. Although she's had a few inconveniences, she has been able to continue with her little business.

With this loan of 2,500 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she plans on buying rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. This will enable her to establish a store that has everything necessary to serve her neighbors and allow them to find everything they need.

Maria is full of optimism and is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for confiding in her and offering her loans; that's why Maria will come through with punctual repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Kodjovi Edem

texts.fr: Monsieur S. Kodjovi Edem est un célibataire  qui habite le quartier de KAGOME au centre de la ville de lomé. Il n’a pas poussé loin des ses études il se débrouillait dans la vie mais en 2006 il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées, ce qui a très bien marché pour lui jusqu’à ce jour. Il a gagné la confiance de ses clients par la qualité de ses prestations. Il s’approvisionne au port autonome de lomé. son stock de pièces détachées  reste insuffisant pour couvrir la demande de sa clientèle , il sollicite auprès de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de 1 moteur EPL  6 pain d’amortisseur et  1 train arrière 306
texts.en:
Mr. S. Kodjovi Edem is an unmarried man who lives in the KAGOME district in central Lomé. He hasn’t advanced far beyond his schooling, as he was getting by okay in life. In 2006, he got started in the spare parts business, which did very well for him until now. He earned the trust of his customers through the quality of his service. He gets his supplies at the autonomous port of Lomé. His stock of spare parts is still insufficient for meeting the demands of his customers. He’s requesting his first loan from WAGES for buying one EPL motor, six shock absorbers, and one 306 rear axle assembly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
BERTHA RAMÍREZ RAMÍREZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, y su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la Av. Yarinacocha N° 2500 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 49 años de edad, sin carga familiar, con 03 años de socia en Manuela Ramos. 

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, esto lo invirtió en un restaurant que tenia, y que con el tiempo tuvo que cerrar, hoy ha cambiado de giro y tiene una bodega, el cual está instalado en su propia casa y le permite dedicarse a su familia.

Quiere siempre tener su bodega bien surtida y el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  compra en cantidad de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche bebidas y golosinas en surtida los clientes se sienten contentos y vuelven a comprar con confianza, ya que saben que aquí pueden hallar de todo comentó.
Dice de Manuela Ramos, “Me ayudo bastante a ordenar mi situación económica, ya que deje mi carrera en el magisterio para dedicarme a mi familia y me siento feliz por esa decisión”.
texts.en:
Bertha R. R. is a member of the Las Rosas Communal Bank and her shop is located at 2500 Yarinacocha Ave, in the Yarinacocha district. She is 49 years old, unmarried, and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan was of 300 Soles, which she invested into a restaurant she owned at the time. She eventually closed down the restaurant however, and has changed careers. Now she runs a small shop out of her home, something that allows her to dedicate time to her family. She always wants to keep her shop well stocked, and she will invest this new loan of 1,000 Soles into buying a good amount of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, milk, drinks, and candy. When a store is well stocked, its clients are happy and confidently return to the store, knowing that they'll always find everything they need. Of working with Manuela Ramos, Bertha says "They have been very supportive, and helped me to improve my financial situation ever since I left my job as a teacher to dedicate myself to my family. I am very happy with the decision I made"

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, milk, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
CARMEN ROSA M. SANTAMARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con su negocio ubicado en el Jr. Zavala N° 600, Distrito de Callería tiene 35 años de edad, 04 hijos menores ellos, su esposo traba en la agricultura.

Consiguió hace 4 años, el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, e implemento su mini restaurant, con el tiempo y la buena atención, así como el buen sabor de sus comidas ha hecho que su restaurant sea bien concurrido, por lo que fue necesario cada vez mayor inversión, y Manuela Ramos siempre la ha apoyado. El préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, y comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar 08 kg., aceite 12 litros, una docena de platos, vasos, una docena de cubiertos, ambientación de su local, ahora tiene mayor trabajo y requiere el apoyo de sus hijo.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, se siente contenta porque las incentiva a salir adelante y colaborar con los ingresos familiares y no estar esperando solo al esposo, sin hacer nada en casa.
texts.en:
CARMEN ROSA M. SANTAMARÍA belongs to the “Las Rosas” (The Roses) Communal Bank, with her business located at Jr. Zavala N° 600, Callería district. She is 35 years old, has 4 young children and her husband works in agriculture. 4 years ago she received her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles, and she opened her mini restaurant. With time and good customer service, as well as the good flavor of her food her restaurant has become popularly frequented. So as her business has grown she has needed a greater loan, and Manuela Ramos has always helped her. The loan for S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles will be used to buy a sack of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, a dozen plates, glasses, a dozen place settings, decorating her locale, now she has greater work and she needs the support of her children. Grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her, she feels content because she is motivated to succeed and help with the family income and not be just waiting for her husband with nothing to do at home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, plates, glasses, place settings, and decorations

loans.name: Las Rosas Y Las Guindas Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank “Las Rosas y las Guindas” is located in the district of Lircay, province of Angaraes in the department of Huancavelica. Angaraes has a population of 51,931 people and is one of the provinces with a lot of potential in agriculture, livestock and mining.

Delfina is married with seven children whose ages range between nine and twenty-five. She has a store that sells groceries, sodas, and cleaning products. Delfina started her business with just a few products and has been able to increase her merchandise with the loans she has received. She constantly travels to L. to visit her two children who are studying there. She asked for a loan of $160 to buy more merchandise for her store. Her dream is to sell products to other stores, so she would like to buy a car to increase her sales, and she wants to be able to pay for her children’s education.

Dominga is married with two sons. She sells cleaning products. Before, she would purchase only a dozen of each product but now she is able to buy large packages with her loan money. Dominga asked for a loan of $320 to buy merchandise for her store. Her dream is to buy her own house.

Ana is married with three children. She sells clothes and some sweets. She was able to expand her clothing line from only children's clothes to clothes for the entire family. Ana asked for a loan of $320 to buy school uniforms. Her dream is to have a boutique and to buy a house.

loans.use: For its 14 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso A. tiene 61 años de edad, el reside en la Aldea Caucara, el tiene 40 años de estar casado con la sra Concepcion Alvarado, y tiene una nieta la cual tiene 4 años de edad.
su negocio es la venta de productos de consumo popular y este negocio lo ha sostendo durante 10 años y gracias a su negocio ha podido salir adelante ya que el Huracan Mitch en el año 1998 le destruyo su casa, mas sin embargo ha podido salir adelante a pesar de los duro que fue esa experiencia.
el necesita el presstam para surtir su pulperia ya que quiere tener una mayor variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas.
el sueño de el es poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Celso A. is 61 years old and lives in Aldea Caucara. He is 40 years old, married to Mrs. Concepcion Alvarado, and has a 4 year old grandchild. His business is selling general merchandise and this business has supported him for 10 years. Thanks to this business he has been able to be successful as Hurricane Mitch destroyed his home in 1998, nevertheless he has been able to success in spite of this difficult experience. He needs a loan to stock his store as he wants to have a greater variety of products in order to have greater sales. His dream is to be able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, baked goods, refreshments, tortillas, beans, rice, butter, sugar, margarine, salsa, soup, crackers, soap, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: la señora Pastora es costurera desde hace treinta años, desde muy pequeña aprendió la costura, que ha sido una de sus herramientas para ayudar a su familia, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio laureles sur, con  cuatro hijos de 12,16,18 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es jubilado. Con  el préstamo va a comprar mercadería como ropa, tela para vender y obtener otras entradas de ingreso. Sus planes es poder hacer su casa de concreto y segura ya que su casa es de tabla y sencilla y desea poder dejar a sus hijos en una casa buena y digna. También desea montar un taller de costura
texts.en:
Pastora has been a seamstress for the past 30 years. She learned dress-making when she was very little, and it has been one of the tools she uses to help her family. She is 47 years old and lives in Barrio Laureles Sur, and she lives with her four children aged 12, 16, 18, and 20 years of age. Her husband is retired. With this loan she plans on purchasing merchandise such as clothing and fabric to sell and obtain another source of income. Her plan is to remake her house of out of concrete to be safe and secure - her house is currently made out of wood planks and she wants to be able to give her children a good and dignified home. She also would like to set up a tailor shop.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and fabric.

loans.name: Lila Victoria

texts.es:
LILA VICTORIA B. D. M. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” con domicilio en la prolongación Túpac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16 Km. 6 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 63 años, 03 hijos, y es madre soltera.

Se dedica al negocio D. venta D. ropa a domicilio y también en los poblados cercanos, el primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en la compra D. ropa y las ofreció a sus vecinos con facilidades D. pago, y así consiguió más clientes.

El negocio inicial creció y siempre ha requerido los préstamos, que desD. hace 2 años le facilita Manuela Ramos, con éste préstamo D. S/.1,200. Nuevos Soles, comprará en Lima ropa al por mayor, la misma que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Incluso comprará  un poco D. útiles escolares aprovechando la campaña escolar.
Comenta: “Si no sería la Manuela Ramos, que sería D. nosotros quien nos daría esa facilidad, aparte nos capacita con charlas sobre ventas, y atención al cliente”
texts.en:
LILA VICTORIA B. D. M. belongs to the “Las Rosas” (The Roses) Communal Bank, she lives at Túpac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16 Km. 6, Callería district. She is 63 years old, has 3 children and is a single mother. She sells clothing at home and also in nearby villages. With her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles, and she bought clothing and sold them to her neighbors offering payment plans, and in this way she obtained more customers. The business began to grow and has always required loans. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With this loan for S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy clothing at wholesale in Lima which she will then sell to her customers. She will also buy some school supplies to take advantage of the school season. She says, “If it weren’t for Manuela Ramos, what would become of us, who would give us this capability, in addition to teaching us with seminars about sales and customer service.”

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: Doña Meyling se dedica a la venta  de productos de cosméticos y prendas de oro y plata que deja al crédito a sus clientes, inicio con dinero que presto, y hasta el momento le ha ido bien, algunos clientes que no le pagan y eso hace bajar sus ingresos. Tiene 32 años, reside en anexo villa libertad, con dos niños que estudian la primaria, su esposo trabaja en una aduana. Con este crédito va  a comprar inventario para fortalecer las ventas entre los productos como; plata, ropa, perfumes, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic que da las gracias por hacer posible sus ventas. Sus metas es poder tener una casa propia por que aun viven donde la mama.  También desea establecer una boutique grande es uno des sus anhelo, y poder dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Meyling is a salesperson of cosmetics and silver and gold jewlery, providing on credit sales to her clients. She started out with money she borrowed and until now things have gone very well, although some clients have defaulted on their payments, diminishing her income. She is 32 years old and she lives in Anexo Villa Libertad together with her two children that are in primary school. Her husband works in a customs office. With this loan she will purchase inventory to strengthen her sales, such as: silver, clothing, and perfumes. This is her second loan with Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) and she is grateful for the opportunity to make her business possible. Her goals are to have her own home because she is still living with her mother. She also wishes to establish a large boutique and to provide her children with an education.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and various clothing items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
MERCEDES SÁNCHEZ V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” con domicilio en el Jr. Zavala N° 600 del distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge es actualmente se dedica a conducir un moto taxi.
Ella es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años y el primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con él, se dedico a comprar y vender ropa, pero las cosas no le resultaron como tenia planificadas, así que con el tiempo se dedico al negocio de restaurante.
Este negocio le ha ido mucho mejor por ello con el  préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, ella comprará insumos, en mayor cantidad, además de que también está implementando en el mismo local, una juguería, ya que hay por el sector muchos clientes que reclaman que falta una juguería, por ello, compro una licuadora, vasos y frutas para tal fin.

Se siente contenta con Manuela Ramos, menciona que es un apoyo grande, y que no te pide muchos requisitos para darte el dinero, pero si se tiene que ser responsable.
texts.en:
Mercedes S. V. is a member of the Las Rosas Communal Bank. She lives at 600 Zavala Jr., in the Callería district. She is 35 years old and has 2 children. Her husband currently works as a taxi driver. She has been a client of Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Mercedes used her first loan, of 300 soles, to buy and sell clothing, but the business did not work out as well as she had planned. Eventually, she quit the business and started a restaurant. This business has been going much better and with this new loan, of 1,000 soles, Mercedes will buy ingredients in bulk. Also, she will set up everything she needs to begin selling juices, because many people have complained that no one in the neighbourhood sells any. For this, she will need to buy a juicer, glasses and fruit. Mercedes is happy with Manuela Ramos, grateful for their help, and glad that the only criteria they have for lending to people is that their clients are responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and set up juice sales.

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos L. tiene 39 años de edad, el es residente de la aldea Caucara, el vive en union libre con su compañera de hogar, con la cual ya procreado 2 hijos 1 de 11 y el otro de 5, los dos estan estudiando en primaria y kinder.
los dos salen adelante con su hogar, ella trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y el se dedica a vender botellones de agua purificada, estos los vende en diferentes aldeas y caserios ya que hasta esos lugares no llegan a vender este tipo de producto.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas botellones ya que este producto lo tiene que comprar de contado y los botes son bien caros. 
el desea en un futuro comprar otro carro y asi poder extenderse mas en otros lugares ya que este negocio es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos L. is 39 years old and lives in the village of Caucara. He lives with his significant other, and together they have two children who are 11 and 5 years old. The children are in elementary school and Kindergarten. The couple is able to keep up with their home. She works at a shrimp packing plant, and he sells bottles of purified water. He sells them in several villages and small settlements because no one else offers that type of product in those areas. He needs a loan to buy more bottles of water. He has to buy them with cash and they are very expensive. In the future he wants to buy another vehicle so he can reach more places since this is a very good business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottles of water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 45 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Santa Rosa, con tres hijos de 15,20 y 25 años de edad, todos están estudiando, su negocio es un restaurante con cuarenta años de experiencia, el cual fue herencia de su mama ya que ese ha sido y es su fuete de su subsistencia, con este solicitud es  su tercer ciclo el cual va a comprar granos básicos y carnes, pollo verduras y otros alimentos para preparar los ricos platillos. Uno de sus planes es poder cambiar varios artefactos ha modernos, mejorar su infraestructura para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Dar estudio a sus hijos, y poder cambiar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and she lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Santa Rosa. She lives with her three children, aged 15, 20 and 25 years, all of whom are students. She owns a restaurant which she has been running for the past 40 years - it was left as an inheritance from her mother that has now passed, and it is the source of her livelihood. This is her third loan and she will purchase basic grains and meats, chicken, vegentables and other foods to perpare her delicious recipes. On of the plans is to upgrade various items to be more modern, and to renovate the building to provide a better quality of service to her clients. She wishes to provide her children with an education and to be able to buy a new car.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meats, chicken, and other food products to prepare her delicious recipes.

loans.name: Yaovi William

texts.fr: Monsieur Yaovi william est un résident du quartier de didjolé à lomé, informaticien de formation, ce monsieur n’a pas pu trouvé un boulot convenable raison pour laquelle il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé « MDI Informatique ». Dans sa boutique il fait du traitement de texte, la vente de matériel informatique et bureautique, il souhaite crée un cyber et faire d’autres activités telles que la gravure. Il s’approvisionne dans une grande boutique de vente de matériaux informatique appelée « SOPTIMEX ». Il demande à WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 2ordinateurs, une imprimante, 06 graveurs de CD et 02 cartons de CD. Etant marié, il n’a pas encore eu d’enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi William A. is married, without children, and lives in the Didjolé neighborhood in Lomé. He's a trained computer specialist, and since he couldn't find a suitable job, he opened a shop called "MDI Informatique". In his shop, he does word processing and sells computers and accessories, as well as office supplies. He would like to open a cybercafé and also start an engraving business. He gets his supplies from a large computer store called SOPTIMEX. He's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner WAGES to purchase two computers, one printer, six CD burners, and two boxes of CDs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 computers, one printer, 6 CD burners and 2 boxes of CDs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO SAJAMÍ SANTAMARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” con domicilio en la Av. Yarinacocha N° 1090 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 30 años, 04 hijos pequeños, y su cónyuge trabaja en la municipalidad.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inicio junto con su hermana un restaurant, que al principio estuvo muy bien, pero después dejo de funcionar y se retiro del negocio.

Hoy se dedica a arrendar habitaciones y es por eso que el préstamo que es de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la refacción  de unos cuartos y dándole el acabado así como la seguridad para alquilarlos, por lo que está invirtiendo en compra de listones, tablas, puertas, clavos y todo lo necesario para que los cuartos sean habitable y confortables.

Muy agradecida comenta que Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que ayuda a las mujeres a crear y mantener una mini empresa, siempre que sean buenas pagadoras.
texts.en:
ROSARIO SAJAMÍ SANTAMARÍA is a member of the “Las Rosas” Community Bank located at Av. Yarinacocha, no. 1090, in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 30 years old, and has 4 small children. Her husband works for the municipality. Her first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used to start a restaurant with her sister. Initially things went well, but it eventually stopped working, and she closed the business. She now rents rooms; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles to invest in remodeling and putting the finishing touches on several rooms, as well as making them secure, in order to rent them out. She is investing in purchases of batten trim, paneling, doors, nails, and everything else to ensure that the rooms are habitable and comfortable. In expressing her immense gratitude, she comments that Manuela Ramos is an NGO that helps women start and maintain micro-businesses on the condition they faithfully repay their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of rooms. Purchase of batten trim, paneling, doors, nails - everything  to ensure that the rooms are comfortable.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La señora Ángela es una mujer trabajadora que ha trabajo desde muy joven para apoyar a sus hijos a que no le falte nada. Tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles norte en la ciudad de Managua, con cuatro hijos  mayores que se apoyan entre si. Doña Ángela se desempeña como conserje, es viuda lo cual se le hace mas difícil la carga de su familia, con este crédito  va  invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina ya que su casa es pequeña y cocina en la sala, lo cual se le hace un poco incomodo y desea poder gozar de su trabajo las mejoras, este es su cuarto ciclo y da gracias Afodenic por hacer realidad sus metas.
texts.en:
Ángela is a hardworking woman who has worked since she was very young to support her children so that they don't miss out on anything. She is 48 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua with her four grown children who support one another. Ángela works as a concierge. She is a widow, which has made taking care of her family more difficult. She will invest this loan in infrastructure for the construction of her kitchen. Her house is small and her kitchen is currently in the living room, which is very uncomfortable, and she would like to enjoy her home improvements. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she gives thanks to Afodenic for making her goals reality.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: El señor Bolívar  tiene 44 años de edad, residen en el barrio Laureles norte en la ciudad de Managua su esposa  le tiene tres hijos de 8,12 14 años de edad, los tres estudian,  don Bolívar  trabaja en mantenimiento y su deseo es poder mejorar su casa ya que es de tabla y tiene unas parte rota lo cual desea mejorar para seguridad de su familia. Con este crédito va invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en la parte de enfrente lo cual va hacer de mucho beneficio para su familia por la seguridad.  A futuro es poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Bolívar is 44 years old. He resides in the neighborhood Laureles, north of the city of Managua. He and his wife had three children together that are 8,12 and 14 years old. They all go to school. Mr. Bolivar works to support his family and wishes to make improvements to his home because it is made of wood and some of the pieces of the wood are broken. He wants to replace them so that his family will be protected. With this loan he is going to invest the money in building a wall in front of his house. It will benefit his family by protecting them. His future plans are to help his children by paying the their schooling and make more improvements to their home.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the materials to build a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose M. tiene 53 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Brenda Carolina con la cual han procread 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en el colegio de San Lorenzo.
don Saul se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de agua purificada en botellones, el tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el se desplaza en su carro por los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, su compañera de trabajo tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion y con estos dos negocios ellos salen adelante con sus hijos y su hogar.
el necesita el prestamo para ampliar su negocio y desea comprar varia mercaderia al contado y no al credito,
su meta es cambiar su carro por uno mas grande y asi poder montarle mas producto y poder visitar mas lugares.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Saul M. is 53 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and they have three children. Two of them are students at the San Lorenzo School.

Mr M. has had a business buying and selling bottled water for six years. He delivers the water through out the neighborhoods and surrounding areas of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. His wife has a grocery store at the house and these two businesses provide for the family.

Jose Saul needs the loan to enlarge his business and to be able to pay cash for the supplies instead of paying with credit.

His goal is to buy a larger vehicle to be able to carry more water bottles and to sell them throughout more areas.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottled water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Lucia Isabel Gómez M. tiene la edad de 37 años habita en Las Pilas Oriental ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja como agricultor , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , uno de 14 años que estudia , de 8 años estudia su primaria y uno de 5 años que estudia actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es darle siempre educación y darle una mejor condición de vida , doña lucia desde hace doce años trabaja como agricultora , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio las actividades agrícolas con el apoyo de su esposo y el esfuerzo de ella misma , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivo es reforestar y darle manteamiento a todo los cultivos por igual , el financiamiento lo requiere para la establecer una manzana de plátano y yuca. Lo cual va a comprar los insumos necesarios para poder seguir adelante y poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia Isabel Gómez M. is 37 years old. She lives in Las Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who is a farmer. Their 3 children, who are 14, 8, and five, attend school. The plans for the children are to always give them an education and give them better life conditions. Lucia has worked as a farmer for the past twelve years. The biggest problem she now has is the lack of financing. She started her agricultural activities with the support of her husband and her own effort. The future plans for her farm are for the reforestation and maintenance of all of her crops. The loan is needed to set up a field of bananas and yucca. She will buy the necessary supplies to be able to get ahead and be able to produce more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and banana sprouts to plant

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria A. tiene 45 años de edad, ella reside en la colonia morazan desde hace 10 años y esta casada con el Sr. Jose Nuñez, con el cual han tenido 3 hijos delos cuales uno esta en el colegio. su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el tiene un negocio de venta de agua no purificada (agua para servicios y lavar ropa) el la vende en varias comunidades en donde no tienen agua potable. 
la Sra. A. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella tiene 11 años de realizar esta actividad, y ha logrado sacar adelente a sus hijos, ella necesita el credito para mejorar su vivienda y asi poder tener mejores condiciones de vida.
su deseo es poder arreglar bien toda su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria A. is 45 years of age. She has resided in Colonia Morazan for the last 10 years and is married to Mr. Jose Nuñez. Together they have had 3 children, of whom one is in high school. Her husband helps her with the expenses of the home as he has a business selling unpurified water (for services and to wash clothing). He sells water in different communities that do not have potable water. Mrs. A. has worked for 11 years making and selling tortillas. She has been able to help her children get ahead, and she needs the loan to improve her home to better their living conditions. Her desire is to be able to fix up her whole house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Brunilda del carmen, tiene la edad de 63 años habita en las pilas Oriental ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ello tiene 10 hijos  todos están casados y le apoyan con los gastos de la casa , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las vivienda , doña Brunilda tiene 40 años trabajando como en agricultura el rubro que ella maneja son los granos básicos  y establecimiento de plátano , ella inicio con el apoyo de su esposo , los planes futuros para sus tierras es diversificar . Ella con el financiamiento va a compra fertilizantes, material vegetativo para obtener un resultado de calidad en cuanto al cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brunilda del Carmen is 63 years old and lives in Las Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. Her husband works and helps her with the expenses of the home. She has 10 children, all of whom are married and help support the home. Her plans are to improve her living quarters. Mrs. Brunilda has worked for 40 years as a farmer of basic grains and plantains. She began with her husband's help. She plans to diversify her land in the future. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and plant supplies to obtain higher quality crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertlizer and supplies to improve crops

loans.name: Angela Dominga

texts.es: La señora Ángela Dominga B. tiene la edad de 43 años habita en Las pilas Oriental ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como administrador de un pozo de agua potable para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos uno de ellos trabaja y estudia los otros tres solo estudian y le apoyan con el trabajo agrícola en sus tiempos libres, dona Ángela desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultora el rubro que ella trabaja es el plátano , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , inicio estas labores con ayuda de su papá , los planes hacia su familia y su producción es mejorar para poder tener mejores ingreso . Ella con el financiamiento  va a comprar material vegetativo e insumos para lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela Dominga B. is 43 years old and lives in Las Pilas Oriental, located in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who runs a well of drinkable water to be able to help with the expenses of the home. They have four children under their care; one of whom studies and works, and the other three just study. They all help with the agricultural work in their free time. Mrs. Ángela has worked for 25 years farming plantains. The hardest part of her job is the lack of money. She began working with her dad's help. Her plan for her family and for her work is to be able to have higher earnings. With the loan she will buy plant materials and supplies to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizer to improve crops

loans.name: Marlen Argelia

texts.es: la joven Marlen R. tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer los trabajos de la casa y luego abre su negocio a las 6am para atender a sus clientes, ella vive con la mama y tiene un niño de dos años, a ella le ha tocado criar sola a su hijo ya que su esposo tuvo que emigrar a los Estados Unidos para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, pero como que no ha sido posible que el les ayude. ella trabaja hace mas de 4 años en su pulperia. los sabados y domingos estudia en la Universidad, ella esta estuando una licenciatura en pedagogia. ella vive a 10 kilimetros de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Young Marlen R. has a small grocery store in her home. She gets up at 5:00 am to do housework and later opens her business at 6:00 am to attend to her customers. She lives with her mom and has a 2 year old son. She has the responsibility of raising her son alone since her husband had to emigrate to the United States to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life. But as it has not been possible for him to help them, she has worked for more than 4 years in her grocery store. On Saturdays and Sundays she studies at the University. She is studying for a teaching degree. She lives 10 kilometers from the city.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, coffee, churros, eggs, lard, bleach, soap, sauces, bread, soft drinks, cookies, milk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken, dairy products, eggs, soft drinks, tortillas

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es contadora y trabaja en una empresa de consultaría.
Es soltera y les ayuda a sus hermanos solventando sus estudios y alimentación ya que sus padres no se encuentran con ello.
Vive en la zona de Villa Pampahasi de la Ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus tíos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de educación ( pago de cursos en una universidad para que pueda optar con el programa de licenciatura en contaduría pública)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que mejoraran sus condiciones laborales.
texts.en:
Carmen is an accountant and works in a consulting business.

She is single and helps her brothers pay for their studies and food since her parents are no longer with them.

She lives in Villa Pampahasi in the city of La Paz in her uncle’s home.

This loan will be used as capital for education (to pay for university courses so she can apply to a degree program in public accounting).

This is the second time she has requested a loan from Impro, and the second time that she has needed Kiva’s support. With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve her conditions in life by improving her working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for education

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. libros, es mujer sola y sus hijos le ayudan para poder solventar los gastos D. alimentación ya que el negocio D. libros es en pequeña escala y no cuenta con mucho capital
Vive en la zona D. pasankeri D. la Ciudad D. La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital D. trabajo ( compra D. libros, Colegiales, cuentos, D. historia y otros)
Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago D. su deuda.
texts.en:
Maria works in the purchase and sale of books. She is a single woman. Her children help her pay the cost of food since the book business is still small-scale and doesn’t profit much.

She lives in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz in her own home.

The loan will be used for working capital (the purchase of books, schoolbooks, storybooks, history books, and others).

This is the ninth time she has requested a loan with Impro. Her history qualifies her as a #1 customer, which is to say that she can be relied on for paying back her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School, Newton Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School, Newton, Waterloo.  It was built by the Ahmadiyya Mission in 1977 to spread education and the Ahmadiyya faith to the children of the district. It has a total of nineteen staff and 689 pupils. It is a co-educational school. Until last academic year, the school had only Junior Secondary School I – III (JSS I – III). Now, it has been elevated to a Senior Secondary School with only class IV (Senior Secondary School I) for a start.

Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School makes good grades every academic year at the Basic Education Certificate Examination (BECE). Before its elevation to a senior secondary school, the school has been able to send many pupils to senior secondary schools every academic year. 

However, regardless of their good performance at the BECE, Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary school faces some major challenges – it lacks a library, a laboratory and a meeting hall. 

Since teachers usually receive very meager salaries, many of them find alternate ways of making a living. Some engage in businesses or agriculture, and others have organized extra classes for the pupils (though this is a practice the government is trying to abolish). Teachers are seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects and then, out of their salaries, they will gradually repay the loan.

Alusine H. S. (second row third from right) is the principal of this school. He is fifty-eight years old. He was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, and is married with eleven children who attend the Junior Secondary School. He has been a principal of this school for over fifteen years.  Alusine will use this loan to buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron, zincs and steel windows. He told me that this will create a very big impact in his life.

loans.use: Invest the loan in a house building project

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cira Cecilia Vda. D. A. tiene 61 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales apoyan económicamente a la empresaria.
Cira Sánchez se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en una tienda comercial ubicada en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió en la compra productos para forma sus pequeña tienda, inicio con cosas pequeñas pero con el apoyo del crédito empezó a comprar sus productos al por mayor y así poder vender mas.
Con el crédito D. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. abarrotes al por mayor así como andamios, pizarra, balanza en otras cosas que requiere su negocio.
Edelmira tiene como un sueño, poner una gran tienda surtida D. abarrotes  y crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Cira Cecilia Vda. D. A. is 61 years old and lives in the Moche district, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. Although she did not finish her studies, she is a business woman with 4 children who depend upon her. She dedicates herself to selling groceries from a shop built into her home. With her first loan from the Santa Lucia II Communal Bank, of 300 soles, she bought small quantities of the products she sells in her store. Bit by bit, and with the help of such loans, she has been able to buy her products in larger and larger quantities and sell more of them. She will also invest this next loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, into her business. She will buy groceries to stock up her store, but will also buy scales, display boards and construction materials to improve the store itself. Cira Cecilia dreams of expanding her store and of growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock and construction materials.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea Sánchez S. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
 Andrea se dedica a la siembra de maíz y  camote  ella es propietaria de unos terrenos por el cual siempre ha estado en el negocio de la siembra, señala que suele presentarse complicaciones como plagas, los cuales afectaron levemente su producto su producto, a pesar de ello supo manejar el problema informándose como contrarrestar las plagas y hoy continúa con su negocio y el incremento de sus ingresos con el Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en su primer negocio, el cual fue la siembra de maíz.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 mese, lo invertirá en siembra de camote y la compra de una máquina y la hoja de camote (semilla).
Andrea tiene como sueño aumentar su producción, en la siembra de maíz y camote; establecer una tienda de abarrotes e ir amueblando su casa.
texts.en:
Andrea Sánchez S. is 48 years old and lives in the Moche District, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of Libertad in Peru.

She graduated from high school and has 3 children who depend on her financially.

Andrea owns land on which she cultivates corn and sweet potato. There are always complications like infestations which have affected her product in the past. Despite this, she overcame it by informing herself on how to counteract such things and today she continues with her business.

With the increase in income with the Communal Bank "Luis Sánchez II", she invested it in her first business which was growing corn.

With the loan of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest it in cultivating sweet potato; she'll buy sweet potato seed and equipment.

Andrea's dream is to increase corn and sweet potato production, open a grocery store and start furnishing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweet potato seed and equipment.

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
La señora Ángela Presciliana B. B. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta el 3° de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. 
Ángela B. se dedica a la venta de menú, tiene un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio destinado a la venta de su negocio, al inicio tenía pocos comensales, por lo que decidió salir a ofrecer su menú a diversas establecimientos que se encuentran alrededor de su negocio, empezando a trabajar con pedidos, actualmente vende su menú en su negocio y a domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de accesorios de cocina, arreglos de sillas entre otros y compra de víveres.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres y neceseres de cocina, para su negocio.
Angela tiene como sueño, alquilar un local para ampliar su negocio y seguir cocinando, también para compromisos.
texts.en:
Ángela Presciliana B. B. is 49 years old, lives in the Moche District, Trujillo province in the Libertad Department, Peru. She didn't finish high school and has 4 children who depend on her financially.

Angela is in the food business and sells meals. She has a space in her house from which she runs her business. At first she had few customers, so she went out to the businesses around hers, looking for customers and she began taking their orders. Currently, she sells her meals at her business and delivers.

With the first loan of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.) that she received from the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, she bought kitchen accessories, fixed chairs and bought food.

With this loan of 600 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she'll invest in groceries and kitchen necessities for her business.

Angela's dream is to rent a place to expand her business and continue cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and kitchen necessities.

loans.name: R.e.c Primary School, Bassa Town Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.E.C. Primary School, Bassa Town Group. R.E.C. Primary School Bassa Town was founded in 1945 by the Rural Council to give education to the children of Waterloo. R.E.C. Bassa Town is divided into Lower Primary School (Classes I – III) and Upper Primary School (Classes IV – V). The Lower and Upper schools have a total number of 731 pupils and a total number of twelve staff. R.E.C. Primary school is proud that their pupils are able to make good grades at the National Primary School Exams (NPSE).

Over the years, the school has grown so much that it now lacks adequate classrooms. Staffing is also a problem facing the school. It lacks enough trained and qualified teachers to meet the growing number of pupils.

This will be the first loan for teachers of the B.E.C. Primary School from SMT/Kiva. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, especially for people in the teaching profession, they could not use their salaries to buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use it to begin or continue building a house, others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use it to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. Still others will use it to buy furniture.

Irene M. C. (back row third from left) is the head teacher of R.E.C. Lower Primary School. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles (thirty-two km) from Freetown. She is fifty years old and married with four children. Two of her children are grown, one is in college and the other is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III). She has been a head teacher of this school for over five years. Irene will invest this loan in her business. It will enable her to expand her business. She sells cigarettes, sugar, soft drinks, rice and so on. With the loan, she will be able to buy these items in wholesale.

loans.use: To supplement their salaries

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Sánchez A. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria estudio su secundaria completa, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos dependen económicamente de ella.
Edelmira Sánchez se dedica a la venta de menú los cuales son repartidos en la curtiembre “Los Líderes”, así como entre sus familiares y vecinos, prepara únicamente pedidos, la preparación de los alimentos los realiza en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 85 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus alimentos.
Con el crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para los extender la cobertura de su negocio.
Edelmira tiene como un sueño, poner su restaurante o una juguería.
texts.en:
Edelmira Sánchez A. is 51 years old and lives in the Moche District in the province of Trujillo, in the department of Libertad, Peru. She finished high school and has 6 children, two still depend on her financially.

Edelmira sells meals which are delivered to the tannery "Los Líderes”, as well, as to friends and neighbors. She only offers take out orders and prepares them in her house.

With her first loan of 85 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD) that she received from the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, she invested in supplies for the preparation of meals.

With the loan of 500 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she'll invest it in supplies in order to reach a wider customer base.

Edelmira dreams of implementing a restaurant or a toy store.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow her business

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Elizabeth Y. B.  tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella actualmente cursa el 3er ciclo de una carrera técnica.
Lourdes, se dedica a básicamente a sus estudios, establece una asociación con su pareja el cual se dedica a ser moto taxista.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de piezas para la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (moto taxi) .
Con el crédito de 600 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra del motor y pago de las cuotas del alquiler / venta del moto taxi.
Lourdes tiene como sueño, concluir sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Lourdes Elizabeth Y. B. is 20 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad. She is currently in her third level of coursework towards a technical career. Although Lourdes is primarily a student, she has also established a partnership with her husband, who drives a motorized rickshaw.

Lourdes is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank, and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in the purchase of parts to repair her rickshaw. The current loan (for 600 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) will be used to purchase a motor and to cover the lease payments on the rickshaw.

Lourdes's dream is to complete her higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor and to cover lease payments on her rickshaw

loans.name: Raphael Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the St. Raphael Primary School. It was established in 1923 by the Catholic Mission to spread education and religious doctrine. The school has a total number of 570 pupils and a staff of thirteen teachers. The school produces good results at the National Primary School Exams (NPSE). They also organize sports and thanks giving every academic year for the pupils.

Some of the major challenges facing this school are the late receipt of school fee subsidies from the government, the belated arrival of the teaching materials and the inadequate seating accommodations for the pupils.

Teachers and other professional workers come to SMT to seek loans for different reasons. Since salaries are usually very small, they are prompted to engage in businesses to supplement their meager salaries. Some cannot run a business for themselves directly; rather, they will invest whatever little they have into their wives’ businesses. Others seek a loan in order to pursue further studies or to pay school fees for their children. There will also be some who will want a loan to buy pieces of furniture like chairs or a bed, and some will want to either start building a house or continue with a house building project they have already begun. It is for some of these reasons that teachers at St. Raphael have come to SMT to seek a loan. 

Sylvanus A. K. (left) is the head of this group. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty years. He was born in Waterloo, twenty miles (32 km) from Freetown. He is fifty years old and married to a businesswoman. They have seven children between the ages of seven and twenty-one. With this loan, Mr. K. will buy house-building materials such as doors and windows. He has already started building the house and only the doors and windows are lacking for the completion of the house. This loan will certainly enable Mr. K. to achieve his dream of completing his house.

loans.use: To supplement their salaries

loans.name: Marian Danixa

texts.es:
La señora Marian Danixa B. P., tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 5 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. 
Marian se dedica a la venta de pollo, cuando inicio con los créditos también se dedica a la venta de pollo pero en menor cantidad,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de Omnlife, el cual le ha permitido obtener buenos ingresos.
 Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una balanza y una vitrina útiles para el negocio.
Marian Blás tiene como sueño, brindarles bienes a sus hijos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marian Danixa B. P. is 39 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed her primary school education and has five children who are financially dependent on her.

Marian's business is selling chicken, and the funding she has received has enabled her to do so in greater quantities. Her business is located in her home.

She is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in the purchase of Omnilife products, which resulted in good earnings. She will use the money from this loan (for 800 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) to purchase a scale and a display case for her business.

Marian's dream is to be able to provide things for her children and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a scale and a display case.

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió su secundaria completa, de estado civil soltera.
Nelly Sánchez se dedica al negocio de la Artesanía, tenemos así la cuenta de peluches chocotejas y todo tipo de regalo.
A encontrado una buena inversión en el negocio especialmente en los productos a base de chocolate, producción que ella misma los prepara, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invito en la compra de ingredientes para iniciar con el negocio de las chocotejas, así mismo en marcianos y chupetines.
Con el crédito de 700 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para peluches y continuar con la venta de artesanía.
Nelly tiene como uno de sus sueños crecer como empresario tiene un local propio para su negocio e independizarse y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school and is single.

Nelly's business is selling crafts, including stuffed animals, artisanal chocolates, and all types of gifts. She has found her business to be a good investment, especially her homemade chocolate products. Her business is located in her home.

She is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in ingredients to make chocolates and lollipops. She will use the money from this loan (for 700 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) to purchase materials to make stuffed animals and to continue her business selling crafts.

Nelly's dream is to grow as a businessperson, have her own shop, be financially independent, and be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for stuffed animals and to continue selling crafts

loans.name: Lorenzo Govie Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Lerenzo Govie Secondary School. This school was named after its founder, Lorenzo Govie, in 1974. It is a junior secondary school with classes JSS I – III. It has a staff of twenty-five and over 400 pupils.   

Lorenzo Govie school gets good grades at external exams (Basic Education Certificate Examination – BECE). However, Lorenzo Govie faces some major challenges like inadequate seating accommodation, lack of a library and a science laboratory.

Teachers and other professional workers in SMT’s operational areas do come to SMT to seek a loan for various reasons. Since salaries are generally small for workers in the country and especially so for teachers, some teachers use the loan to start a small business in order to complement their salaries and those who are already running small businesses invest their loans into their business. Some teachers use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others use their loans in home building projects.  

Thirty-five year old Ansalen A. M. (right) is a teacher of this school.  He was born in Pendembu, Kailahun district, southern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the two of them have five children who are between classes five to Junior Secondary School I (JSS I). Both Ansalen and Rev. Dommic Ado-Kangaig will use their loans to pay college fees for themselves.  This loan will bring great happiness to these teachers as it will enable them to pursue further studies in University.

loans.use: To pay college fees for themselves.

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Esther Fernández Sánchez tiene  26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 1 hijo el cual los depende económicamente de ella.
Patricia se dedica actualmente a la venta de útiles escolares, anteriormente vendía productos de belleza, y por motivos de campaña escolar invirtió en la venta de útiles, en el cual esta obteniendo buenos resultados, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa. Cabe resaltar que la empresaria solo trabaja en base a pedidos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en materiales para iniciar su negocio de manualidades y tejidos.
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio, es decir surtir sus productos para aumentar sus ventas.
Patricia tiene el gran sueño de poner una tienda para la venta de bisutería.
texts.en:
Patricia Esther F. S. is 26 years old, living in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, department of Liberty. She completed high school, and she has one son, who is her economic dependent. Patricia now sells school supplies. Before, she sold beauty products, but because of school campaigns, she switched to selling the supplies, which has had good results. Her business is run out of Patricia's home. It is fitting to note that the businesswoman only works on a by-order basis. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the Luis Alberto S. II Communal Bank, Patricia invested in materials for starting her handicrafts and fabric business. With this loan of 400 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will set up her business. That is to say, she will stock up on inventory to increase her sales. Patricia's main goal is to set up a store for selling costume jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para implementar su negocio,surtir sus productos para el aumneto de sus ventas.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Santillán Sánchez tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de chocolates, lo vende en su domicilio y en la curtiembre en donde labora su papa, además su producto es ofrecido en diversas tiendas del distrito, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de chocotejas, estas eran ofrecidas por cajas.
Con el crédito de 100 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio así como en materiales e ingredientes para las chocotejas.
Sandra tiene el gran sueño de poner una tienda para la venta de abarrotes y chocotejas, al interior de su distrito.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra Santillán Sánchez is 25 and lives in the district of Moche, the province of Trujillo, and the department of La Libertad. She studied through high school, and has 2 children who depend on her economically. Sandra sells chocolates in her home and in the tannery where her father works. Her product is also offered in various stores in the district, and she develops her business in her home. She received her first credit of 300 soles from the communal bank, "Luis Alberto Sánchez II" and invested it in ingredients to make chocolates, which she offers in boxes. With this credit of 100 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in implementing her business with materials and ingredients to make chocolates. Sandra has the big dream of starting a store to sell groceries and chocolates in the interior of her district.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement her business with materials and ingredients to make chocolates

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El joven Norlan tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, el se desempeña como cadete de taxi desde hace  cuatro años, recorre día a día en la ciudad para abordar a clientes. El es soltero y sus deseos es poder mejorar su casa. Con unos ahorros le compro el taxi a su hermano y ahora ve las ganancias. Con esta solicitud de crédito desea reparar la dirección y la caja del carro para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es poder comprar otra unidad de taxi, poder tener una casa propia para cuando tenga su familia.
texts.en:
Young Norlan is 28 years old. He lives in Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. He has worked as a taxi driver for four years. He travels the city day after day to serve his customers. He is single and his wishes are to improve his home. With some savings, he bought a taxi for his brother and now sees the profits. With this loan he hopes to repair the steering and car battery to give good service to his customers. His plans for the future are to buy another taxi unit and be able to have his own home for when he has a family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car battery and repair the steering in his taxi

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos Sánchez D. V. tiene 49 años D. edad, vive en vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos, pero actualmente solo vive con su nieto quien depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Santos se dedica a la venta D. menú trabaja solamente con pedidos, los cuales son llevados a domicilio; cuando empezó su negocio solo repartirá menú entre la familia pero ahora ya tiene más comensales porque el alimento y un buen servicio; su negocio es preparado en su casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la venta D. menú, pues con el crédito D. 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo seguirá invirtiéndolo en la venta D. menú y en bienes como sillas, cubiertos y vasos.
Santos tiene como sueño hacer un buen capital con la venta D. menú, para poder iniciar con la venta D. ropa y disfrutar D. paseos con su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Sánchez D. V. is 49 and lives in the district of Moche, the province of Trujillo, and the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through high school and has 3 children, but currently she only lives with her grandson, who depends economically on her. Santos sells food and works only by taking orders, which she then delivers to homes. When she started her business she only delivered food among family members, but now she has more customers because of her good food and service. She prepares the food in her home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from the communal bank, "Luis Alberto Sánchez II," she invested in selling her food. With this credit of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will continue to invest in selling her food and in goods such as chairs, silverware, and glasses. Santos has the dream of making good capital by selling her food to be able to start selling clothing and enjoying trips with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods like chairs, silverware, and glasses

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: La señora Alma Nubia tiene la edad de 37 años habita en las pilas Oriental ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo es cual trabaja como albañil para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene  a su cargo cinco hijos todo estudian y los mas grandes le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida para que su hijos no le falte los estudios y sean mujeres y hombres de bien , ella desde hace cinco años trabaja en la agricultura la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio los trabajos agrícolas con sus propios esfuerzos , el financiamiento lo necesita para la compra de material vegetativo, fertilizantes , insumos , preparación de suelo y arado .
texts.en:
Mrs. Alma Nubia, 37, lives in Las Pilas Oriental which is in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who works as a bricklayer to help with the household expenses. They have 5 children who go to school. The older children help with the agricultural work. The plans for the children are to improve their living conditions so they do not stop their studies, and that they become good people. Alma has worked in agriculture for five years. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She started her agricultural work with her own efforts. The loan is needed to buy organic matter, fertilizer, supplies, ground preparation and plowing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, prepare the ground, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Yesenia Lisbel

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia Lisbel Sánchez tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella. 
Yesenia se dedica a la venta de menú, anteriormente empezó con la venta de golosinas en su casa, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas (variedad)
Con el crédito de 100 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y arreglo de los inmuebles del negocio.
Yessenia tiene como sueño inaugurar su restaurante en donde ofrezca variedad de platos típicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia Lisbel S. is 39 years old and lives in the district of Moche in Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed elementary school and has one son who depends on her economically. Yesenia works selling prepared meals. Earlier, she began with the sale of sweets in her house, and developed her business from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank "Luis Alberto S. II", she invested in the purchase of a variety of sweets. With this credit of 100 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of sweets and the improvement of her place of business. It is Yessenia's dream to open her own restaurant where she will sell a variety of local foods.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets and improvements to the place of business.

loans.name: Asuncion Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Carmen Z. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella tiene estudios superiores, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Asunción tienen como negocio la venta de perfumes y un pequeño botiquín (medicamentos), como su casa esta en construcción traslado su negocio a la casa de su suegra, presenta sus productos en una vitrina. Es la empresaria quien se encarga de la venta de sus productos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de perfumes y mostradores.
Con el crédito de 300 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, así como en ropa de bebe y continuar implementando su botiquín.
Asunción tiene como sueño, concluir con la construcción de su vivienda, así mismo alquilar un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Asunción del Carmen Z. is 39-years-old and lives in the Salaverry distrtict of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She has a higher education and 3 children who depend on her financially. Asunción sells perfume and basic medications. Since her house is under construction, she moved her business into her mother-in-law’s house where she sets out her products in a display case. She’s in charge of sales. She invested her first loan of 300 soles, which she received through “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II” Communal Bank, in the purchase of perfume and display cases. She’ll use this loan of 300 soles, which she’ll repay in 4 months, to purchase cosmetics, baby clothing and to stock her mini-pharmacy. Asunción dreams of completing construction on her house and renting a space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, baby clothing and to stock her mini-pharmacy.

loans.name: Amanda Sonia

texts.es:
Amanda es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Amanda es soltera, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Amanda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes. Además Amanda prepara barquillos (galletas) que prepara en su casa y los comercializa ambulantemente.
Amanda necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y menestras.
Amanda sueña con ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amanda is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Lirio.

Amanda is single, 40 years old and has three children. Amanda has a store in her house in which she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meats. Furthermore, Amanda makes barquillos (cookies) that she prepares in her home and sells on the streets.

Amanda needs a loan of 1600 soles ($525 USD), money that will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and menestras (traditional rice and bean dish).

Amanda dreams of growing her business and giving a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and menestras (traditional rice and bean dish)

loans.name: Cristina Santos

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Santos B. D. R. tiene 73 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. la Libertad.
No tiene estudios realizados (analfabeta), tiene 6 hijos cuya situación económica es independiente.
Cristina recién ha ingresado como socia.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal  “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II”, que será cancelada en 4 meses, que será invertido para la compra D. materiales D. escritorio, por campaña escolar en la pequeña tienda en el cual venD. útiles escolares. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Manifiesta que su negocio va generando poco a poco mayores ingresos; así mismo se apoya con los ingresos que percibe su esposo en su condición D. jubilado.
Cristina tiene como sueño ser propietaria D. una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cristina Santos B. D. R. is 73 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department. She never attended school and is illiterate; she has 6 children who are all economically independent. Cristina has recently become a bank member. With the loan of 300 PEN that she received from her Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras D. Salaverry II” [“The Triumphant from Salaverry II”], that will be paid in full in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies; due to the of the upcoming school year she will be selling these supplies in her small school supply shop. Her business is run out of her home.
