Cristina discloses that her business is generating higher profits little by little; in this manner she supports herself with the income that she obtains given that her husband is retired. Cristina’s dream is to be the owner of a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Marilu Norma

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Marilu es soltera, tiene 27 años y es enfermera de profesión, Marilu tiene una botica llamada FARMASOL, en un local alquilado que se ubica al frente de un centro de salud, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 2 personales.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de analgésicos.
Marilu sueña con tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Marilu is single, 27 years old, and is a nurse by profession. Marilu has a pharmacy called FARMASOL in a rented locale that is located in front of the health center; she runs this business with the help of 2 employees. Marilu needs a loan of 1400 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of analgesics. Marilu dreams of having another pharmacy branch.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase analgesics.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Honorata es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Honorata se dedica a la crianza D. animales como gallinas, cerdos, actividad que realiza en su casa, los animales los venD. en los diferentes mercados.
Honorata necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. una computadora.
Los sueños D. Honorata son mejorar su casa e implementar una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of Communal Bank Lirio. Honorata is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. Honorata dedicates herself to raising animals such as chickens and pigs; she carries out this activity at her house, and then sells the animals in different markets. Honorata needs a loan of 1000 PEN, money that will be invested as part of a payment for a computer. Honorata’s dreams are to improve her house, and to open a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As part of a payment for a computer for her children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Isabel es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Isabel viaja a diferentes ferias en donde compra animales que luego beneficia  en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, luego los comercializa por mayor. Isabel además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, y ganado porcino.
Isabel sueña con salir adelante con sus hijos y ahorrar lo suficiente para tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of Lirio ('Iris') community bank. She is 33-years old and married with three children. Isabel travels to different markets where she buys animals to take to the slaugherhouse in Ayacucho city. She then sells the meat wholesale. Isabel also runs a grocery store from her house. Isabel needs a loan of 2,000 PEN that will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, and pigs. Her dream is for her and her children to get ahead in life and save enough money to have their own resources.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and pigs.

loans.name: Ederlinda Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Ederlinda Ysabel G. F. tiene 70 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ederlinda presenta estudios superiores incompletos, tiene 10 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes.
La empresa tiene una panadería pequeña la cual lo administra con apoyo de su hijo con quien vive, su negocio lo desarrolla en casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de  su Banco Comunal “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió  en la compra de harina y moldes para la elaboración de pan.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en su panadería y a la compra de hilos para el tejido y bordados en bisutería.
Ederlinda tiene como sueño que su negocio prospere e invertir sus ganancias en la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Ederlinda Ysabel G. F. is 70 years old and lives in the district of Moche, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. Ederlinda has completed some college studies and has 10 children who are independent. She has a small bakery, which she manages with the help of her son, with whom she lives. The business is in their house. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received through her communal bank, "Santa Lucia II", she invested in the purchase of flour and molds to make bread. With this loan of 300 soles, which she will repay in four months, she will invest in her bakery and purchase thread for weaving and embroidering jewelry. Ederlinda dreams of having a prosperous business and investing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in bakery; purchase thread for weaving and embroidering jewelry

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor de Maria P. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad.
Ella concluyo sus estudios secundarios, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Flor tiene como negocio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, al cual lo surte con mercadería como productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos para surtir su tienda comercial, antes solo vendía abarrotes ahora también lo complementa con la venta de  útiles escolares, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa. 
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo utilizará para comprar abarrotes al por mayor.   
Flor tiene como sueño hacer crecer su negocio con el apoyo de los créditos.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria P. is 41 years old and lives in Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad province. She has a high-school education and three children who depend on her economically. Flor owns a small grocery store, which she stocks with merchandise such as beauty products. With a loan of 300 soles she received through her communal bank, “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, she purchased products to supply her store; whereas before she only sold groceries, now she complements them with school supplies. Her business is located in her home. With this loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy wholesale groceries. Flor hopes to expand her business with the support of these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale groceries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Misuyo, en el distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 58 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, su negocio es la venta D. golosinas y bebidas (galletas, gaseosas, frugos, etc.), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (principalmente gaseosas al por mayor).  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (golosinas, bebidas, galletas, frutas D. diferentes variedades, etc.) para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Desaguadero, en la frontera; ella tiene el anhelo D. tener una tienda granD. donD. pueda colocar sus productos y continuar trabajando para bien D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank, “Corazones Unidos” in the Misuyo neighborhood of Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 58 years old, married, has two children and a fifth-graD. education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for eight years. Her business is the sale of sweets and drinks (cookies, soft drinks, fruit juices, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy merchandise for her business (primarily wholesale soft drinks). Now she needs a new loan for 800 soles, which she is committed to repaying in four monthly payments. With this loan, she wishes to buy more merchandise for her business (sweets, drinks, cookies, different varieties of fruit, etc.) to be able to sell them in the markets of Desaguadero, on the border. She dreams of having a large store where she can sell her products and continue working for the benefit of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, drinks and variety of fruits

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Gregoria es casada, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos, Gregoria se dedica a la venta D. leña, alfalfa, en un puesto que esta ubicado en el mercado Las Nazarenas, además Gregoria venD. jugo D. naranja.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña y alfalfa.
Los sueños D. Gregoria son construir su casa y que sus hijos salgan adelante con una profesión.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of Lirio Communal Bank. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. She sells firewood and alfalfa at a stand in the Las Nazarenas Market. She also sells orange juice. Gregoria needs a loan of 1600 Nuevo Soles to buy firewood and alfalfa. Gregoria’s dreams are to build a home and that her children move ahead in life by obtaining a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood and alfalfa.

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
La señora Juana Nila R. García tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales apoyan económicamente a la empresaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda comercial ubicada en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió en la compra productos para forma sus pequeña tienda, inicio con cosas pequeñas pero con el apoyo del crédito empezó a comprar sus productos al por mayor y así poder vender mas.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor así como andamios, pizarra, balanza en otras cosas que requiere su negocio.
Juana tiene como sueño, incrementar su negocio para que su picantería sea la mas concurrida.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Nila R. G. is 34 years old. She lives in the Moche district in Trujillo Providence in the state of La Libertad, Peru. This small-business woman has some post-secondary studies. She has four children who help her economically. Juana has a grocery store at her house. She utilized the first loan of 300 Nuevo Soles (PEN) from the Santa Lucia II Communal Bank to buy consumer goods for her small store. She initially sold only a few items but with help from the loan started to buy them wholesale in order to be able to sell more. With the 1000 PEN loan, which Juana will repay in six months, she plans to buy wholesale produce (groceries) as well as scaffolds, slate, a scale and other goods needed for her store. Juana’s dream is to improve her business so that her small store will become the best attended.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, scaffolds, slate, a scale and other goods for her store

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Maria se dedica a L. siembra de flores variadas, las cuales los comercializa en diferentes florerías, además viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales que vende en los mercados de L. ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra de insecticidas.
Maria sueña con que su hijo sea profesional e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Maria is married, 37 years old, and has 1 child. Maria dedicates herself to planting assorted flowers, which she sells at different flower shops; she also travels to markets where she purchases grains that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan of 800 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of insecticides. Maria dreams for her son become a professional, and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by MarieL. Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Lidia Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Mariela R. E. tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 1er año de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Lidia tiene como negocio la venta de jugos y comida rápida es apoyada por su madre aun esta empezando con su negocio pero manifiesta que sus ventas van mejorando, su negocio lo realiza en el domicilio de  su mamá.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de frutas necesario para la preparación de jugos así como de otros alimentos para su negocio de comida rápida.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de vasos y la reparación de su licuadora.
Lidia tiene como sueño poner una bodega surtido de abarrotes y continuar con la venta de jugos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia Mariela R. E. is 20 years old. She lives in Salaverry district in Trujillo Providence in the State of La Libertad. She completed school to ninth grade.

Lidia has a child as a dependent. She has a small business, at her mother’s house, selling juice and fast food. Her mother helps and the business is improving.

Lidia bought fruits and other ingredients needed for the foods she prepares with the $100.00 loan received from the Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry Communal Bank. She will buy glasses and repair a blender with the new $100.00 loan, which she will repay in four months.

Lidia’s dream is to set up a small grocery store and to continue selling juice.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glasses and repair a blender.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients, plates and cups for her business

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Martha Elizabeth H. L. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Madre, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Martha es costurera, se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir para damas y niños; manifiesta que a pesar de ser madre soltera se esfuerza en velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, y hacer crecer su negocio para que así obtenga mayores ingresos para el hogar; su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Santa Lucia II”, lo invitó en la compra de materiales de costura y el arreglo de su máquina de coser.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses,  lo invertirá en su negocio, la compra de una vitrina, hijos Y todos lo enseres necesarios para su negocio de costura.
Martha, tiene como sueño comprarse una remalladota industrial, para incrementar su producción y dar una mejor condición de vida  para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth H. L. is 40 years old and she lies in the Madre district of the province of Trujillo, in the department of la Liberdad, Peru. She completed high school and she has two children that depend on her financially. Martha is a seamstress and she works in the making of articles of clothing for women and children; despite being a single mother she strives to ensure the welfare of her children, and has expanded her business in order to obtain better income for her household; her business is located in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received from her Communal Bank called "Santa Lucia II", she invested in the purchase of sewing materials and the repair of her sewing machine. With this loan of 600 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will invest in her business, buying a glass case and other necessary equipment for her sewing business. Martha dreams of buying an industrial sewing machine to increase her production and to improve the quality of life of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business by buying a glass case and other things needed for sewing

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Irma es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Irma tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen Alto en donde vende ropa variada con la ayuda de su hija. Además Irma viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde compra quesos, cereales. Irma tiene proyectado vender calzados.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Irma son mejorar sus negocios y educar a sus 5 hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Irma is married, 37 years old, and has 5 children. Irma has a stall at the Carmen Alto market where she sells a variety of clothing with her daughters’ help. In addition, Irma travels to the different fairs where she buys cheeses, cereals. Irma plans to sell shoes in the future. Irma needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of shoes. Irma’s dreams are to improve her businesses and to educate her 5 children so they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Monica es soltera, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Monica junto a su mama tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, en donde ella realiza trabajos de impresiones, serigrafía en bolsas, papeles, de manera artesanal. Además Monica vende calzados a pedido.
Monica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintas, mallas.
Los sueños de Mónica son mejorar la calidad de producción, ampliar su negocio y brindar todo lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Monica is single, 29 years old, and has one child. Together with her mother, she tends to a store at a rented location where she provides services such as copying, screen- printing onto bags, papers, and handcrafts. In addition, Monica sells footwear on order. Monica needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest into the purchase of dyes, mesh. Monica’s dreams are to improve the quality of her product, to expand her business, and to provide for her daughter’s every need.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of dyes, mesh.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Leonarda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Leonarda se dedica a la venta de comida en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, los días domingos vende comida típica como mondongo y Puca.
Leonarda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la refacción de su casa para trasladar su restaurante.
Leonarda sueña con mejorar su negocio y sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Leonarda is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Leonarda dedicates herself to the sale of food from a rented location, an activity she conducts every day. On Sundays, she sells typical foods such as mondongo (tripe) and Puca (a beef and potato dish). Leonarda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in refurbishing her house so she can move her restaurant there. Leonarda dreams of improving her business, and for her children to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her house and move her restaurant there.

loans.name: Norma Rosa

texts.es:
L. señora Norma R. D. L. R. V. tiene 44 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Perú.
L. empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 1 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. elL..
Norma tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes entre los cuales también venD. gaseosas, golosinas, etc y complementa su negocio con L. elaboración D. tejidos en hilo, manifiesta que sus ganancia poco a poco van aumentando y que se esfuerza por tener surtida su tienda para que D. esa manera pueda generarse mayores ingresos; su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.
L. señora Norma recién forma parte del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, que lo invirtió para comprar productos para formar su pequeña tienda.
L. empresaria pertenece también al taller D. creaciones “MOCHE”, en el cual aprenD. a confeccionar variedades y tejidos, los cuales también hacen que le genere un ingreso mas para su hogar.
Con este primer préstamo D. 300 Nuevos Soles que cancelará en 04 meses ,lo invertirá en L. compra D. golosinas,gaseosas y otros productos para implementar el negocio.
texts.en:
Norma R. D. L. R. V. is 44 years old and lives in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, L. Libertad, Perú. This businesswoman did not complete her studies, and has one son who depends on her financially. Norma has a small grocery store where she sells items such as soft drinks, snacks, etc., and she complements this business with handmaD. embroideries. She states that her earnings are increasing little by little, and she makes a great effort to keep her store well-stocked so she can generate more income; her business is located in her house. Norma recently became part of the “Santa Lucia II” cooperative bank, and she invested in the purchase of products to establish her small store. She also belongs to the “MOCHE” workshop, where she makes handmaD. and knitted items that help her add to the income she generates for the household. With this first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she will cancel in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of snacks, soft drinks, and other products for the business.  

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase snacks, soft drinks, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Cirila es viuda, tiene 62 años y 5 hijos, Cirila tiene un recreo restaurante en el mirador de la ciudad de Ayacucho llamado LA CHOZA DEL MIRADOR, en donde vende comidas típicas y bebidas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 3 personas.
Cirila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Cirila son tener un negocio mas tranquilo y descansar.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Cirila, 62 years old, is a widow and has 5 children. Cirila has a recreational restaurant at a viewpoint in the city of Ayacucho called “LA CHOZA DEL MIRADOR”. Here, she sells traditional foods and beverages with the help of 3 people. Cirila needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of tables and chairs. Cirila’s dreams are to have a steady business and to be able to rest some.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Santos Marivel

texts.es:
La señora Santos Marivel C. García tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos empezó con Manuela Ramos, en la venta de cerveza y así con el capital que se generaba poco a poco fue surtiendo su tienda de abarrotes, el negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para poder competir con los demás negocios ubicados a su alrededor.
Con el crédito de 500 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y abarrotes al por mayor para equipar su negocio.
Santos tiene como sueño, viajar con su familia disfrutar del bienestar de su familia y la prosperidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Marivel C. García is 34 years old and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in La Libertad. She completed her secondary school studies, and has 2 children who depend on her financially. Santos started with Manuela Ramos in the sale of beer; with the capital from this endeavor she slowly was able to supply her grocery store, which she runs out of her home. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, she invested in the purchase of groceries so she could compete with the other businesses around her. With the loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store. Santos’ dreams include traveling with her family, and enjoying the family’s well-being and the prosperity of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Monica Mariela

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Monica es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Monica se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del colegio Virgen del Carmen, también prepara bocaditos que vende ahí mismo, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Monica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas, aceite, sal.
Los sueños de Monica son tener casa propia,
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the Communal Bank Florecer. Monica is 23 years old, lives with her spouse, and has one child. Monica sells candy from a cart every day outside the gates of the Virgen del Carmen school. She also makes snacks that she sells there. Monica needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy candy, oil, and salt. Monica hopes to have her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, oil, and salt

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Nelly es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Nelly se dedica a la venta de golosinas variadas, de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del colegio Condorcanqui. Además Nelly vende salchipollos en una avenida principal de Carmen Alto.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, golosinas.
Los sueños de Nelly son aumentar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Community Bank Florecer. She is married and has two children. Nelly is 30 years old. She sells various candies at an outdoor stand at the entrance to the Condorcanqui school. Additionally, Nelly sells salchipollos (a typical Peruvian chicken dish) on the main street in Carmen Alto. Nelly needs a loan of 1600 Soles to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, and candies. Nelly's dream is to grow her business and to give her children good educations.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and candy

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Santos Sabina P. P.  tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 2do año de educación secundaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos, se dedica al diseño y confección de manualidades  así como a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio ha ido variando inicio haciendo carteras de allí adornos en macramé , los cuales los vende a personas o clientes conocidos, el negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió para adquirir los productos de belleza y materiales para manualidades.
Con el crédito de 800 soles , que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de telas para sus manualidades, así como en útiles para sus hijos.
Santos tiene como sueño, instalar un taller de manualidades y brindarle recreación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Sabina P. P. is 29 years old and lives in the Moche district, in Trujillo province, in the apartment La Libertad. She studied in high school for two years and has two children that are economically dependent on her.

Santos designs and makes handicrafts, as well as sells beauty products. The business has diversified. At first she sold purses adorned with macrame. She sold them to people or established customers. The business was based in her home. With the first loan of 300 Soles from the Communal Bank "Santa Lucia II" she bought beauty products and materials for handicrafts. With this loan for 800 soles, that will be repaid over 6 months, she will buy fabric for her handicrafts, as well as supplies for her children.

Santos dreams of opening a handicraft workshop and allowing her children recreational time.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabric and supplies for her children

loans.name: Susy Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Susy Carolina C. Vásquez tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 2do año de secundaria, tiene 1 hija la cual depende económicamente de ella.
Susy se dedica a la venta de comida (menú), su negocio lo comparte (en asociación) con su suegra, esto desde el mes de Enero del presente año, su negocio lo desarrolla en la casa de sus suegra. 
Con el primer crédito de 200 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios para la cocina.
Con el crédito de 500 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para la preparación de menú y arreglo de su local.
Susy tiene como sueño, administrar su propio negocio, independizarse como empresaria en la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Susy Carolina C. Vásquez is 20 years old. She lives in the Salaverry district, in Trujillo province, in the apartment La Libertad. She studied until the second year of high school and has a daughter that is economically dependent on her. Susy sells food (the special of the day). She has run her business with her mother-in-law since January of this year. The business is based in her mother-in-law's home.

With the first loan of 200 soles that she received from her Bank "Comunal Las Triunfadores de Salaverry II" she bought cooking utensils. With this loan of 500 Soles, that will be repaid over 4 months, she will purchase supplies for preparing her menu and fixing up her location.

Susy dreams of managing her own business and becoming independent as businesswoman selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing food and fixing up her location

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
la Sra. Rosa L. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan Aguilera, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan y le ayudan economicamente. ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de bloques de cemento, ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su mayor sueño es tener una fabrica grande de produccion de bloques y tener muchos empleados para poder ayudarle a la gente con generacion de empleo ya que en esa comunidad es muy escaso el trabajo y cuesta hacer dinero.
su producto lo vende en nacaome y caserios cerca de nacaome.
ella necesita el credito para tener una mayor produccion de bloques ya que ahora esta produciendo muy pocos y las necesidades de sus clientes son muchas.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is 39 years old and married to Mr. Juan Aguilera. They have 4 children, all of whom work and help the family out financially She has worked for 8 years making and selling cement blocks. Her biggest dream is to have a large factory for producing blocks and have many employees to be able to help create jobs since jobs are scarce in her community and it is difficult to make money. She sells her product in Nacaome and Caserios (close to Nacaome). She needs the loan to increase production of blocks as she is now producing little and demand from her customers is high.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
el Sr. Mateo P. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en union libre con la Sra. Brenda Yanez, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
el Sr. Mateo se dedica a la venta de pasto para vacas, y tambien se hace trabajo de transporte de pasto para alimentar vacas, el utiliza su carreta de bueyes para poder transportar el pasto a diferentes potreros en donde se encuentran las vacas, tambien hace traaslado de piedras y arena del rio, y lo lleva donde el cliente lo desee, el necesita el dinero para poder hacer su carreta mas grande ya que el tamaño que tiene es muy pequeño y necesita que sea mas grande para hacer menos viajes y llevar mas material.
su deseo es poder comprar un camion o un pickup para poder transportar lo que los clientes le digan y asi hacer el trabajo mas rapido y poder hacer muchos trabajos en el dia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mateo P. is 36 years old and lives with Mrs. Brenda Yanez in a common law marriage. She works selling sweets. Mr. Mateo sells hay for cows and also works transporting the hay for feeding the cows. He uses an ox cart to transport the hay to different pastures where cows are found. He also transports stones and sand from the river to wherever the customers want it. He needs the loan to make his cart bigger, since it is currently very small and he needs it to be bigger to be able to make fewer trips and carry more items. His desire is to be able to buy a truck or pickup to be able to transport whatever his customers tell him to move and in this way make his job go more quickly and be able to do more work in a day.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hay for livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
el Sr. Jose C. tiene 37 años de edad el tiene unas vacas las cuales ordeña todos los dias y saca una buena cantidad de leche, con la leche que saca hace quesillo y cuajada, el distribuye su producto en varias comunidades ya tambien lo vende en su casa de habitacion, gracias a este negocio ha logrado comprar una motocicleta y con esto el distribuye su producto mas rapido y seguro, ahora el necesita comprar unas pastillas para hacer quesillo y cuajada, tambien necesita comprar unos tarros de hierro para depositar la leche ya que los que tiene no le sjustan para guardar toda la leche que saca en las mañanas.
el tiene 3 hijos que estan en la escuela.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose C. is 37 years old and has three children attending school. He has several cows, which he milks daily and they produce a good amount of milk. He makes cheese and curd and sells them in several communities and at his house. He bought a motorbike with the earnings, and now is able to distribute his products faster and safer. He needs to buy tablets used to make the cheese and curd, as well as to buy big containers to store the milk he gets when milking the cows in the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tablets used to make cheese and curd and large containers to store milk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: La Señora Placida P. M. tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Placida tiene 3 hijos y todos sus hijos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Placida es los servicios de costura. Hace mas de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio Doña Placida inicio con capital propio por lo que poco a poco invirtió en su negocio y hasta los momentos ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Los propósitos de Doña Placida son de invertir lo suficiente para seguir con su negocio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la inversión en materia prima como tela, hilos y otros artículos. Los sueños de Doña Placida son que su negocio obtenga una buena fama por vender productos de calidad. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Placida P. M. is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children work independently. For more than 17 years Placida has worked as a seamstress. She started with her own money, and little by little, she invested in the business. Up until now she has been able to maintain her business. Placida would like to invest enough money to keep running her business. The loan is for working capital. She needs to buy materials like fabric, thread and other things. Placida’s dream is that her business gets a good reputation for selling quality products. She is asking for $625.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Teodora M.  tiene 67 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ya estan grandes y le ayudan economicamente para los gastos del hogar, pero como ella es una persona luchadora tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, calsonetas, trajes de niños, vestidos de niñas y sandalias, ella tiene 41 años de tener este negocio, este negocio es su distraccion diaria ya que no le gusta estar en la casa encerrada sin hacer nada, ella dice que toda su vida va a trabajar y que la unica distraccion es su negocio. 
ella dice que necesita comprar mas mercaderia de otra que no vende en este momento para asi tener mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodora M. is 67 years old, single and has two grown children who help out with household expenses; however, because she is a determined woman, she has her own business selling clothing. She sells slacks, shorts, boys' suits, girls' dresses and sandals. She has had this business for 41 years, and it is the highlight of her day as she does not like being cooped up at home with nothing to do. She contends that she will work the rest of her life and that work is her greatest enjoyment. She says that she needs to buy merchandise that she does not carry at present so that she can offer a broader selection to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's, men's and children's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 55 años D. vida, es viuda desD. hace 12 años y tiene 10 hijos, todo ellos ya viven fuera D. casa. En vida, su esposo no le permitía que trabajara con él en el campo, entonces se dedicaba al cuidado D. sus animales. DesD. que enviudó retomó la agricultura pero le pareció muy duro ya que no tiene ayuda para producir grandes cantidades. Entonces comenzó a sembrar en pequeñas cantidades con el apoyo D. algunos vecinos, y cuando tiene oportunidad D. viajar a la ciudad, lleva algunos sacos D. papa para comercializar en el mercado. D. esta forma pueD. generarse ingresos para su sustento diario. Felicia está satisfecha con la agricultura, ya que le permitió darles educación a sus hijos. Felicia es D. carácter sumiso, y aunque no desempeña ningún cargo en su banco comunal, es muy puntual es sus pagos. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, por lo que también está muy agradecida por la oportunidad y confianza brindada. El dinero que ahora está solicitando es para la compra D. fertilizantes para sus chacras D. papa.
texts.en:
Felicia is 55 years old and has been a widow for 12 years. She has 10 children, none of whom live with her. While her husband was alive, he would not let her to work with him in the field, so she took care of the animals. Since becoming a widow, she has taken up agriculture again, but it is very difficult since she doesn't have the help to produce large quantities. Therefore, she began planting small amounts with the help of some neighbors.

When she had the opportunity to travel to the city, she brought with her some sacks of potatoes to sell in the market. In this way she was able to generate income to cover her daily needs. Felicia is satisfied with agriculture, as it has allowed her to give her children educations.

Felicia has an obedient disposition, and though she isn't an officer in her community bank, she is very punctual with payments. This is her 8th loan with MFP. For this she is very grateful- and for the opportunity and confidence it has brought. The loan she is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizer for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Lino

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Lino R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella vende frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, matequilla, manteca, huevos, carbon, verduras como ser yuca, papa, repollo, tomates, cebolla, etc. ella tiene su negocio en el mercado de Nacaome desde hace 5 años, ella es madre soltera y su meta es graduar a sus hijos.
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos por eso ella lo cuida mucho y trata de mantenerlo muy bien, ella atiende a sus clientes con mucha delicadesa y eso es lo que les gusta a muchos de ellos, por eso prefieren comprarle a ella, ademas que vende barato, mas barato que la competencia. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Lino R. dedicates herself to selling popular consumption products. She sells beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, lard, eggs, coal, and vegetables such as yucca, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, etc. She has had her business in the Nacaome market for the past 5 years. She is a single mother, and her goal is to see her children graduate. This enterprise is her only source of income, which is why she maintains it very carefully. She tends to her customers delicately, which they appreciate and is the reason they choose to buy from her. In addition, she sells her goods at prices that are more reasonable than her competitors. She needs a loan to buy additional products, so she can sell more and therefore increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, salt, soaps, lard, cooking oil, coal, eggs, butter, margarine, beans, rice, sugar, coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 42 años de edad, hace 26 años vive con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, 3 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Se dedica a la siembra de papa y alverjas, al inicio no se acostumbraba al trabajo, pero el paso de los años han logrado que ame su trabajo. Ahora está muy pendiente de sus cultivos, del tamaño y la calidad, ya que de eso depende el conseguir buenos precios en el mercado. Para sus próximas siembras cambiará de semillas, por unas de mejor calidad. Flor es una socia muy tímida, pero es la primera en asistir a cada una de sus reuniones; este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y sacos de semilla de otra calidad.
texts.en:
Flor is 42 years of age, and for the last 26 years has lived with the father of their 6 children, 3 of whom still live at home. She works farming potatoes and peas. At the beginning she was not accustomed to the work, but as the years go by she has come to love her job. Now she is very devoted to her crops, to the size and quality, as these things are important to get a good price at the market. For her next crops she will change to seeds of better quality. Flor is a very shy group member, but she is the first to attend every one of the meetings. This is her eighth loan with MFP and in all this time she has never defaulted. The money she requests will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and bags of seeds of a different quality.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna B. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en el colegio. ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, su negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, con su esposo se ayudan para salir adelante con los gastos del hogar.
ella desea poner otra tienda en una comunidad cercana ya que mucha gente los domingos viaja hacia nacaome para comprar cosas y ella vende mucho, los clientes le comentan si ella tuviera una tienda por aquellos lados le fuera mejor, porque asi la gente compraria localmente y no tuviera que viajar.
por tal razon ella quiere comprar mas mercaderia y con las ganancias que tenga asi poder ver si puede poner otra tienda.
texts.en:
Reyna B. is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children who are in school. She dedicates herself to selling clothes and shoes. The business is her only source of income; along with her husband, they help themselves to get ahead with the household expenses. She wants to open another store in a community nearby, since many people travel toward Nacaome on Sundays to buy products and she sells quite a bit. Customers tell her that it would be better if she had a store closer to them because, then, they could buy locally and wouldn’t have to travel. For this reason, she would like to buy more merchandise to sell and, with the earnings from those sales, explore the possibility of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dress shirts, shoes, blouses, t-shirts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel tiene 30 años de edad, hace 3 años vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una hija, habitan en una casa alquilada. Desde que se casó siembra papa en chacras alquiladas, hizo su contrata por dos años. Él cultiva para semilla porque le resulta más rentable que para consumo, su producción la envía a la ciudad de Arequipa. También tiene brinda el servicio de Internet en su pueblo, que también le genera muy buenas ganancias. A Gabriel le gustaría incursionar en otros negocios, como ser intermediario en la compra y venta de papa; pero de todas las actividades que realiza se siente  más identificado con la agricultura, aunque algunas veces ha tenido grandes pérdidas, también le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, le gusta labrar y cultivar la tierra por ser parte de su infancia. Gabriel es muy puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, y este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, piensa volver a sembrar en el mismo terreno donde acaba de cosechar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 30 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife of three years, and together they have a daughter. Since he was married, he has planted potatoes in rented fields. He has had a contract for two years. He grows for seed because it is more profitable than growing for consumption. He sends his product to the city of Arequipa. He also provides Internet service in his neighborhood, which generates a very good income. Gabriel would like to break into other businesses, like serving as a middleman in the buying and selling of potatoes. Of all his activities, he identifies most closely with agriculture. Although he has occasionally had big losses, it has also given him a lot of satisfaction. He enjoyed working and cultivating the land as part of his childhood. Gabriel is very punctual in making all of his payments, and this is his eighth loan with MFP. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers, as he plans to plant the same field he has just harvested.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina tiene 52 años,  es casada hace 21 años, tiene 7 hijos con los que viven en su casa. Ella y su esposo trabajan como peones en las chacras de algunos familiares, asimismo siembran de 3 a 4 hectáreas de papa y alverjas en chacras alquiladas. En la última cosecha enviaron 150 sacos de papa al mercado de Lima y otros 50 sacos al mercado de Tarma, y con las ganancias que lograron obtener pudieron pagar los pesticidas que compraron al crédito anteriormente. Ahora esperan invertir una la misma cantidad para su nueva campaña de siembra. Georgina fue la presidenta de su banco comunal hace un año, esta vez apoya a su hija con el cargo de tesorera, ya que ambas integran el mismo grupo. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Georgina is 52 years old, has been married for 21 years, and has seven children who live at home with her. She and her husband work as laborers in their relatives' fields, and they also plant three to four hectares of rented fields with potatoes and peas. In the last harvest, they sent 150 sacks of potatoes to the market in Lima and another 50 sacks to the market in Tarma, and with their earnings they were able to pay off their previous loan, which they spent on pesticides. Now they hope to invest the same amount for their current planting. Georgina was the president of her communal bank a year ago, and this time is helping her daughter in the office of treasurer, as they are in the same group. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she has been very responsible in her payments. She is seeking this loan for the purchase of fertilizers for her new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 41 años de edad, hace 20 años vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos. Años atrás se dedicaba a trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo en el labrado de la tierra, pero debido a que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar sus necesidades se incrementaron, entonces empezó a vender verduras de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de San Ramón, ubicado en la selva central de Junín. Al iniciar su negocio sufrió mucho, ya que muchas veces se quedaba con sus productos sin vender porque no tenía clientela, decidió retornar a las labores agrícolas, pero su esposo la motivó una vez más a seguir en su negocio. Acaba de cumplir 5 años de esta actividad, y le resultó ser muy rentable, lo que le permite solventar la educación de sus hijos. Irma es una cliente muy seria, en todo este tiempo ha tratado de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, el cual se siente muy agradecida por permitirle trabajar. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su capital de trabajo para el incremento de su mercadería, y una parte la usará para la compra de los útiles para sus hijos que están en el colegio.
texts.en:
Irma is 41 years old and has lived with her husband and the father of her three children for 20 years. Years ago, she worked with her husband as an agricultural laborer, but due to the fact that her children began studying their needs grew, so she began working as a traveling saleswoman selling vegetables in the market of San Ramón, located in the central jungle of Junín. In the beginning, her business suffered greatly--many times she was left with unsold produce because she didn't have a clientele. She decided to return to agricultural work, but her husband encouraged her to continue her business. After five years of this activity, it has become very profitable, which allows her to afford her children's education. Irma is a very serious client. She has always tried to be punctual in her payments. This is her eighth loan with MFP, to which she is very grateful for allowing her to work. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise and also to purchase school supplies for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres. En los años de su niñez, conjuntamente con su padre lideraba la labor agrícola en sus tierras, mientras que sus hermanos eran fieles colaboradores, ahora que ellos formaron sus propias familias, su dinámica de trabajo ha mermado por la falta de apoyo; pero igual sigue esforzándose al lado de su padre. En la temporada anterior ha sembrado alverjas y su cosecha le ha sido muy gratificante, con las ganancias pudo comprar un becerrito para que luego de dos o tres años le supla en el arado a su toro actual. Javier está muy contento y no piensa dejar sus cultivos, ya que la mayoría de las veces le ha resultado ser rentable, lo que le ha permitido vivir tranquilamente. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para abonar sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Javier is 33 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house. In the years of his childhood, he helped his father lead the agricultural work on their land, while his brothers were loyal employees. Now that they have their own families, his work dynamic has weakened for lack of support, but he continues working alongside his father. In the previous season, he planted peas and his harvest was very rewarding--with his earnings, he was able to buy a calf that can pull his bull plow after two or three years. Javier is very happy and has no plans to quit agriculture, since the majority of the time it has been very profitable and has allowed him to live a quiet life. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he has always demonstrated punctuality in his payments. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años, está separada de su esposo hace 14 años, es madre de 7 hijos, ahora vive solo con 2 de ellos. Tras el alejamiento del padre de sus hijos, sufrió mucho, ya que sus hijos eran muy pequeños, durante esos años tuvieron una precaria economía, y más aun cuando por los gastos educativos. Entonces decidió iniciar un negocio propio, con la venta de verduras en la zona selva, en un inicio llevaba muy poca cantidad, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su mercadería y ahora ya lleva por sacos. Es a base de este negocio que pudo educar a sus hijos mayores, los cuales ya trabajan en Lima, y le ayudan con la educación de sus hermanos menores. Maria también siembra algunas verduras y papa, tanto para la venta como para su consumo personal. Durante su permanencia en su banco comunal, ha sido puntual en sus pagos, y cuando no puede asistir a las reuniones, deja su cuota con sus vecinas. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, del cual le está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de seguir trabajando. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de verduras y demás productos, para tener variedad de qué ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and has been separated from her husband for 14 years. She is the mother of seven children, and now lives with just two of them. Following her husband's departure, she suffered a lot--her children were still very small, and they had a precarious economic situation, even more so because of educational costs. Then she decided to start her own business selling vegetables in the jungle. In the beginning, she sold very little, but with time she increased her merchandise and now sells sacks of it. It is thanks to this business that she was able to educate her older children, who now work in Lima and help her educate her younger children. Maria also plants some vegetables and potatoes, as much for selling as for personal consumption. During her time with the communal bank, she has been very punctual with her payments, and she even leaves her payment with her neighbors when she is unable to attend the meetings. This is her eighth loan with MFP, to whom she is very grateful for the opportunity to keep working. This loan will be used to purchase vegetables and other produce to be able to offer her customers a variety of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja por más de 30 años, con el que tiene 9 hijos, 2 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Ella y su esposo siembran papa y alverjas, la agricultura les han dada mucha satisfacciones económicas, comodidades en su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, los que ahora ya son hombres de bien para la sociedad. En este año han sembrando con 30 sacos de semilla en chacras de regadío y 20 sacos en chacras temporales, y eso gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos que aun le acompañan. Ambos se sienten muy satisfechos y agradecidos a la tierra que les provee sus frutos, una vez acumulada su cosecha contratan un camión para transportarla a los diversos mercados para su comercialización, recuperar su inversión y volver a sembrar la próxima campaña. En su banco comunal, siempre ha tratado de asistir a todas las reuniones y en caso de faltar, pedía permiso anticipado a su asesora de crédito. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una buena cliente. El dinero que solicita los derivará a la compra de fertilizantes para sus chacras sembradas, de ese modo ayudar a las plantas para su buena producción.
texts.en:
Octavia is 50 years old. She has lived with her partner for more than 30 years. With him she has three children, two of whom still live at home. She and her husband plant potatoes and peas. Agriculture has given them economic fulfillment, comforts in their home and education for their children, who are already good members of society. This year they have planted 30 sacks of seeds in irrigated fields and 20 sacks in seasonal fields, thanks to the help of their children who still accompany them. Both feel very satisfied and thankful to the land that provides them its fruits. Once they have collected their harvest, they will contract a truck to transport it to various markets for its sale, recuperate their investment and return to plant the next field. They always try to attend the meetings at their community bank, and when they miss one, they ask permission from their credit assessor. This is their eighth loan with MFP, and they have always shown to be good clients. The money that they request will be diverted to the purchase of fertilizers for their planted fields to assure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna es una mujer muy cariñosa y dedicada a su familia, tiene 29 años y vive en una casa alquilada, junto a sus 3 hijos, Sonia de 11, Deysi 4 y Fernando de 1 año, desea verlos profesionales y siendo útiles a la sociedad. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de habas saladas, gracias a este negocio ha podido darle a su familia el sustento económico que necesitan para vivir, vende de manera ambulatoria por la calles de Juliaca, su producto es muy delicioso por eso es vendido rápidamente. Ella sale a vender junto al más pequeño de sus hijos, a quien cuida con mucho cariño y amor, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir en qué momentos trabajar y en qué momentos dedicarse a las tareas del hogar, esa libertada le ha dado la facilidad necesaria para cuidar bien a su familia. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es caminar todo el día, puesto que el clima no siempre es el más favorable. Reyna quiere comprar una carretilla donde pueda vender sus habas saladas y otros productos más; como maní, papas fritas, etc., ya que sabe que si trabaja duro podrá salir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones se que toman entre todas las socias. Con los quinientos soles que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo, y podrá comprar más ingredientes para preparar sus habas saladas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 29 years old. She is affectionate and dedicated to her family. She lives in a rented house with her three children; Sonia 11, Deysi 4, and Fernando 1. She wishes to see them become professionals and useful members of society. She prepares and sells salted beans. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for her family. She sells on the streets of Juliaca. Her product is delicious and sells quickly. She takes her youngest, who she takes care of with much affection and love, with her. What she likes best about her work is that she can decide when to do her business work and when to do housework. This freedom has allowed her to take good care of her family. She has been doing this for 13 years. What she likes the least is walking all day because the weather is not always good. Rayna wants to buy a cart where she could sell her salted beans and other products like; peanuts, French fries, etc. She knows that if she works hard she can get ahead for the good of her children. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to paying it back on time without fail. She would like to be able to have more loans. She is very quiet, but she always participates in the decisions of her community bank. With the 500 PEN she will increase her working capital. She will buy more ingredients to make her salted beans and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients for the preparation of her salted beans

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 20 años, es una joven muy alegre y sonriente, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc, ella tiene una librería en su propia casa, la cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para vivir, vende muy rápido sus productos, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. A Zenaida le gusta vender, sabe que mientras más lo hagan sus ingresos serán mejores, pero le es muy difícil y cansado permanecer todo el día dentro de su librería, ya que no puede salir a la calle con la libertad que ella desearía. Con los 2 años de experiencia que tiene en este trabajo, ha decidido hacer crecer su negocio y espera para un futuro cercano, tener una librería más grande. Este es el tercer préstamo de Zenaida con MFP, siempre ahorra dinero de sus ventas para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con la cantidad que ahora solicita ha decidido comprar más productos para incrementar la mercadería de su librería.
texts.en:
Zenaida is twenty years old, a happy and smiling young lady, and lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She is dedicated to the selling of notebooks, mechanical pencils, books, etc. She has a bookstore in her home which has given her the money necessary for living expenses. She rapidly sells products, and she is always ready to receive her customers with a smile on her face. Zenaida enjoys selling and knows that the more she does the better her income will be, but it is very difficult and tiring to remain inside her bookstore for the entire day as she cannot go out and about with the liberty that she would desire. With the two years of experience that she has in this line of work, she has decided to grow her business and hopes in the near future to have a larger bookstore.

This is the third loan that Zenaida has taken with MFP, and she always saves the money from her sales to be able to make her payments on time. She is a very friendly member of her communal bank and always works for the wellbeing of it. With the money that she is asking for she has decided to buy more products to increase the merchandise of her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is a farmer. She grows rice which she uses to feed and clothe her family. Rosita is 54 years old and has three children.

Her husband, Eduardo C. is also a farmer. Together, they till their land to support the needs of their family. They started their business in 1993. Until now, they still have their farm, abundant in harvest. "The produce is mainly intended for family use," Rosita said. "And if we have plenty of harvest, I will sell our rice in the market for additional income," she added.

Rosita is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy good quality seeds and herbicides to ensure good harvests. The loan will help the couple achieve better yields. In that way, they will be able to pay for school fees like tuition and books.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses. CEVI gives its clients credit, training and insurance coverage, to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: Buy good seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija, por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros. Junto a su pareja se dedica a la producción de papa utilizando la llamada, semilla única, ya que este tipo le ha dado buenos resultados. Cada vez que cosecha aprovecha el carro de un amigo para enviar sus productos a un mercado de la ciudad de Arequipa, de ese modo le resulta más rentable y capta mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar. Adicionalmente, tiene una bodega, la cual ha ido poco a poco incrementando sus productos, para que cada vez le sea más rentable. A Gladys le gusta mucho la chacra, por ello se levanta a las 4.00am todas las veces que tiene cultivar o cosechar; lo que sí le parece más dificultoso es seleccionar la papa, porque suele lastimarse las manos, y más aun cuando tienen hielo (por el intenso frío) termina sangrando, por ello trata de buscar personas que le ayuden con esa labor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra de papas, porque ya cuenta con semillas seleccionadas para su nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years of age, married, and has one daughter. For the moment they live with her in-laws. She and her husband work together farming potatoes using a unique seed, since this type has given her good results. Each time she harvests she takes advantage of a friend's car to send her products to a market in the city of Arequipa. In this way her business is more profitable and provides higher economic returns for her home. Additionally, she has a small grocery store, and little by little she has been increasing the products so that each time it is more profitable. Gladys very much likes farming, and gets up at 4:00 am every time she has to plant or harvest. What seems most difficult to her is picking the potatoes, because this usually hurts her hands, and even more so when they are icy (from the intense cold) she ends up bleeding. Because of this she tries to look for people to help her with that task. This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to being punctual in her payments. The money she requests is to buy fertilizers for planting her next potato crop, as she has already selected seeds for her new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is 44, married and lives in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a driver and mechanic. She has six children and five of them are in school. At first, she was just a mere housewife, taking care of her husband and children. Later on, she grabbed the opportunity of having vacant land at the back of their house. After joining Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in April, 2008, the idea of planting vegetables cropped up.

Hard work is the key for success, that’s what Mrs. D. remembers, for her nothing is impossible. During her free time, she is planting vegetables. Now she applies for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers. She’s hoping that someday, she could deliver her vegetables to other places. Seeing all her children finish their studies will be a great achievement for her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her garden

loans.name: Sous

texts.en:
Sous K. is 58 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia, where she runs a medium-size store to sell various kinds of groceries. She sells items like cooked produce and some sweets for kid. Most of her clients are villagers who live near her house.

Her husband, Mr. Samoy, 48, helps her in the business. He also goes to buy groceries from market sellers in bulk for his wife to sell at home.

Sous has seven children: three are married and the other four are single. Two of her single children are employed. Sous is asking for a loan to increase stock of grocery inventory.

loans.use: Increase stock of grocery inventory.

loans.name: Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loan consists of sixteen people, located in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. All members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs.Phin D. is the Village Bank president, who was selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she cultivates rice in the dry season and her field now faces a small problem because it has infertile soil which has a bad affect on her crop. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Sim Thea, is a construction worker who can earn less income to support the family. Phin D. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other two attend the local school.

This loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to support her farm and buy fuel to pump water on the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna B.,48, is a married mother of six. Her husband is a motorcycle driver in their village. Lorna is not satisfied with the income of her husband, considering that they have many children to feed. So she finds ways to earn income just to help her husband answer their immediate family needs.

She ventured into food vending and with her dedication, she was able to make home-made food for lunch and snacks to peddle in her village. She wants to have a small loan amounting to PHP5000 to purchase materials and ingredients to complete the needs of her food stall.

loans.use: To purchase materials and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing C., 39, has been growing different kinds of vegetables for more than three years. She lives in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She is married to Sean, 44, who earns a living as a local construction worker. They have two children who are still young and go to school.

Saing C. faces a problem with transportation in that she always hires a neighbor's taxi at a high price. To solve the obstacle, she has decided to request a $500 loan to buy a motorcycle for her and the family to ride.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Phearum P. lives in Trapaing Chambork village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because she usually pays much money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to help plow the field and reduce her expense for plowing.

Her husband, Kong Kem, is a driver who has a little salary. Phearum is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one who is a construction worker and the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy an ox to help plow the filed and reduce her expense for plowing.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat K. is a villager in Sramouch Hae village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.

On her plantation, she doesn't earn enough income to support her family. In order to improve their lives, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. Sat would also use them to plow the field to reduce her expenses.

Sat is a 48 years old widow with a child who is employed.

loans.use: Buy two cows for breeding to earn more income and use them to plow the field to reduce her expenses.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath P. is a villager in Trapaing Chambork village in Takeo province. She is a chicken-seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to sell and earn more profit to support her family, Her husband, Mr. Pul Nget, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Ath P. is 60 years old and the mother of six children; two are construction workers, one sells groceries and the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun S. lives in Boeung Tranh village in Takeo province. She is a weaver. Her business is doing well, but she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough raw materials to support her business. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials to weave to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Nget Sien, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Aun S. is 32 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to weave

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mrs. Mang H. has lived with her family of three in a medium-size wooden house along the street for years. She is 41 and currently makes a daily income by planting vegetables on her own farmland next to her house. She is married to Mr. Lab. They have one child, who is a student in primary school.

Mang H.'s husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. Recently, her husband hasn't been able to attract as many clients, because his motorbike breaks down frequently. As a result, Mang H. decided to ask for a $400 loan to buy another motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: Buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon S. was born in 1953; she now lives in Chen village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. She is a widow with two children; one works in a garment factory and the other is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. On the plantation, that child faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, to buy gasoline to pump water, or to hire laborers to work on the field during the dry season. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phon S. decided to request a loan for him. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to hire laborers

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en:
Tagi S., 49, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pop corn/ice cake business. She sells to the villagers 4 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

Tagi S. has already received 1 loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Tagi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients that are needed to run her business. Some part of her loan will be used to pay for her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Soonaalofa

texts.en:
Soonaalofa P., 41, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the villagers and schools 4 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~ USD).

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Soonaalofa’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients needed to run her business and to make it more successful.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: So Chhea

texts.en: Mrs. So Chhea M. lives in Prey Veing village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uk Ratana, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household better. In order to improve their living, Mrs. So Chhea M. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig food to start a business breeding pigs to earn more income. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children; both are in the local school.  Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig food to start a business breeding pigs.

loans.name: Uilaemotasi

texts.en: Uilaemotasi S., 19, is single with two children.  She has two years of experience in the coconut oil business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Uilaemotasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used mainly for her business; buying an electric machine used to squeeze the oil, which is faster than using your hands to squeeze it, and buying a load of coconuts.

loans.use: To purchase a load of coconuts and an electric machine used to squeeze the oil.

loans.name: Saipai Tua

texts.en: Saipai Tua E., 65, is married with five children.  She has four years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has three previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Saipai Tua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase equipment for making handicrafts.
