loans.use: To buy machines, brushes and coconut shells used for making handicrafts

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn S. is a villager in Am Pao Prey 2 village in Kandal province. She owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Shou Sien, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice. He faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and he does not have rice seeds to plant yet. Thus, Mrs. Norn S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so that her husband can grow rice. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting.

loans.name: Paese

texts.en: Paese K., 43, is married with six children.  She has two years of experience in the chips/ice cake business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Paese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and things for home improvement like timber, cement, nails, paint and an iron roof.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and home improvement

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa F., 32, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Isa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Isa's loan will be used to purchase a plant sprayer, knives, spade, wheelbarrow and sacks of fertilizer for her business. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Sok Um

texts.en: Mr. Sok Um O. was born in 1981 and now lives in Ray Dorb village in Kandal province. He makes rice wine for sale. His wife, Mrs. Mon Phary, is a grocer. She also breeds pigs. Since her   pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it and to support her husband’s business. Thus, Mr. Sok Um O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for the breeding business to earn more income. He has a child who is too young to attend school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for the family's pig-breeding business to earn more income.

loans.name: Ufiufi

texts.en: Ufiufi M., 31, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Ufiufi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipment needed on the plantation and to pay her children's school fees and school uniforms. She will spend some part of her loan on timber for home renovation.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment and pay for school fees and uniforms

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa T., 45, is married with nine children.  She has three years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has four previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase items for her business, to buy home improvement materials like floor mat and cement and to pay for her children's school uniforms and school fees.

loans.use: To buy canteen supplies, home improvement materials, school uniforms and school fees

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia T., 49, is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers four days per week. She has had a previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187).

SPBD loans are Sesilia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase farming equipment, sacks of fertilizers and chemicals for the plantation.

loans.use: Purchase of a plant sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and knives

loans.name: Fenika

texts.en: Fenika A., 20, is married with one child. She has many years of experience in the elei printing business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Fenika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase paints for elei printing and also helped her with her children school fees.

loans.use: To purchase paints for elei printing and also for school fees.

loans.name: Mr. Sokea Kem's Village Bank  Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Akreiksat village in Kandal province comprise this village bank group, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sokea K.,  aged  27, is the leader of the group. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Hout Sambath, is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it to earn more income. Thus, Mr. Sokea K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. Mrs. Samnang C. does not come to take a loan but her husband is taking a loan, so she is shown in the picture instead of him. 

Three members in this group  are taking end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Marianive

texts.en: Marianive K., 41, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Marianive’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy fishing equipment and fishing suits.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and fishing suits

loans.name: Avei

texts.en: Avei F., 23, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience in the homemade restaurant business. She sells to the villagers and public five days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Avei’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients and equipment needed to run and upgrade the standard of her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en: Fiapito T., 35, is married with eleven children. She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and public five days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiapito’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a new canoe and a large container to store the fish and keep it from being damaged.

loans.use: To purchase a canoe and a large container to store the fish

loans.name: Mrs. Phatt Soth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Krasang village in Kandal province comprise this village bank group, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phatt S. is a 52-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Neang Hor, is a thresher who owns a threshing machine. In his business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy gasoline for his threshing machine. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phatt S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has two children; one works in a garment factory and one stays at home to do housework. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for the threshing machine.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin C., 27, owns a brickfield used to make charcoal. He sells the charcoal from his house and sometimes customers come to buy at his house. He is married with two teenage children. His wife works as a local farmer and sells desserts out of her home to the neighborhood. C. is applying for a loan to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase the capital in his business

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en: Faasaveve T., 35, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the design and making of traditional baskets,  bracelets and lava-lava. She sells to the villagers and public 5 days a week. She has 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Faasaveve’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy carving equipment, paints, elei board and other material for her business.

loans.use: Buy varnish, paints, elei board and carving equipment used in making handicrafts.

loans.name: Suilaulau

texts.en: S. Suilaulau, 49, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the pancake/pork cake business. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days a week. She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 470 Tala (~195 USD).  SPBD loans are S.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. A part of her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. Her business is running well.

loans.use: Buy flour,  sugar and oil.  Also to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Lotonoa

texts.en: Lotonoa T., 67, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in running a small-goods store. She sells to the villagers and public 5 days a week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Lotonoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Lotonoa's loan will be used to buy more goods for the store and also to purchase timber, roofing material, paints and cement to renovate her home.

loans.use: Buy goods for her store and materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Rany

texts.en: Mrs. Rany N. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Phen Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he grows mushrooms near his house. In his mushroom-growing, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy mushroom seed and tools. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Rany N. decided to ask for a loan. She is a 25-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy mushroom seed and tools

loans.name: Laloata

texts.en: A. Vili, 39, is married with one child.  She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers five days per week. This is her first loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).  SPBD loans are A.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase taro tops, knives, a spade and barred fence

loans.name: Uaina

texts.en: Uaina T., 40, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the general public and villagers 3 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Uaina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase vegestable seeds, cabbages, peas, corn, cucumber,green pepper, egg plant

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en: Penelope S., 45, is married with seven children.  She has three years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the general public and villagers seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD).  SPBD loans are Penelope’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар работает в местном колхозе. Ему 34 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Чтобы занять жену Музаффар держит дома коров и бычка. Жена смотрит за ними и по мере упитанности Музаффар выводит их на базар и продает. Это вносит весомый вклад в его семейный бюджет. Сейчас очень трудно найти высокооплачиваемую работу и поэтому приходится находить различные способы для зарабатывания денег. Музаффар давно слышал про МикроИнвест и когда несколько его односельчан получили здесь займ он тоже решил присоединиться к ним и подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Muzaffar works in the local collective farm. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. To keep his wife busy Muzaffar has cows and one calf at home. His wife looks after the animals and Muzaffar takes them to the market when they are grown enough and sells them. This brings a very good income into their family budget. Right now it's very hard to find a good high paying job and this is why it is necessary to look for other sources of income. Muzaffar has heard of MicroInvest a long time ago and when one of his fellow villagers got a loan he too decided to join and applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Toeum

texts.en: Toeum S., 33, earns a living by growing morning glory (water spinach) to sell at the market. She currently relies on planting a crop around the public lake in an area of Phnom Penh City. She can generate an average income of $5 per day to help support the family's living. Her husband helps her growing vegetables and he also drives a taxi motorbike. They have three children who are still young and are studying at school. S. is looking for a loan to purchase more seeds of morning glory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds of morning glory

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech M. is 41 years old and the mother of seven children who are not yet married. Three of them are employed and the other four are students in the local school. She currently grows morning glory (water spinach), which she relies on planting in and around the public lake behind her house. She has been in this business since 1996. She is married to Phoeun, 44, who is a domestic fisherman. To expand the business and to earn additional income, Pech M. is asking for a loan to buy morning-glory seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds for growing

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil H. is 62-year-old man who lives with his wife and three sons in Nablus City, Palestine. Khalil has been working as a plumber for 20 years. He also has a shop for plumbing items.

Khalil is requesting a loan of $1,000 US in order to do some maintenance work on his machines and to purchase more goods for his shop. Khalil would like to thank you in advance for your support!

loans.use: Purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Mr. Chhen V. is a 30-year-old father of four who lives in Trapaing Veing village in Takeo province.  He farms rice on his own plot of land, and his wife, Mrs. Pak Toem, sells homemade soya-bean. Two of their children attend the local school and the other two are still too young to work or study.  Mr. Chhen V. is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow for breeding, which will provide additional income for his family.  Both Mr. Chhen V. and his wife Mrs. Pak Toem are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Philma

texts.en: Philma O. sells petroleum products like gas, diesel, lubricants, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more petroleum products to sell. She is 40 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more petroleum products to sell

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Шоимардонов Нурали житель района Рудаки.Возраст 35 лет ,женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует овощами и фруктами. В месяц получает доход в размере 200 долларов США. Для того, чтобы увеличть доход от своего бизнеса он планирует получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurali S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. He has been working in sales for fifteen years. He sells vegetables and fruit. He earns about 200 US dollars a month. In order to increase his income, he wants to take out a loan for six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells sarongs of various colors. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit. She hopes to expand this business. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 38 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is a hair stylist. She also sells hair materials like hair cream, hair extensions, etc. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase one hair dryer and hair extensions. She is 29 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one hair dryer and hair extensions

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence has a medicine store where she sells medicine to people in her community in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a tailor. She sells tailoring materials like zippers, thread, etc. She also sells sarongs. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She is 27 years old and single. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells second hand shoes. The demand for her second hand shoes is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more second hand shoes to sell. She is 30 years old and single. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Зикриев Абдувохид проживает в районе Рудаки.Возраст 35 лет ,женат и имеет четверых детей.Занимается ремонтом квартир по найму . Кроме того занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли.А торгует овощами и фруктами. Опыт работы в торговле уже 15 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abduvohid Z. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, is married and has four children. He is hired to remodel apartments. In addition, he is also a trader. He sells vegetables and fruits. He has 15 years of sales experience. Abduvohid plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He plans to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells second hand clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana sells provisions and wine. She hopes to expand her business. She is 37 years old and married without a child. She is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and wine to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and wine to sell

loans.name: Pirout

texts.en: Mrs. Pirout B. is a 38 year-old mother of three children living in Hang Heng village in Takeo province.  Two of her children already attend the local school and the other is not yet old enough.  Mrs. Pirout B. farms rice on her own plot of land and she also raises chickens. Her husband, Mr. Noub Pros, is a teacher in the local school. Although they work hard, they do not always earn enough to support their family.  Mrs. Pirout B. will use the loan to start a pig breeding business, and will use the money to purchase pigs and feed, and for materials to build the pig pens. Mrs. Pirout B. and her husband Mr. Noub Pros are both pictured.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, feed, and materials to build pens to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Шокиров Сафарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 71 год.Имеет четверых детей. Старший сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках . Сам он занимается животноводством.Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупный рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safarali S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 71 years old. He has four children. Safarali’s eldest son is working in Russia. Safarali raises livestock. He has a plot where he raises cattle. He would like to take out a loan in order to increase his cattle headcount. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cattle headcount

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess is a hair stylist. She also sells hair creams and hair extensions. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice owns a farm. She cultivates pumpkin leaves (green vegetable leaves). Eunice has been in this farm business for the past eight years, after learning from her friend for a year. Eunice has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Eunice is 43 years old and married with three children. Eunice is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more pumpkin seeds (green vegetable seed) to plant on her farm. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more pumpkin seeds to plant

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a married 34 year-old mother of one who sells kerosene and also owns her own hair salon. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase hair extensions to sell in her hair salon.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions to sell in her hair salon.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng K. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Moeun Vichet, is an ice cream seller.  Although they try to work hard, they still do not make enough to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mrs. Cheng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy cement and other supplies to build the house. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and other supplies for her house.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham A. is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children and also cares for his mother. He has a poultry business where he raises birds and sells both birds and eggs. As he is responsible for covering the entire family's expenses, he works hard every day.

His poultry business is growing, as are his customers' demands. Haitham has a chance to increase his income by selling more but he lacks the capital to increase sales. He has therefore decided to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more chickens to sell. Help Haitham improve his family's quality of life by contributing to the growth of his business. They thank you sincerely.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells medicine and she has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase additional supplies of medicine to sell. She is 47 years old and married with one child. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of medicine to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. has a small farm. She is 42 years old and has 6 children. She lives in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, a town of 36,228 people in 7,082 households. The most common type of livelihood there is farming, and some raise hogs and livestock. Her family has been engaged in farming for almost 20 years already. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like 4 sacks of rice seeds, 2 bags of Urea fertilizers, and pesticides. The loan will truly help Jocelyn achieve a better yield to support her family well.

CEVI helps local farmers to sustain and grow their business. CEVI gives their client not just credit, but also trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 50 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for several years. She hopes to make a loan of N140, 000 to purchase more supplies of provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Evelnly

texts.en: Evelnly sells petroleum products like gas, and lubricants, etc. She hopes to make a loan in the amount of N140, 000 to purchase more petroleum products to sell. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more petroleum products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Bunry Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people living in Sramaoch Haer village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Bunry N. is a 39-year-old village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries to generate bigger profits. Her husband, Mr. Chhang Srorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Bunry N. has three children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to generate bigger profits

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol S. is 33 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She currently contributes to the family's food needs by also working in the garment industry. She is married and has six children; five of them are single and live in the family home. To help support the family's living conditions, three of her single children are employed. Her husband is running a business as a motorcycle taxi driver.

The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is too small for them and in a bad state; therefore, Kol S. would like to ask for a loan in order to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Mrs. Hum N. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more coconuts and a cart to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Keng Chantha, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Hum N. is 48 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: Purchasing more coconuts and a cart to support her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to dig a well for her family, to buy gasoline and to pump water to support the field.

loans.name: Vit

texts.en: Vit N. has been catching fish to sell at the local market for more than 6 years. He is age 38 and the father of six children who are single and live in the family home. Two of his daughters are employed as garment workers. He is married to Mrs. Sak, 45, who assists him in the fishing business. The family generates a daily income of approximately $5 each day. The family's living conditions are not comfortable, because their house is lacking spare materials and breaks frequently. To solve the problem, Vit N. has decided to apply for a loan to repair their old house.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru: Хусейнов Сайфулло житель района Рудаки. Проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 38 лет ,женат и имеет четверых детей. Строитель. Работает по найму .   Параллельно с этим занимается торговлей. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saifullo H. is a resident of the Rudaki area. He is 38 years old, is married and has four children. He is a construction worker. Saifullo works for hire. Parallel to this he is a salesman. He sells fruits and vegetables. Saifullo plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He can pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Боймуродов Файзали проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 24 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает в сфере производства. Производит национальные сундуки. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 8 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ему иметь в запасе подручный материал.Погасить кредит планирует в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizali B. lives in the Gissar area. He is 24 years old, is married and has three children. He has a high school education. Faizali works in manufacturing. He makes traditional chests. Faizali has been in this business for 8 years now. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase materials. This will help him to have needed materials in stock. He plans to pay back his loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 28 years old and married with a child. She sells eggs at Uselu Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience has a machine that she uses to grind maize and beans, etc. She has one grinding machine and she is not able to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase another grinding machine to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Боймуродов Шерали проживает  в районе Гиссаре. Возраст 36 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование . Уже 20 лет занимается производством национальных сундуков. Дело дает неплохой доход, а теперь наступает сезон , поэтому Шерали решил получить кредит , чтобы закупить запас материалов.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sherali B. lives in the Gissar area. He is 36 years old, is married and has four children. He has a high school education. For 20 years now he has been making traditional chests. His business provides profits that are not bad, the high season is starting and this is why Sherali decided to take out a loan in order to purchase a supply of materials. He will be able to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Imuetinyan

texts.en: Imuetinyan sells bags and shoes. She is 27 years old and single. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Кароматов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота он решил получить кредит . Таким образом он сможет увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzullo K. lives in the Gissar region. He is 49 years old, married and has four children. He raises cattle and has been in this business for more than 20 years. This business is the only source of income for his family. To increase the headcount of cattle he decided to apply for a loan. This way Fayzullo can also increase his turnover. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells foodstuffs like beans, rice, plantain, etc. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kem Chhum Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank group, which consists of sixteen members, is located in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province.   Each member of the group plans to use the loan that they obtain in different ways. Mrs. Kem C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members to lead the group. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. She is a 55-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending the local school. Now Mrs. Kem C. is requesting a loan to build the staircase for her house.

loans.use: To build the staircase for her house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks. Mary lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says "thank you".

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Кароматов Нурулло проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 25 лет,не женат. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует на центральном рынке коврами. Опыт в данной сфере составляет семь лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы оплатить аренду за торговую точку. Это даст возможность работать без издержек. А кредит будет погашать в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurullo K. lives in the Gissar district. He is 25 years old and single. He is an entrepreneur and sells rugs at the central market. He has seven years of experience in this business. Nurullo plans to obtain this loan in order to pay for his retail outlet lease. This will enable him to work without expenses. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay rent

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca sells tailoring materials and she also sews clothes for people in her community. She is 31 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane sells fruits and foodstuffs. She is 42 years old and married without children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Jane needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells cooked foods like yam, rice, beans, etc. She has been running this business for a long time. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Eseohe

texts.en: Eseohe is 28 years old and married without a child. She sells provisions and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina T. sells food supplies like gari (a fried cassava dish) and maize at Elmina. Savina has received no formal education. She is married with two children and her husband is a fisherman. Savina has been selling food supplies such as gari and maize for a while. She is responsible for helping support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Savina will use her loan to buy additional supplies in order to help her increase the sale of her primary products: gari and maize. This will help her to further meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business and expand her trade.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies to increase her sales of gari and maize

loans.name: Nasri

texts.ru: Мухаммадиев Насри житель района ГиссарВозраст 42 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии шофер. Уже 20 лет работает водителем частного такси. В данный момент планирует произвезти ремонт автомашины. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом . На эти деньги он закупит запчасти. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasri M. lives in the Gissar district. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary vocational education. He has been working as a private taxi driver for 20 years. Currently, Nasri plans to repair his vehicle. He requested this loan in order to purchase auto parts. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Abewoa

texts.en:
Abewoa N. sells aluminium bowls at the Elmina first port. Abewoa has received no formal education. She is married with two children and her husband is a mason. Abewoa has been selling aluminium bowls since 2000. Her financial responsibilities include assisting her husband with the payment of rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Abewoa’s loan will be used to buy additional inventory to enable her to increase the sale of aluminium bowls to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for reinvestment in order to further the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory to increase the sale of aluminium bowls

loans.name: Sabzbahor

texts.ru: Набиева Сабзбахор проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Домохозяйка. Занимается фермерской деятельностью.Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы получать молоко.Молоко она сможет реализовывать своим соседям, а часть оставит своим детям. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabzbahor N. lives in Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married and has five children. She is a homemaker and involved in an agricultural business. She has a small farm where she raises livestock. Sabzbahor plans to obtain this loan to purchase a dairy cow and have milk. She could sell the milk to her neighbors and leave some for her children. She can repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married with two children and has received no formal education. Since 2008 Lydia has been selling food supplies, such as gari (fried cassava), okra and tomatoes, at the Elmina first port. Lydia uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Lydia will use the loan to purchase additional supplies to help her increase her sales of food in order to meet the demand created by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to save towards a house which she will share with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies to increase her food sales

loans.name: Hairullo

texts.ru: Тиллоев Хайрулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 62 года, женат и имеет восемь детей. Работает бригадиром в совхозе. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых неоткормленных бычков, откармливает их , а затем перепродает на тех же рынках. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hairullo T. lives in Vahdat. He is 62 years old, married and has eight children. He works as a foreman in a collective farm. Besides this work, he is involved in animal husbandry. He buys young bulls, feeds and raises them, and then resells them at markets. Hairullo plans to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 39 years old and married with 6 children. She sells eggs and palm oil. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy rents out chairs, tables and canopies. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies to sell. She is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and canopies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria produces and sells sachet water in her shop. She has two water production machines. Gloria learned this business in a year before establishing her own in the year 2003. Gloria is a mother of 5 and she is 32 years old. Gloria has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. Gloria lives in Mebamu and she needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more chemicals for purifying water and for production of nylon for the water. She is very grateful for the financial assistance granted to her by Kiva and LAPO Microfinance, and she thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more nylon and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif G. is a 36-year-old man who works in his own barber shop in a small city called Imishli. He is married and has two children. He started his career working in a general barber shop but after he gained experience in barbering and saved some money he was able to open his own small barber shop. Arif is a very polite man and a professional in his business. His barber shop is always full of people. Arif’s dream is to provide to his children a better education. He would like to expand his business and purchase modern barber tools for his shop. Arif and his family count on your help.

loans.use: To purchase modern barber tools

loans.name: Sharafet

texts.en: Sharafet K. is a hard-working man who has always made sure, since his younger days, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married and has an adorable daughter. Sharafet has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With starting capital of $100, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise five years ago. Today his business has become domestic with his children and wife also engaged. Sharafet needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil A. is a 57-year-old butcher who sells meat in a small butcher shop.  He has worked there for the last eight years. Shamil sells mutton and beef, which are very popular among Azerbaijani people. Early in the morning farmers bring to his butcher shop sheep and calves, and at that point Shamil and his son begin their work day. Shamil always sells fresh meat which makes his shop very popular. Now Shamil would like to purchase a refrigerator for his store to keep meat cool during the hot time of the year.  Shamil, his wife, and their three children count on your help.

loans.use: purchase refrigerator

loans.name: Mirseymur

texts.en: Mirseymur A. is a successful 25-year-old entrepreneur. He is single and lives with his parents. Mirseymur began a small grocery store five years ago with a small amount of savings and the support of his parents. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of USD 1200 so that he can expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Mirseymur is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Bakhadur

texts.en:
Bakhadur A. is a 31-year-old, married father of 2 children. He provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store he owns, where he sells plates and dishes of the oriental style which are very popular among young ladies who are gathering dowry.

He is requesting a loan of $1225 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the stock of goods available at his store. Bakhadur is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children's efforts to get good educations. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: To expand the variety of plates and dishes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells foodstuffs. Florence learned this business over 8 months and she has been in this business for the past 6 years. Florence is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Florence needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is divorced with 3 children and has received no formal education. Aba has sold fish since the year 2000. She buys fish from the fishermen and then brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends the prepared fish to the market in order to be sold at Elmina. Aba uses her income to provide food, clothing and other basic needs of the family.

Aba will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business to increase the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Aba will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. is 60 years old and is married with four children. He is a market vendor, selling cosmetics and bath goods from his own market stall. Ali is already retired and his business, which he has been running for the last ten years, is his only source of income. However, it is successful enough to allow Ali to support his family and parents. Now Ali is planning to increase stock by purchasing more products.  Ali thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola S. is a 30-year-old beautician with two children. She has a shop open from 7am to 11pm Monday to S., where she also sells hair extensions, hair cream and hair relaxer. Lola has a lot of customers as her shop stands out from others because she has so many hair products and a generator to provide power when there is a power failure (a very common phenomenon in Nigeria). As a result, the shop remains open until late to cater for all the customers who troop through. Lola learned her business in three years and she has been in the business for the past nine years. Lola needs the loan amount of NGN80 000 to purchase more weavons, hair attachments, hair relaxer and hair cream. She thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products to sell

loans.name: Firudin

texts.en: Firudin M. is a dedicated husband and successful father of four children. His eldest child is studying at university and the youngest at elementary school. Firudin began a small grocery store more that 15 years ago, using savings that he earned as a carpenter as his small capital. He was assisted by his wife who helps him serve the customers. Today his clientele has grown and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in the store. Firudin is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve business success with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of food goods sold in his store

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil T. is 54 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur with a grocery store he has rented for the last seven years. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs in the store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items.

Now Ismayil would like to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push on to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress by means of their studies, and he is doing his very best to achieve this. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his store

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab M. is a 57-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years she has rented a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of food. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when her husband could not find a job. Her salary as a nurse was not enough to provide for even the basic needs of her children, and so now her small business is the main source of family income. 

Zeynab works from 8am until 10pm, and her friendly and polite approach has earned her a large clientele. Now she would like to purchase more goods so that she can increase the range of products on offer. In this way she will be able to provide for her children's needs and pay their school fees. Zeynab promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her store

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah E. is married and has one child. She has not received schooling through formal education. Since 2007 Hannah has sold red oil and palm kennel oil at the Elmina first port. She is married and her husband’s occupation is that of a porter.

Hannah uses her income to help support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Hannah will use the loan to purchase additional stock which will enable her to increase her sales of red oil and palm kennel oil to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Purchase additional red oil and palm kennel oil for resale.

loans.name: Khazratqulu

texts.en:
Khazratqulu K. is 54 years old. He is married with three children. He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as: sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Khazratqulu is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Khazratqulu is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Aqroinvest Credit Union believes his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food items.

loans.name: Carlista

texts.en:
Carlista sells second hand clothes. She has been in business for the past eight years.

Carlista lives in Ilogbo and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years.

Carlista is 39 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. Carlista says thanks.

loans.use: Purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O. is a hair stylist who also sells clothes.

She is 37 years old and married with three children. Helen is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.

She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia sews clothes for her customers as well as tailoring materials.

She is 32 years old and married with three children. Patricia lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Patricia needs a loan of N30000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad H. is 33 years old. He is married with three children. Elshad has been selling men’s shoes for eight years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in the central market of Sabirabad.

He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. Elshad's business has profited from his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Elshad needs a loan of $1,200 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients.

You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Elshad thanks everyone for help and support!

loans.use: Purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus A. has sold groceries such as milk, Milo, canned products and rice at Bantama, in Elmina, since 2004.

Theophilus has received a junior high degree, is married and has three children. His wife has the occupation of a fishmonger. He is responsible for providing financial support, food, clothing and other basic needs for the family.

His loan will be used to buy additional stock to increase the sale of goods to meet the high demand from his customers. Theophilus hopes to use the new profits from his business to support the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: Buy additional stock to meet the high demand from customers.

loans.name: Khikmet

texts.en:
Khikmet H. is 44 years old. He is married with two children. He is a entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as: sweets, macaroni, sugar, salt, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Khikmet is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Khikmet is requesting a loan of 965 AZN for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Aqroinvest Credit Union believes Khikmet's perseverance and clear vision will be key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food items.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian E. is married with one child and received schooling through junior high. Vivian has sold fish since 2004. She buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, in Elmina.

Her husband is also employed, but his sector of employment is as a trader. Vivian uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Vivian will use the loan to help her purchase more fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to reinvest to help expand her trade.

loans.use: Purchase more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro I. is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells food stuffs like plantains and yams.

She needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more food stuffs to sell. Caro says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Agajafar

texts.en:
Agajafar K. is a hard-working man. Over the years, he has focused on strengthening the family business - cattle sales - so he can provide for his children. With the experience he has gained over the last 15 years in business, he has been able to grow his business and bring stability to his family.

Agajafar has a friendly family who always tries to help each other.

Now Agajafar has decided to build his own business raising animals. He will care for the animals for a short period of time and then sell them at his city's large stock shows. Therefore, he has requested $1,225 for the term of 15 months.

Agajafar is counting on your help once again and thanks you very much for your love and support.

loans.use: Purchase and sell cattle.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a widow who has five children. When she was asked her age, she smiled and said around 60 years. “When we where born they never recorded it,” she says.

Rachel sells provisions and drinks in her house. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Rachel thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef A. is from the city of Sabirabad. He dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region.

He is the father of one son who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

Agasef has engaged in this business for more than 15 years. He would like to expand and purchase two more calves.

With your help, Agasef will be able to make his business more successful and support his family.

loans.use: Purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a tailor and she also sells clothes to her customers. She is 29 years old and married with a child.

She needs a loan of N40,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en:
Malakhat A. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Eighteen years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.

She is engaged in this business with her husband. Slowly, the number of calves increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason is requesting a loan.

Become an important part of the growth of Malakhat’s business.

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Navi

texts.en:
Navi A. sells used clothing at Elmina and has been doing so since 2004.

She is married with six children and has received no formal education. Her husband works as a trader. She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to buy additional stock to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand from her costumers.

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the purpose of expanding her trade.

loans.use: Buy additional used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. Bose lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 52 years old and married with six children. She sells sarongs at Ogida Market, in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine hails from Cele and sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past six years.

Josephine is 29 years old and married with four children.

Josephine has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and the loans have tremendously increased her business and her profit margin. Josephine needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Livina Ozhaagu

texts.en:
Livina sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past five years. Life is not too easy for her family. Her four children are in secondary schools and she pays their school fees, feeds them and clothes them with her husband's support.

Livina is 37 years old and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Livina has been very grateful to LAPO Microfinance for helping her expand her business. Livina wants to increase sales and meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is married with 3 children and has no formal education. Beatrice has sold fish since 1999. She purchases fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Her husband also works in the fish industry as a fisherman.

Beatrice uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Beatrice will use the loan to increase her capital to enable her to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to reinvest to increase the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To increase her capital to enable her to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Priscilia

texts.en: Priscilia is a hair stylist and her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. They have 5 children. Priscilia also sells hair extensions and is requesting a loan in the amount of N50000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She thanks everyone that makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 39 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. makes a living selling popular local foods such as banku, kenkey and fried fish. When growing up, she received no formal education, and now she is married and has eight children. Her husband makes a living as a trader. Mary has sold popular local foods for the last two years, and finds it an effective way to help her large family pay rent, utility bills and meet other basic expenses. She will use her loan to buy corn to make more kenkey and thereby meet increasing customer demand. She hopes to use the profits made possible by this loan to fund her children's education.

loans.use: To buy corn to make into kenkey, a popular local dish

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Since 2002, Beatrice B. has made a living selling food such as eggs and tomatoes at a local market. She is married and has seven children. When growing up, she received a primary school education. Her husband works as a fisherman. Beatrice helps her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses. She will use her loan to buy additional food to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the increased income made possible by this loan to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
La Señor Fulgencio O. Riveros, vive en el Barrio Pai Ñu de la Ciudad de Ñemby, posee un automóvil Marca Nizzan Bluebira que utiliza como elemento de trabajo. 

Esta acompañado hace 20 años con la señora Anatolia Baez. La Sra. Anatolia es modista y se dedica a la confección de Ropas como uniformes de oficina y vestidos de fiestas, tienen 1 hijo ya mayor.

El Señor Fulgencio O. posee una parada de Taxis ubicado San Valentin e/ Av. Avelino Martinez del Barrio Barcequillo de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, frente al Colegio Domingo Sabio, limitando con la Ciudad de Ñemby.- 

Don Fulgencio y su mujer han realizado el presente préstamos a fin de poner en condiciones su vehiculo para el comienzo de las clases., pues la época en que aumenta la cantidad de clientes en la zona.

Con el comienzo de las Clases por que las maestras son por lo general clientas seguras de su Taxi para salir a la ruta Acceso Sur.

Son pocos los transportes públicos que transitan por la Avenida Avelino Martinez.
El taxista se levanta muy temprano, va a la parada donde espera que lleguen los pasajeros en la parada., más aun en días de lluvia
texts.en:
Mr. Fulgencio O. Riveros lives in the Pai Ñu neighborhood in the city of Ñemby. He owns a car, a Nissan, that he uses for his job. He has spent the last 20 years with his wife, Anatolia Baez. Anatolia works in fashion and makes clothes like office uniforms and party dresses. They have one grown son. Fulgencio has a taxi stop located at San Valentin and Avelino Martinez Avenue in the Barcequillo neighborhood in San Lorenzo, in front of the Domingo Sabio school, near the border with Ñemby city. Fulgencio and his wife are asking for this loan in order to make repairs to his vehicle so it is ready for the beginning of classes, which is when the amount of customers increase. Teachers are some of his regular customers who need taxis along the Acceso Sur road. There are few public transportation options along Avelino Martinez Ave. Fulgencio gets up very early to go to the taxi stand and wait for his customers, especially on rainy days.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: auto repairs

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi enjoys running her small business, in which she sells drinks and pepper soup to local customers. She has been in this business for the past eight years, and would like to expand by opening a second shop where she can sell more drinks and pepper soup. Olabisi is 30 years old, married and has three children. She has been a faithful LAPO Microfinance client for the last three years, and is applying for a loan to buy more drinks to sell to her customers and spices to make her soup. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva and LAPO Microfinance, and wishes to thank you for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and spices to use to make pepper soup

loans.name: Uchena

texts.en: Uchena runs a restaurant and also sells drinks. She is is 36 years old, married and has children. Uchena is applying for a loan to buy more drinks and foodstuff to cook and to sell. She thanks you for your generous support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuff to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: La Sra. Maura de Luizzi es casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica actualmente a atender una despensa en su domicilio particular. Nos comenta la Sra. que anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en los E.E.U.U bastante tiempo, tenia a su cargo el cuidado de un anciano. Tenia un buen vivir alli, ganaba buen dinero el cual guardaba y un porcentaje lo enviaba a los familiares aquí. Despues de un tiempo le avisaron que el marido tenia graves problemas de la vista, entonces tuvo que dejar todo y emprender su viaje de vuelta. Al llegar se encontro con una delicada situacion, ya que el marido casi perdio la vista. Gracias al dinero que junto alli pudo solventar los gastos y con lo que sobro invirtio en una despensa, la que mencionabamos anteriormente.En vista a que le fue bien con la despensa recurrio a nosotros para seguir invirtiendo en su despensa y comprar mas mercaderias como carne, lacteos, embutidos, alimentos no perec, articulos de merceria, etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura de Luizzi is married with two children. She runs a general store out of her home. She worked in the United States for a long time, caring for an elderly person. She had a good life there and she earned a good salary that she saved and would send a percentage of her money to her family here (in Paraguay). Later, she was notified that her husband has serious problems with his sight, so she had to leave the U.S. and return home. When she arrived she found herself in a delicate situation, as her husband had almost lost his sight. Thanks to the money she had saved in the U.S. she was able to pay for their household expenses and with the money left over, she started a small general store. Since the store is doing well, she came to us [Fundacion Paraguaya] for a loan so she can continue investing in her store. She wants to buy more merchandise like meat, dairy products, sausages, non-perishable items, other dry goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Ogechukwu

texts.en: Ogechukwu sells various food products to the people of her community. She learned this business three years ago, and has been active in it ever since.  Ogechukwu is 40 years old, married and has six children. She has borrowed from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and has made good use of her loans to boost her business and her profitability. Ogechukwu has applied for a new loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers. She is very happy with the support she has received from Kiva, and she wishes to say thank you to your generous support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara sells hair extensions, makeup and hair cream. Omolara goes to Idumota (within Lagos) to purchase her goods in large quantities and sells retail in the Okoko market in Lagos. Omolara has been a LAPO Microfinance client for the past two years. Omolara is 33 years old and married with three children.

Omolara needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions, hair creams and hair relaxers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, creams and relaxers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a typical businesswoman who sells provisions and foodstuffs. Elizabeth goes to Idumota within Lagos to purchase her provisions and she travels to the republic of Benin to buy her foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. Elizabeth has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and she lives in Okoko, Lagos.

Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with four children. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Набиев Ахмад житель города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается животноводством. Покупает и продает животных. Скупает на одном рынке а продает на другом. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ahmad N. lives in Vahdat. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He is involved in animal husbandry. He buys and sells livestock. He buys livestock at one market and resells at another. Ahmad plans to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Podemos hablar de  la Sra Miguela E., tiene 40años , con 3 hijos , tiene una despensa , ella empezo vendiendo  golosinas y comestible y asi fue surguiendo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio  y logro crecer economicamente a gran escala, y asi mantener y educar ella sola a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera pero dice que eso no es inconveniente, es un ejemplo para las madres solteras de escasos recursos.

Nos comenta que gracias a los creditos que otorgo la fundacion ella esta alcanzando sus objetivos.

Los miembros de este grupo hacen ventas de todos tipos, y estan realizando esta prestamo para comprar mas mercederia para vender.  

Fany R.        	Venta de zapatos
Miguela E. 	Despensa
Nelly S.	        Kiosco
Celina Ledesma  	Vendedora Ambulante
Antonia C. 	        Venta de helados
Maria Alba C.	Venta de ropas 
Mirian Agüero    	Venta de verduras
Gladys Cañiza    	Venta de comidas
Idalina Z. 	Modista
Maria A.           Venta de merceria
Gabriela A.	Venta de tortas
Gloria G. 	Ventas de zapatos
Rosalia M.	        Venta de empanadas
Licia Barua V.   	Venta de ropas
Lidia N. 	        Venta de merceria 
Luisa O. 	        Venta de empanadas
texts.en:
Mrs. Miguela E. [one of the members of the group] is 40 years old and has 3 children. She has a general store—she began by selling candies and sweets and gasoline, and with her efforts and sacrifices she grew economically on a large scale. She alone supports and educates her children. Although she is a single mother, she says that it does not inconvenience her. She is an example for single mothers with limited resources. She is grateful for the loans the foundation [Fundacion Paraguaya] has given her to help her reach her goals. The members of this group sell all kinds of things and are asking for this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. Fany R. sells shoes. Miguela E. has a general store. Nelly S. has a kiosk . Celina Ledesma is a street vendor. Antonia C. sells ice cream. Maria Alba C. sells clothing. Mirian Agüero sells vegetables. Gladys Cañiza sells food. Idalina Z. works in fashion. Maria A. sells general merchandise. Gabriela A. sells baked goods. Gloria G. sells shoes Rosalia M. sells empanadas (pastries). Licia Barua V. sells clothes. Lidia N. sells general merchandise. Luisa O. sells empanadas (pastires).

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale sells foodstuffs in her shop located along Badagry Road in Lagos. She opens her shop from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Monday to Sunday. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Bolale is 30 years old and married with three children. Bolale lives in Okoko.

She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene sells ice fish in the Okoko market. She has been in the business for the past 15 years. Irene is 46 years old and married with seven children. Irene lives in Okoko and she is requesting the amount of N50,000 to purchase more ice fish to sell. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and to Kiva for the financial help rendered to her for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: Aquiles tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su hijo en casa de su madre. Desde niño demostró inclinación por la agricultura, siempre ha tratado de ser muy responsable, y todas sus siembra actuales son de 25 a 30 sacos de papa en chacras temporales, y en zonas de regadío cultiva alverjas y maíz. Aquiles está muy contento con las labores agrícolas, cuando termina a tiempo de trabajar sus cultivos, en su afán de retribuir el esfuerzo de su padre, acude a apoyarlo en sus cultivos. De todo el proceso agrícola lo que más le gusta es la comercialización, porque siempre lleva la esperanza de encontrar un buen precio para sus productos. Pero una vez en el mercado, dice volverse un poco torpe, algunas veces pierde la contabilidad, por ello siempre trata de apoyarse con sus apuntes. Aquiles es el presidente de su banco comunal, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable, tanto en sus funciones como en sus pagos. El crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para comprar fertilizantes para el abonado de sus diversas siembras.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in his mother’s home. From a young age he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. He has always tried to be very responsible and today he has a crop of 25-30 sacks of potatoes that he grows in transitional fields. He also grows beans and corn in irrigated fields.
