Aquiles is very content with his farmwork. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Aquiles always tries to help him out with some pointers. Aquiles is the president of his community bank and this is his 8th loan with MFP. In all of this time he has proven to be very responsible, both in his duties and in his payments. The loan he is asking for is to purchase fertilizer for his varied crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru: Халимова  Ашурби жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 49 лет , замужем и имеет восьмерых детей.Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Хочет купить дойную корову , для того, чтобы получать молоко. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать , а так же использовать для своей семьи. Это даст возможность получать дополнительную прибыль.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ashurbi H. is a resident of the city of Vahdat. She is 49 years old, married, and has 8 children. She is a housewife and also raises animals. She would like to buy a dairy cow as a source of milk which she could sell and also use for her family. It will provide her with additional income. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 45 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos que viven en su casa. Tras la separación con su esposo, sus cultivos de papa y alverjas han mermado, porque a sus hijos no les gustan las labores agrícolas, debido a ello siembra con el apoyo de sus sobrinos. La agricultura le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, con las ganancias, logró construir su casa de material rústico; pero las constantes lluvias provocaron la caída de una pared, ahora se propuso poner un buen cimiento, alto y retomar otra construcción. Seguir cultivando sus chacras también le ha permitido cubrir la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Y desde hace tres años atrás, los días que no realiza sus cultivos, se dedica a la venta de verduras y quesos que lleva a un mercado de la zona de la selva los días viernes. Victoria se convirtió en una mujer independiente y está muy contenta con las actividades que realiza. Las ganancias de su próxima cosecha de papa serán para terminar la construcción de su casa, y de ese modo su felicidad será completa. El ciclo anterior fue vocal de su banco comunal, y cumplió de buena forma la misión encomendada. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy consiente y puntual en cada uno de sus pagos. El dinero que solicita esta vez es para la compra de fertilizantes y demás insecticidas para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old, divorced, with 3 children who still live at home. After she separated from her husband, her bean and potato crops decreased. Since her children do not like doing farm work, she relies on the help of her nieces and nephews to plant her crops. Working in agriculture has given her great satisfaction and with her earnings she was able to build a home out of basic materials. However, the constant rains caused one of the walls to fall down. Now she needs to put in a strong foundation and begin building again. By continuing to plant her fields she has also been able to feed her children and pay for their education. For the past three years she also has sold vegetables and cheese that she takes to a market in the jungle to sell every Friday. Victoria has become an independent woman and she is very content with her jobs. The earnings from her next potato crop will be used to finish building her home and this will complete her happiness. During the last loan cycle she was the spokeswoman for her community bank and she completed her duties in a good way. This is her 8th loan with MFP and in this time she has proven to be consistent and on-time with all of her payments. The money she is asking for with this loan will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 25 años de edad, está felizmente casada y tiene 3 hijos. Sus padres fueron agricultores y ella desde muy niña se levantaba a las 5.00am para cargar agua del puquial, después apoyaba a su madre en preparar el menú del día; comía a las 9.00am y trabajaba durante todo el día en la chacra. Ahora Vilma y su esposo siembran papa, alverjas, maíz y habas; en su mayoría papa, ya que tienen compradores que cosechan en su chacra. Prefieren vender por chacra para evitarse los ajetreos de la selección y el preparado de la carga, aunque la cotización es algo menor, pero ahorran mucho tiempo. Esta pareja es muy feliz labrando y cavando cada unos de los surcos de la tierra, esperan que los precios del mercado se mantengan hasta que terminen de cosechar sus chacras restantes, para poder recuperar las inversiones en los fertilizantes. En esta época también están trabajando preparando otras chacras ajenas, con el anhelo de ahorrar para comprarse más tierras. Vilma es una cliente muy responsable, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, ingresó a su banco comunal motivada por su madre, ahora es la tesorera de su grupo y ha demostrando gran responsabilidad, tanto en sus funciones como en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para los cultivos que ha sembrado hace dos meses, también adquirirá semillas de arveja.
texts.en:
Vilma is 25 years old, and is happily married with 3 children. Her parents were farmers and as a little girl she would wake up at 5:00 am to carry water from the stream, then she would help her mother make the food for the day. At 9:00 am they ate and then spent the whole day working in the fields. Today Vilma and her husband grow potatoes, beans, corn and peas. They mostly grow potatoes because they have buyers that come in and harvest their fields. They prefer to sell their crops by the field so they avoid the chore of selecting and preparing the potatoes. They earn a smaller profit, but they save a lot of time. This couple is very happy working on the land, digging out each row with care. The hope that the market prices remain stable until they finish harvesting the rest of their fields, so they can recover some of the money they invested in fertilizer. Right now they are also preparing some fields for other people, with the hope of saving enough to buy more land. Vilma is very responsible and this is her 8th loan with MFP. She was motivated to join her community bank by her mother and now she is the treasurer of the group. She has proven to be very responsible both in her group duties and in her payments. The loan money is for fertilizer, for the crops she planted 2 months ago. She will also buy more bean seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo Jarol quien es chef y sus dos pequeños hijos; Jarol y Luana, en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican al negocio de la cocina desde hace 11 años, pues tienen un restaurante, el cual administran los dos y donde trabajan juntos, aveces también la ayuda su madre, haciendo que el negocio sea cada vez más productivo. A ellos les gusta mucho el negocio de la cocina porque tienen muy buena sazón y les gusta ver la satisfacción en el rostro de sus clientes, los cuales en su mayoría se van muy contentos despues de haber degustado los deliciosos platillos que preparan. Pero la mayoría de las veces es muy sacrificado su trabajo y suelen terminar a altas horas de la noche, felizmente son muy unidos y esperan generar buenos ingresos para la educacion de sus hijos y de su familia. En el futuro les gustaría tener una cadena de restaurantes y así poder gozar de una mejor estabilidad económica. Ana se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más mesas para expandir su negocio, además arreglará la fachada y comprará algunos utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and lives with her husband Jarol, who is a chef. They have 2 small children, Jarol and Luana, and live in their own home. They have both worked in the food business for the past 11 years. They have a restaurant that they manage and work in together. Sometimes Ana’s mother helps too, which makes the business even more productive. They like working in the restaurant because they make good food and enjoy seeing the satisfaction on their customers’ faces. The majority of their customers leave feeling content after having enjoyed one of the delicious meals that they prepare. But they also have to sacrifice a lot for their jobs and usually finish working very late at night. Happily, they are very united and hope to earn a good enough salary to pay for their children’s educations. In the future they would like to open a restaurant chain in order to enjoy more economic stability. This is Ana’s 3rd loan with MFP and she has always been on time with her payments. With this loan she will buy more tables to expand her restaurant. She will also make improvements to the outside of the restaurant and purchase some kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tables and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Calistan

texts.en:
Calistan sells drinks and pepper soup in her shop. Calistan has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and she lives in Okoko. Calistan is 35 years old and married with five children.

Calistan is requesting the loan of N70,000 to enable her buy more drinks and pepper soup spices to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza”cumple actualmente  su 4to ciclo es decir tiene mas de un año de formacion y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , retiran un crédito promedio de 500.000 Gs y lo utilizaran para ampliar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: la compra de tela , compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. Se ezfuerzan el doble para conseguir mas ingresos y asi disminuir las necesidades del hogar.

Lilian F.	Vta de cosméticos
Zulma I.	Vta de frutas y verduras
Maria Irene B. 	Despensa
Petrona R.	Vta de merceria
Maria Isabel A.	Vta de artesanias y merceria
Nilda R.	Vta de comestibles
Teodora D. 	Heladeria
Nelida de B. 	Vta de frutas y verduras
Diana F.	Vta de comestibles
Sindia L.	Vta de mercaderias varias
Susana Faría 	Vta de frutas y verduras
Mirtha F.	Vta de juguetes inflables
Blanca V.	Vta de juguetes
Marlene Bordón	Vta de chipas
Maria C. 	Fca y venta de productos de limpieza
Alicia F.	Vta de cosméticos
Faustina S.	Vta de cosmetibles
Maria Zunilda M.	Vta de dulces
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (Hope) is currently in its 4th loan cycle. The group was formed over a year ago and works with Fundacion Paraguaya. They are asking for a loan of approximately 500.000 Gs [each] and they will use the money to expand the work they are already doing, like: buying fabric, buying ingredients to make prepared food, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, baked items, and vegetables for resale, buying and selling drinks like soda, beer, wine, etc. They will double their efforts to earn more income and diminish their household needs. Lilian F. sells cosmetics. Zulma I. sells fruits and vegetables Maria Irene B. has a general store. Petrona R. sells general merchandise Maria Isabel A. sells handicrafts and other goods. Nilda R. sells food. Teodora D. has an ice cream shop. Nelida de B. sells fruits and vegetables. Diana F. sells cosmetics. Sindia L. sells general merchandise Susana Faría sells fruits and vegetables Mirtha F. sells inflatable toys. Blanca V. sells toys Marlene Bordón sells chipas (a corn and cheese bread) Maria C. sells cleaning products. Alicia F. sells cosmetics. Faustina S. sells food. Maria Zunilda M. sells sweets and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric, food ingredients, general merchandise,cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married. He offers taxi services to help people to get around the city as well as between cities. Prior to having his own business, Kostya was employed as a driver. Then he decided to be self-employed. Today Kostya has many repeated clients that use his services often.

His monthly profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. This is the only source of income for his family. Kostya would like to receive 8,000 UAH to fix his car. His business goal is to be able to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To fix the taxi

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 60 años, es soltera, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que su único hijo, Renato viajó al extranjero a estudiar. Se dedica desde hace casi 13 años a la atención de su puesto de comida en el mercado “Huamantanga”, uno de los más concurridos del distrito de Puente Piedra en la ciudad de Lima, el trabajo es muy duro, pero felizmente Domitila tiene quien la ayude, pues contrató a dos chicas las cuales la ayudan en la atención y en la cocina. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y siempre está pensando en nuevas formas de mejorarlo, es por eso que se ha hecho de buenos clientes, los cuales son fieles a su puesto de comida. Domitila se distrae mucho con el trabajo y dice que es necesario trabajar mucho para lograr lo que uno quiere, felizmente todos sus esfuerzos no son en vano, ya que su puesto arroja buenos ingresos y le permite trabajar tranquila y feliz. Ahora con el verano, el calor hace que la cerveza que vende sea muy consumida, es por eso que quiere comprar más cerveza para generar mayores ganancias y en el futuro expandir su negocio. Domitila lleva años trabajando con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo fuera de su banco comunal, y espera seguir trabajando y generando ganancias para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará cajas de cerveza, para aprovechar mientras dura el verano, para que con las ganancias pueda abastecer su tienda en el otoño.
texts.en:
Domitila is 60 years old and single. She lives in her own home and her only son, Renato, is studying in another country. For the past 13 years she has worked in her food stand in the Huamantanga market, one of the busiest markets in the Puente Piedra district in the city of Lima. The work is very hard but happily Domitila has some help—she hired two young women to help her work in the kitchen. She likes her job a lot and is always thinking of new ways to improve her business. Because of this she has a loyal group of customers who always come to her food stand. Domitila is absorbed in her work and says that it is necessary to work a lot in order to achieve the things we want. Happily, her efforts are not in vain, since her food stand generates a good income and allows her to work happily in peace. During the summer, the heat means that people will buy a lot of beer from her, so she wants to purchase more beer in order to generate more income in the future. Domitila has been working with MFP for several years, but this is her first loan outside of her community bank. She hopes to continue working and generating income in order to repay her loan on time. With this loan she will buy cases of beer and with the profits she earns from selling the beer in the summer, she will stock her food stand for the fall.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: His family has 2.73 ha of agricultural land, which he received from privatization. He also works on 5.46 ha of land, which belongs to his retired parents. He has been working on this land since 1999. He has no agricultural technique. The work is performed by service providers in the village. He accomplishes manual work with his wife and he pays workers to do weeding and harvesting. He uses a minibus to transport workers in the field. He also uses the minibus to transport his agricultural products to the market. He has planted one ha of Moldova sort vine. Last year he had trouble achieving grapes; they cost four lei for one kg and take the money received with delay. This year he wants to plant 0.5-1 ha of potatoes and onions. He grows wheat and corn for his household needs and he sells the surplus to the collectors of wheat. This loan was used to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and payment services.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and payment services.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris tiene 32 años, es natural de la Ciudad de Ancash, vive con su esposo Jose Carlos, el cual es de la Ciudad de Puno, ambos viven en su casa propia con sus hijos Brenda de 8 años y Marco Antonio de 2. Ellos son una familia muy unida, tanto es así que Iris y su esposo trabajan juntos en el servicio de trasporte, con diferentes rutas a los distritos de Lima, él es chofer y ella se dedica a la cobranza de pasajes. Con esta labor ambos mantienen los gastos de su hogar desde hace 8 años, y les gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que les permite estar juntos durante todo el día, pero el trabajo es cansado y muchas veces los pasajeros no son amables, pero son dificultades que saben afrontar de muy buena manera, además los ingresos son buenos, ya que la ruta que ellos siguen es muy concurrida y siempre tienen el minibus con muchos pasajeros. Lamentablemente esta unidad no es propia, y es por eso que ambos esperan con el tiempo comprar su propio minibús. Iris se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, alentada por una amiga para sacar un crédito en un grupo, es así que espera ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con en dinero que está solicitando refaccionará las pequeñas averías en los asientos del minibus en el que trabaja, para poder brindar un mejor servicio. Con otra parte del dinero desea comprar los útiles de su pequeña que ya comienza el año académico en la escuela.
texts.en:
Iris is 32 years old and is from the city of Ancash. She lives in her own home with her husband Jose Carlos, who is from Puno, and their children Brenda, 8 and Marco Antonio, 2. They are a very close family and Iris and her husband work together. They have a transportation service with different routes around Lima. He is the driver and she collects money from the passengers. With this work they have supported their household for the past 8 years and they both like the work since it allows them to be together the whole day. However, the work is tiring and many times the passengers are not kind. These are difficulties that they have learned to overcome and they earn decent money, since the route they drive is very busy and their minibus is always full of passengers. Unfortunately they do not own the minibus and they hope to purchase their own minibus in the future. This is Iris’ first loan with MFP, she was encouraged by a friend to take out a loan with the group. She hopes to be very punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will repair some damages and tears to the seats in the bus, in order to offer a better service for their customers. She would also like to buy some school supplies for her daughter since the school year is beginning.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to her minibus

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is a single parent who cares for her four children. Loveth is 37 years old and she is a native of Edo State, but lives in Lagos for greener pasture. Loveth sells drinks and cooked food in her shop and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Loveth needs a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase drinks and a generator (to cool her drinks in case there is a power failure). She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and one generator

loans.name: Dildorhon

texts.ru: Дилдорхон и ее муж занимаются предпринимательством – продают мужские брюки. Постоянного места для торговли не имеют и ездят по окрестным рынкам. На больших базарах им еще помогает старшая дочь. Дилдорхон 43 года, воспитывает 4 детей. Больше  года сотрудничает с МикроИнвест и проблем с погашением не было. Сейчас собирается получить новый займ и планирует приобрести весенний ассортимент брюк. Новый займ планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dildorhon and her husband are small business owners - they mainly sell men's pants. They don't have a permanent spot, and for this reason, they travel to different markets. Their older daughter occasionally helps them when they visit large markets. Dildorhon is 43 years old and has 4 children. She has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year and never had problems with repayment of her loan. At this moment, she would like to obtain a new loan so she could purchase pants for the new spring season. She plans to pay off this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for the new spring season

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth C., age 39,  is married with three children ages 16, 12 and 9.  A grand child orphan of her late sister in law also stays with her.  She sells food at Ilala, a small place just few kilometers from city center.  She started her business in 2005 and works daily from 6.45am until 5pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $154.

This will be Elizabeth’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase capital, buy vouchers for sale and make a cupboard for chips. She repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to expand her business and also to start selling chips.
	
Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which totals 20 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Elizabeth is first from right, front row.

loans.use: To start selling chips and expand the food and voucher business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is happily married with six children. She is 45 years old. Lydia sells foodstuffs and kerosene at Igbo-elerin market, which is in the community where she lives. Lydia needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Serghei

texts.en: L. Serghei’s business is at the initial stage. Until present, he worked for his sister, who manages a business with retail marketing of various goods, as the sender. Now he has created a family and he has started his own business. The business location is in Cirnesti village, Nisporeni district. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a refrigerated display case, scales, shelves, and goods. Purchase of goods per month will be 15,000 lei; monthly income of 20,000 lei achievements. Future plans are enlarging his assortment and expansion of business using profits earned.

loans.use: purchasing a refrigerated display case, scales, shelves and goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 42 años convive con su pareja de 52 años, quien se dedica al transporte y con sus 3 hijos; Katherine de 21, Miguel Angel de 19 y Joswan de 7, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, dándole más comodidad ya que al mismo tiempo puede dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, especialmente al pequeño Joswan que aún necesita de sus cuidados. Su hija mayor, la cual tiene un bebé y quien aparece en la fotografía (su madre había salido a traer mercadería) también la ayuda en la atención de la tienda cuando ella sale por alguna urgencia, gracias a su ayuda ha podido abastecerse para la atención a la clientela. A María le gusta mucho la atención al público, que requiere de mucha paciencia, la cual ella posee en cantidades. Su negocio siempre es muy concurrido y los productos que vende se agotan rápidamente, es por eso que necesita salir a comprar más mercadería, dejando a su hija en la atención. Katherine es muy feliz apoyando a su mamá, ya que el negocio los beneficia a todos, y en el futuro espera seguir trabajando para que el negocio de su mamá crezca mucho más. También nos cuenta que su madre quiere abrir unas cabinas de Internet, comprar televisores y video juegos para alquilarlos a los jóvenes del barrio y tener con ellos otro mercado que explotar. María se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, prometiendo ser muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunos muebles y computadoras de 2do uso para sus cabinas de internet.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives in a house she owns with her 52-year-old partner who is in transportation as well as with her three children: Katherine, 21; Miguel Angel, 19; and Joswan, 7. She has a store located in her home which makes it easier for her to care for her children at the same time as the business, particularly little Joswan who still needs to be watched over. Her eldest daughter, who has a baby of her own and who is pictured (her mother had gone out to buy merchandise) also helps María taking care of the business when she needs to go out; thanks to her help she has been able to stock up in order to take care of the customers. María enjoys serving her clients very much as it requires a great deal of patience, a quality she has plenty of. Her store is always busy and the goods she offers sell out quickly. Because of this she needs to go out to buy more merchandise, during which times she leaves her daughter in charge of the business. Katherine is very happy to help her mother because the business benefits the entire family and in the future she hopes to continue workings so that her mother's business grows a lot more. She also tells us that her mother wants to open internet booths, to buy televisions and video games to rent to the youth of the neighbourhood and in this way take advantage of a new opportunity. This is María's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she promises to be very responsible and punctual in her repayments. She will use the loan to buy some furniture and second-hand computers for her internet booths.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and computers in order to provide internet services

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mebel sells coolers. She travels to Leome to buy her coolers (a journey of about 5 hours by bus) and she travels once a month. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Mebel is 50 years old and married, with 2 children. Mebel needs a loan of N 140,000 to purchase more coolers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more coolers to sell

loans.name: Ifeyinwa

texts.en: Ifeyinwa is a fashion designer and she also sells fabrics. She learned her business in a year, and she has been in this business for the past 3 years. Ifeyinwa is 34 years old and is married with 5 children. Ifeyinwa lives in Okoko and she is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase cloth and a sewing machine so that she can satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and a sewing machine

loans.name: Adishirin

texts.en:
Adishirin F. is a family man who wants to expand his business so that he can better support his family (wife and three sons) and give them a better quality of life. After finishing university, Adishirin started selling spare parts for various types of cars and repairing cars. His business has grown little by little and now offers a variety of products.

His experience and deep knowledge in cars has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers, and support his family. Adishirin has applied to borrow 1225 USD to buy new goods for his store. He wants to expand his business and increase his income to create a better life for his family.

loans.use: purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en:
Kojo S. is a single parent with 2 children; he has received schooling through the primary level. Since 2008, Kojo has sold groceries such as milk, "Milo" (cocoa powder), canned products, rice and cosmetics at Abrobiano near Elmina.

Kojo uses his income to provide food, clothing, and other basic needs for the family. Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of groceries to help meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of his business.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase the sale of groceries

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has worked growing vegetables for more than 16 years; she has two greenhouses with a total area of 180 m2. She grows tomatoes, cabbage and fibber. In the previous year of this activity, she achieved a profit of more than 21,000 lei. This year she wants to buy seeds in the already well-advanced growth stage in Chisinau City. She also wants to buy film for her greenhouses, which will be procured from Romania. Maria performs all the work that is necessary: control, execution, production, etc. She has been in the business for more than 5 years. Maria decided to borrow a loan from Microinvest to purchase film and seedlings needed for vegetables. The business is profitable but is subject to several risks: climate, diseases, technology failure. Maria holds additional agricultural land that she could use to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase film and seedlings

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin A. is an experienced and energetic man who wants to improve his family's living conditions. He is 37 years old and married with two children. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for foreign cars. He has been involved in this business for more than six years, helping his father before he opened his own shop. He provides spare parts for cars and provides his family with food and other necessities. There is a great demand for Aydin's spare parts, so he wants to buy more goods to meet his clients' demands. He wants to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop's inventory. He promises to repay this loan within 15 months. Aydin is happy about this loan and thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop's inventory

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 32 años, está casada con Pedro de 40, viven en su casa propia con sus 5 hijos; Wilmer de 18, Luis de 16, Pedro de 14, Jhosep de 12 y Edson de 3. Se dedica al bordado de vestidos en su casa, su negocio consiste en adornar con mostacillas, lentejuelas y pedrería los vestidos que le entrega una amiga suya que los compra al por mayor, pagándole una cierta cantidad de dinero por cada vestido. A su vez Liliana al no abastecerse con tantos vestidos, recurre a sus amigas dejándoles cierta cantidad para que la ayuden con la decoración dándoles un porcentaje de su paga. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede explotar toda su creatividad en ello, además los ingresos son al momento, pero aún así quisiera tener algo más estable que pueda administrar desde su casa, es así que ha pensado en poner una tienda de abarrotes, esto le permitiría estar más tiempo con su familia y generar más ingresos. Liliana se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual y responsable en los pagos, además está muy contenta con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cantidad de materiales para la decoración de vestidos y así poder generar los suficientes ingresos para poder implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32 years old and married to Pedro, who is 40. They live in their own home with their five children: Wilmer, 18, Luis, 16, Pedro, 14, Jhosep, 12, and Edson, 3. She works embroidering dresses in her home. Her business consists of decorating dresses that her friend buys in bulk. She decorates with beads, sequins, and stones. She is then paid a set amount of money for each dress. So that she does not have work pile up, Liliana has her friends help with some of the work so they can decorate dresses and then she pays them a percentage of her pay. She likes her job very much since she can employ all of her creativity, and also because the earnings are immediate. Even so, she would like to have something more stable that she could run from her home, and so she has thought about installing a small grocery store. This would allow her to spend more time with her family and generate more income. Liliana is now in her third loan with Microfinanzas Prismo, having been very punctual and responsible with the payments. She is also very happy with her community bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy more dress decorating materials to be able to earn enough to start her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo hace 3 años gracias a la Sra. Irene Chera quien es vecina de las integrantes.
El presente comité se encuentra, en su noveno ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra.Cecilia C. que tiene 45 años , tiene 4 hijos varones  que se quedan en la casa con el hermano mayor mientras ella se  va al negocio para ejercer su oficio de peluquera y tambien  vende ropa interior de la marca Kalua . Por la mañana visita a sus clientas para ofrecer su mercaderia, y por la tarde se la ubica en su peluqueria. Viene haciendo ya bastante tiempo esta actividad, la que es su principal fuente de ingreso para mantener y educar a sus hijos. Esta Sra. se destaca por su buen trato hacia los demas, es por eso que la designaron como Pta. del grupo, labor que tambien viene ejerciendo eficientemente y sin descuidar sus demas actividades. 
Agrega tambien que en el principio de su actividad como peluquera le fue dificil de formar una clientela estable, situacion la cual le llevo a tener varios problemas economicos, que despues con el tiempo y gracias a su esfurzo y constante capacitacion logro superar satisfactoriamente. 
En una de sus entrevistas y reuniones semanales, ella nos cuenta que ,”Agradezco a la Fundacion Paraguaya por ayudarme a mi y a mi familia a progresar y  tambien a mi comunidad”termina diciendo.

Cecilia C. 	     Peluquera
Mercedes H.     Vta de Frutas y verduras
Ana C.	     Venta de Comestible
Martha P.       Vta de ropas usadas
Myrna P. 	     Kiosco
Griselda O.   Venta de Crochet 
Celia M. 	     Vta de ropas
Gloria A. 	     Venta de lenceria
Carmen V.    Venta de comidas
Edilia W.        Peluquera
Rocio R.	     Vta de ropas
Feliciana V. 	Costurera
Rosa Maria Cabaña	Vta de articulos de limpieza
Maria Auxiliadora V.   	Vta de ropas
Soledad A.  	Vta de comidas
Maria Susana G.   Vta de ropas
Felicita A. 	Vta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
This group was formed 3 years ago thanks to Mrs. Irene Chera, who is a neighbor of the group members. The group its in its ninth loan cycle. As an example we can describe, Mrs. Cecilia C., 45 years old, who has 4 sons that stay at home with their older brother while she goes to work as a hair stylist as well as selling Kalua brand underwear. In the morning, she visits her clients to offer them her merchandise and in the afternoon she is in the beauty salon. She has been doing this for some time now and is her main source of income to support and educate her sons. She stands out for her good treatment of the other group members and that's why they designated her as the president of the group, a job that she executes efficiently without neglecting her other activities. We can add that upon her job as a hair stylist it was difficult to form a stable client base, which caused her to have various economic problems, but with time, and thanks to her effort and constant training she was able to make it through. In one of her interviews and weekly meetings, she says "I thank Fundación Paraguaya for helping me and my family to progress, as well as my community". Group Members: Cecilia C. Hair Stylist Mercedes H. Seller of fruits and vegetables Ana C. Seller of groceries Martha P. Seller of used clothing Myrna P. Kiosco Griselda O. Seller of crochet Celia M. Seller of clothing Gloria A. Seller of lingerie Carmen V. Seller of food Edilia W. Hair stylist Rocio R. Seller of clothing Feliciana V. Seamstress Rosa Maria Cabaña Seller of cleaning products Maria Auxiliadora V. Seller of clothing Soledad A. Seller of food Maria Susana G. Seller of clothing Felicita A. Seller of cosmetics

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: cleaning products, fruits, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Afras

texts.en: This is Afras E.. He is 29 years old and lives in Imishli city, where he runs a retail shop to support his family. In his shop, Afras sells spare parts for many different types of foreign cars. He has worked in this business for the last two years. He hopes to increase his income and get married this year. To do this, he needs to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to better meet the needs of his customers. The loan will be repaid within 15 months. Afras is happy to be able to apply for this loan and thanks everyone for their trust. He promises to be precise in making loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married with five dependent children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells rice and bread at Abrobiano near Elmina, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to help financially support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Mary will use the loan to purchase additional stocks to enable her to increase sales of rice and bread to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest in order to expand her trade.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks of rice and bread

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married. He sells clothing and other items at the central market in Tyachevo, which is a small town in the Striy region. Peter has been in this business for nine years. He knows his business well and offers his clients what they need. Peter's business goal is to open a second location and serve even more clients.

Peter would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to increase his assortment of inventory. He says that the loans help him in his business, providing more opportunities for purchasing better inventories.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo Bernardo en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual tiene en su propia casa y en la cual aparte de comestibles, vende también prendas de vestir tejidas a mano, las cuales ella misma elabora gracias a lo aprendido de joven. Adicionalmente, da clases de tejido y manualidades en el hospital de su zona, ayudando a las personas de la tercera edad a sentirse más útiles. Sus ”viejitos” como de cariño les dice, también quieren mucho a Rosario, ya que siempre está muy alegre y desbordante de alegría, y no es difícil dejar de quererla, pues su magnética personalidad hace que cause ese efecto en todos los que la conocen, es por eso que tiene gran cantidad de clientela, siendo su negocio muy rentable. En el futuro quiere tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer cremoladas, jugos y otros productos, para eso necesita un local más grande. Rosario es una cliente muy fiel a MFP, ya tiene muchos préstamos con esta intitución, pero este es su primer crédito individual, fuera de su banco comunal, y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una reja para poder agrandar el espacio de su tienda hacia el exterior, poner mesas para que la clientela pueda consumir los productos al aire libre, esto hará que tenga más espacio y mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 62 years old and lives with her husband Bernardo in a house that was left to her by her parents. She is a very happy and charismatic woman who runs a small shop in her home. In addition to groceries, Rosario's shop sells clothing that she makes by hand, utilizing a skill she learned as a child. She also gives classes in crocheting and handicrafts to elderly people at the local hospital, helping them feel more useful. Her “old folks,” as she affectionately calls them, love her, as she is always very kind and overflowing with happiness. It is easy to love Rosario, as her magnetic personality has this effect on everyone who knows her. Because of this, she has a very large clientele and that makes for a very profitable business. In the future, Rosario would like to have a large shop where she can sell smoothies, juices, and other items. For this, she will need to expand her storefront.

Rosario is a very loyal client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has already received many loans. This is her first loan as an individual, not as a member of a community bank, and she promises to be very punctual in its repayment. With this loan she will purchase a railing to expand her shop outside and will install tables so that her customers can enjoy their purchases in the open air. This will enable her to have more space and more security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her shop to provide better customer service

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. began selling food supplies like gari (fried cassava), biscuits and rice in Abrobiano near Elmina at the beginning of this year. Efua has received no formal education. She is married and has six dependent children. Her husband is employed as a farmer. She is responsible for helping to financially support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales of food supplies like gari, biscuits and rice to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: As additional capital to increase sales of food supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells kitchen items. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. Grace is 50 years old and married with four children. Grace has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She lives in Adaloko in the Lagos state.

Grace is requesting a loan of N70,000 to enable her to buy more kitchen items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.en:
Lidia Marina A. C. is a married, 45-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has four children ranging in age from 14 to 20, all two years apart. They all presently work and live at home with the family.

Lidia Marina operates a small butcher stand that sells pork. She would like to borrow money in order to purchase two more pigs for sale. For this reason, Lidia Marina seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has previously received loans from Fundación León, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the stand’s monthly revenue. Lidia Marina dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and save enough money to provide a sound education for her children.

Lidia Marina A. C. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: To purchase two pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, underwear, ready-made clothes and baby items to sell

loans.name: Irene Janeth

texts.en:
Irene Janeth V. T. is a married, 29-year old micro-business entrepreneur. Irene Janeth has two children, who are 14 and 1 and in various stages of education. They both live at home with the family.

Irene Janeth operates a small general store that sells general food and beverages, cosmetics, and other basic products for the home. She would like to borrow money in order to further diversify her inventory of products, and for this primary reason, Irene Janeth seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has received nine loans from Fundación León in the past, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the store’s monthly revenue. Irene Janeth dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and save enough money to provide a sound education for her children.

Irene Janeth V. T. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara Q. has sold used clothing and rechargeable mobile phone credits at Agona, near Elmina since 2008.

Barbara received a junior high education and is married with no children. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and mobile phone recharge credits to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Barbara hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house which she and her husband will share.

loans.use: Buy more used clothing and mobile phone recharge credits.

loans.name: Teodora Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Teodora A. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 4to año de educación secundaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Teodora se dedica a la venta de golosinas y menú los cuales los ofrece al los pescadores en el muelle, trabaja con pedidos los cuales son hechos para las personas que laboran en el muelle de Salaverry, su negocio lo desarrolla entre su casa y el negocio ambulatorio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para la preparación de menú.
Con el crédito de 300 soles , que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá todo en su negocio 
Teodora tiene como sueño, ampliar sus momentos de recreación con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora A. is 35 years old. She lives in the Salaverry district in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad. She studied up to the 4th year of her secondary education. She has 3 children who are economically dependent upon her. Teodora sells meals and sweets to the fishermen on the wharf. She works on orders for the people who work on the Salaverry wharf. Her business takes places between her house and her street sales. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her bank, “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverrry II”, she bought supplies for meal preparation. She will put this entire loan of 300 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, into her business. Teodora’s dream is to spend more recreational time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying the necessary supplies for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena T., es casada, tiene 2 hijas, una de ellas se encuentra en el exterior trabajando y estudiando, tambien la otra hija ya trabaja y ya está casada,  inició con un capital de Gs. 1.000.000.- son $ 200.- aproximadamente, en el rubro de macaterìa es decir venta de mercaderías en gral en forma ambulatoria (casa por casa), que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señora Elena,  retira el préstamo para la compra de joyas, variedad de bijouteries, carteras de conocidas marcas y otros accesorios de belleza de esta forma renovaría su stock, para dar satisfacción a todos los clientes quienes ya le hicieron sus pedidos.

Uno de sus apiraciones es poder abrir un salón comercial próximamente, refaccionando su vivienda y asi podría ampliar el negocio en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena T. is married and has two daughters. One of the daughters is usually outside working and studying. The other daughter is married and works. With approximately $200, Elena started her business selling door to door. Through the years her business has grown, and she has secured many customers. The area where she sells is very populated and crowded. Elena will use the loan to buy jewels, a variety of jewelry, brand name wallets and other beauty accessories. This way she will update her stock and make her customers, who have already placed orders, happy. One of her aspirations is to be able to refurbish her home to be able to open a commercial salon. With new furnishings she would make her customers more comfortable, and therefore increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewels, jewlery, wallets and accessories

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  de l’association Djekafo est composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la  ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage. Elles exercent  presque la même activité de vente d’habillement de toutes sortes (pour homme, femme et enfant) et des fruits et légumes.  
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son neuvième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des légumes et des nouveautés (habits qui sont à la mode) pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de les solliciter.
 Elles s’approvisionnent en bazin à Bamako (capitale du Mali), les brodés  viennent de Lomé (la capitale Togolaise) les tissus légers  pour homme  du Burkina faso. Quant aux légumes, ils sont achetés au marché de Sikasso au fur et à mesure qu’ils sont vendus. Les habits sont vendus dans la ville de  Koutiala et environnants où elles ont des clients fidèles. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 155 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en élargissant leur entreprise avec l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente d’habits.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi of the association Djekafo is composed of five married women who average 35 years of age and 3 children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and do almost the same work selling clothing of all kinds (for men, women, and children) and fruit and vegetables.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing customer base, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their ninth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The members intend to use this loan to buy vegetables and novel items (in-style clothing) in order to satisfy their ever-demanding customers. Supplies of damask fabrics are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali); embroidery, from Lomé (capital of togo); light weight fabrics for men, from Burkina Faso. As for the vegetables, they are gotten on an ongoing basis at the Sikasso market as they are sold. The clothing is sold in and around the city of Koutiala, where the group members have loyal customers.

They each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 155,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in their commerce by expanding their enterprise with the opening of a clothing shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and vegetables

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.en:
Lidia Mercedes is a happily married, 43-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has two children, ages ten and twenty, both of whom are in various stages of education. They live at home with the family.

Lidia operates a small store that sells clothing products of all types and sizes, specializing in shoe products as well. She would like to diversify her inventory of products, and for this primary reason, Lidia seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders.

She has received loans from Fundación León in the past, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the store’s monthly revenue. One day, Lidia would like to purchase her own business space, as the current one is being shared with her mother, who operates a separate business.

Lidia Mercedes would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Buy more clothing products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nematillo

texts.ru: Нематилло занимается частным извозом на своей машине. Ему 44 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Его жена безработная и чтобы занять ее Нематилло приспособил маленькое помещение у себя дома под магазинчик. Клиентами являются все его соседи. Его жена продает там разные мелкие товары и продукты питания, а Нематилло привозит ей товары. Прибыль от магазинчика покрывает разные мелкие расходы семьи. Нематилло собирается получить займ и вложив его в магазинчик расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Nematillo is a private driver with his own car. He is 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. His wife is unemployed and in order to employ her Nematillo converted a small space in his home into a store. The customers are all of his neighbors. His wife sells miscellaneous small products and food items there. Nematillo brings her products to sell. Profits from the store cover a variety of small family expenditures. Nematillo plans to take out a loan and by investing it into the business expand the product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unite) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi de l’association Kotognontala est un regroupement de sept femmes du  deuxième quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6  enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités,  vente en gros de condiments, pâtes alimentaires, chaussures, céréales et habillements..
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125 000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt du groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l’ail, des gros oignons de Niono, des cartons de macaroni provenant du Ghana, de Dakar et  divers autres produits  venant d’Abidjan (la capitale ivoirienne) et de Bamako ( la capitale du Mali). Ces  femmes vendent leurs produits exclusivement au grand marché de koutiala.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 130 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle.. En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles comptent utiliser une partie de leurs revenus  pour payer la scolarité des enfants et faire face aux maladies. Dans les jours à venir elles comptent  diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités telle l’ouverture d’un magasin de vente des produits divers.
texts.en:
Benkadi of the association Kotognontala is a group of seven women of the 2nd district of the city of Koutiala who know one another well. They are married mothers who average 38 years of age and have at least 6 children each. They do different work, selling condiments, pasta, shoes, grains, and clothing at the wholesale level.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amount has gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 125,000 francs for the fourth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice, some garlic, big onions from Niono, boxes of macaroni from Ghana and Dakar, and various other goods from Abidjan (capital of Cote d'Ivoire) and from Bamako (capital of Mali). These women sell their goods exclusively at the grand marketplace of Koutiala.

With this new loan, the women intend to realize an average of 130,00 francs of profit in the course of this cycle. Besides repaying loans, they intend to use part of their revenues for covering the children's school costs and for coping with illnesses. In the years to come, they plan to diversify their commerce by embracing other businesses, such as opening a store for selling various good.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en:
Juan Ramon S. is a married, 63-year old micro business entrepreneur. He has a 34 year-old son who works and lives with his own family.

Juan has been operating a bicycle buy and repair shop for the last ten years. He would like to increase his inventory of bicycle parts and full outfits. For this reason, he seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders.

He has previously received loans from Fundación León to help supplement his income, but now desires a loan for specific business development. Juan dreams of making enough money to one day make improvements to his home and provide his wife with few financial worries during their retirement.

Juan Ramon S. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping him improve him life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Purchase more bicycle repair supplies.

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma  de l’association Balimaya est composé de cinq femmes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage. Elles exercent  presque la même activité de restauration avec la vente de macaroni de haricot et d’ atiéké. En plus de la restauration,  elles font également le tricotage de laine (pour faire des layettes et des châles destinés à la vente). 
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouma  a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son dixième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de haricot, des cartons de macaroni, de laines et un lot important de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des producteurs et des grossistes de la place. 
Les layettes et châles sont vendus   à la maison et sur commande et les nourritures sont vendues la nuit devant la porte de leurs maisons   ou au carrefour. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group of the Balimaya association is composed of five married women, who average 38 years of age and 5 children. They live in extended traditional families in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). The got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood. They are all almost in the same field of business, namely catering, selling bean macaroni and atiéké (granulated cassava). In addition, they also knit wool into layettes and shawls that they sell).

In order to satisfy its ever-increasing clientele, the Sabougnouma group decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its tenth solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. The women intend to use this loan to buy sacks of beans, boxes of macaroni, wool, and a large amount of condiments. They get their supplies from producers and wholesalers in Koutiala. The layettes and the shawls are sold at home and on commission, whereas the food is sold in the evening in front of their house, or at crossroads. During this cycle, they hope to turn an average profit of XOF 55'000 (ca US$ 110) each, to be used to repay the loan and to provide for their extended families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for their food-serving businesses, and wool to knit layettes and shawls

loans.name: Mujeres En Ritmo Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres en ritmo” se formó con la intención de sus integrantes de mejora su calidad de vida, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, reciben un crédito promedio de 300.000 y lo utilizaran para ampliar y diversificar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc, compra -venta de ropas de ocsión para su posterior venta. Anhelan un futuro con mas oportunidades para sus hijos, con tal razón redoblan esfuerzos para disminuir las necesidades del hogar , y poder brindarles oportunidades para estudiar y optar por un buen trabajo.   

Idalina V.	  Vta de carbón
Ramona I. 	  Vta de carbon
Delia Pereira	  Vta de mercaderias varias
Heliodora de Centurión	Vta de barros medicinales
Felipa A.	  Vta de articulos de limpieza
Noelia V.	  Vta de comestibles
Carmen L.  	  Vta de cmestibles
Mariela S. 	Vta de comestibles
Adriana M.	  Vta de comestibles y despensa
Nancy Cabañas	  Vta de merceria
Epifania J.	Vta de comestibles
Griselda TalaV.	Vta de cd´s
Elva D.	  Vta de ropas
Maria de TalaV.	Vta de chipas
Natalia TalaV.	Fca y venta de productos de limpieza
texts.en:
The “Mujeres in Ritmo” committee was formed with the intention to better the members’ quality of life. The group members already carry out a productive activity. They will receive an average loan of 300,000 PYG that will be used to amplify and diversity the activities in which they are currently engaged, such as: the purchase of supplies for food preparation; to purchase milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, baked goods, and vegetables to be later sold; to purchase beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wine, etc; to purchase and sell formalwear. The group members long for a future with greater opportunities for their children, and for that reason they double their efforts to diminish household necessities to be able to offer them opportunities to study and find a good job. Idalina V. Charcoal sales Ramona I. Charcoal sales Delia Pereira Sale of assorted merchandise Heliodora de Centurión Medicinal mud sales Felipa A. Cleaning supplies sales Noelia V. Food sales Carmen L. Food sales Mariela S. Food sales Adriana M. Food sales and storage Nancy Cabañas Sewing supplies sales Epifania J. Food sales Griselda TalaV. CD sales Elva D. Clothing sales Maria de TalaV. “Chipas” (traditional breads) sales Natalia TalaV. Production and sale of cleaning supplies

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk; to purchase sugar; to prepare and sell traditional foods such as: sausage, blood sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc; to purchase materials to make cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. M. is a married, 52-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has a 16 year-old son who is in school and living at home with his family.

Rosa grows and sells grains and rice to local customers. She would like to borrow money in order to purchase an ox to help plow the land and harvest the crops. For this reason, Rosa seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has previously received loans from Fundación León, and each one has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the viability of her crops.

Rosa dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and purchase two more acres of farmland.

Rosa A. M. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Purchase an ox to plow field.

loans.name: Kotognontala (Soyons   Unie) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe kotognontala  sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 42 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe kotognontala  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Massakina du village de Dah, de la préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent  la même activité de vente d’arachide, de poudre de feuille de baobab et sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe kotognontala a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de feuilles de baobab séchées et d’arachide dans le marché de la localité. Ces produits  sont vendus en gros  au marché de San et à Bobo (au Burkina Faso).
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 60 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un fonds suffisant pour braser en même temps le commerce de pagne de Bobo.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Kotognontala group are all married and average 42 years of age and 5 children. The members of the group live in large extended traditional families in the Massakina neighborhood (village of Dah, San Prefecture, in the Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. They are in the same field of business, selling peanuts and powdered baobab leaves. They are very much in demand in this business.

To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, the group solved his problems by joining Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its first solidarity loan (group loan). The women intend to use the loan to buy sacks of dried baobab leaves and sacks of peanuts at the local market. These products are sold wholesale at the San market and in Bobo (in Burkina Faso). During this cycle, they hope to turn an average profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 120) each, to be used to repay the loan, and to provide for their extended families. They will invest the remainder in their businesses. They ambition to have a sufficient working capital to start selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) in Bobo.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts and sacks of dried baobab leaves

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Sabougnouma de l’association Benkadi  sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 44 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Massakina du village de Dah, de la préfecture de San (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de piment et de cuirs. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouma a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de piment séché avec les jardiniers de la localité. Quant  à la peau, elle est achetée avec les bouchers de la localité. Ces femmes se sont  spécialisées dans le tannage de la peau, un métier qu’elles ont appris avec les parents. Les produits  sont vendus   au marché de San et à la maison.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women of the Sabougnouma ("the good cause") group of the Benkadi association are all married; their average age is around 44, and they have 5 children on average. The members of the Sabougnouma group live in big traditional extended families in the Massakina neighborhood of the village of Dah, Prefecture of San (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali).

They met through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. They have almost the same businesses: selling hot peppers and leather. They are much in sought after in these activities. To satisfy the demand of their ever-growing clientele, the Sabougnouma group found a solution to their problems in joining the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are currently on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

They intend to use the loan to buy sacks of dried hot peppers from the market gardeners in their area. As for hides, they are purchased from local butchers. These women have become specialists in tanning hides, a trade they learned from their parents. Their products are sold in the marketplace at San and out of their homes.

They each hope to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, money that will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover their extended familes' needs, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hot peppers and hides for tanning

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo sells hair extension and is also a stylist. She is 30 years old and married with four children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and lives in the Adeloko Lagos state.

Omo needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more hair extensions, dryer and washing basing in order to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase a dryer and washing basing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia A., es casada, actualmente vive su pareja  tambien le ayuda en el negocio, tiene una sola hija, quien ya es mayor de edad,  se encuentra en el exterior trabajando quien de esta manera tambien le ayuda para la economía familiar. El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio pues se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, y tambien a la compra y venta de bebidas y helados  
La señora Sonia retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería  como remeras, short, blusas, zapatos,  y otros. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 06:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.
El proyecto a largo plazo es la de llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida de ropas en general para niños y adultos.-
texts.en:
Sonia A. is married and lives with her partner who helps her in her business. She has one adult daughter who works outside the country and in this way helps her with the family finances. Her business is in her home: she buys and sells clothing as well as refreshments and ice cream. Sonia will use the loan to buy a variety of clothing articles such as shirts, shorts, blouses, shoes, and so on. She starts her work very early in the day, at about 6:00 A.M. in order to buy everything she needs for her business. Her long-term goal is to have a well-stocked clothing store with clothes for children as well as for adults.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing items such as shirts, shorts, blouses, shoes and so on

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Humu M. is 52 years old.  She is married and has given birth to two daughters.  Both are married and living with their husbands. 

Humu's husband is currently jobless due to an eye problem.  Humu is a food vendor.  She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 
 
Humu prepares and sells a local dish called "Kokonte."  It is produced from cassava flour.  She buys the cassava from farmers in her community.  The peeled cassava is dried in the sun for days and milled into fine flour.  Kokonte is served hot with soup and many Ghanaians enjoy it for breakfast.

With the loan, she wants to procure cassava flour and other ingredients in bulk to improve the quality of her meal to win additional customers.

loans.use: Buy maize and food ingredients.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora María Victoria P. se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas las cuales son comercializadas en su establecimiento donde a diario atiende a sus clientes ofreciendo las frutas.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y por este motivo es que ella espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Mayoreo of Managua, María Victoria P. works selling fruit which she sells from her stand, serving customers daily. She is hoping to receive this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy fruit and is confidently expecting to receive her loan which will allow her to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Abduvakhob

texts.ru: Абдувахоб занимается двумя видами деятельности – куплей продажей сухофруктов по базарным дням и по будним дням занимается частным извозом на своей машине. Ему 32 года, женат, двое детей. Жена нигде не работает, помогает мужу в его бизнесе – она сортирует сухофрукты дома. Прибыль Абдувахоба от купли продажи сухофруктов составляет в среднем 20 -30 процентов от вложенного и достигает максимума, если сухофрукты отсортированы. Абдувахоб подал заявку на займ и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abduvakhob works two jobs: buying and selling dried fruit on market days and, on week days, making deliveries in his car. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. His wife does not work, but she helps her husband with his business. She sorts dried fruit at home. Abduvakhob’s profit on buying and selling dried fruit averages 20-30 percent on his investment and is maximized when the fruit is sorted. Abduvakhob has applied for a loan and is going to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 40 years old. She is a widow and mother of three children, one son and two daughters.

The last born is in primary school while the first two are out of school and learning trades. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.

Akosua is into trading. She sells ready-made textiles such as ladies’ dresses, fabrics, etc. She buys from Accra and treks to markets in nearby markets to sell. She also hawks, selling in her community. Akosua has been in this business for seven years.

She wants a loan to procure more goods in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin to cater to her children.

loans.use: Buy ready-made textiles.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is 34 years old. She is married and a mother of four children, all males. According to her, her first son is in senior high school. The rest are in junior high school. Afia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company.

Afia works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She sells smoked fish in the local market. She has been in this business for 23 years and been endowed with rich experiences. She buys the smoked fish all the way from the northern part of the country. Afia wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles inició el negocio porque ya que aprendio este oficio de su madre y cuando tuvo complicaciones financieras lo vio como una posibilidad para salir adelante, entonces  empezó a ofrecer sus servicios de costurera,  hace aproximadamente 5 años

Inicio solo con una maquina sobrehiladora que le heredo su mama haciendo trabajos  sencillos pero al paso del tiempo tomo cursos sobre patrones de costura lo cual le dio la experiencia para elaborar uniformes escolares y disfraces para toda ocasión

Actualmente le va muy bien, ya que cerca de su casa se encuentra una escuela con la que ya tiene tiempo de hacer sus uniformes también le dan trabajo algunas empresas de la localidad para que les maquile sus uniformes industriales, ademas puso un puesto de venta de perfumes en un mercado que se instala sobre la calle donde ella vive, lo que le da otros ingresos adicionales.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas ya que tiene planeado comprar material de trabajo como: telas, botones, hilos, zipper, etc... para hacer los disfraces de la primavera ya que en los colegios de la localidad  ya tiene algunos pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles began the business because she had learned this trade from her mother and at a time when she was facing financial complications she saw it as a possibility to get ahead in life. She began to offer her services as a seamstress approximately 5 years ago. She began with only one sowing machine that she inherited from her mother by doing simple jobs, and as time passed she took classes on sowing patterns that gave her the experience to assemble school uniforms and costumes for all occasions.
