Currently things are going very well for her, given that a school is located near her house for which she has made uniforms for some time. She also gets work from various local companies assembling their industrial uniforms; in addition, she installed a perfume sales stand in the market located on the street where she lives, which gives her an additional form of income. She needs a loan of 4,000 MXN that she will pay in 10 installments, given that she is planning on purchasing work materials such as: fabric, buttons, thread, zippers, etc., to assemble the spring costumes that have already been requested by local schools.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials such as: fabrics, buttons, threads, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen inició el negocio por la necesidad de solventar sus gastos personales porque cuando se divorcio se quedo con algunas deudas pendientes de liquidar. Comenzó el negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años vendiendo frituras y tostadas después cuando tuvo algunas utilidades,  decidio iniciar el negocio de venta perfumeria y joyeria por catalogo
 Al principio pocos confiaban en ella ya que tenia poca experiencia,  y no podía hacer un buen cierre de ventas, pero eso no la desanimo al contrario le dio fuerzas para sobreponerse a todas las adversidades que se le pudieran encontrar y finalmente consiguió ser una de las mejores vendedoras de la zona incluso ha ganado premios con las empresas para las que labora.


Ahora necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía porque se acerca la temporada de primavera y sus clientes buscaran las tendencia de la temporada por lo que le gustaría poder entregar los productos lo mas rápido posible  y así no perder clientes.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen began her business due to her necessity to settle some personal expenses because when she divorced she was left with some pending debt to liquidate. She began the business approximately 5 years ago selling fried goods and tostadas (a fried corn tortilla dish). Later, when she had earned some profits, she decided to begin a business selling perfumes and jewelry through catalogs. In the beginning, few believed in her given that she had little experience, and she was not able to close deals well, but that didn’t discourage her, on the contrary, it gave her the strength to overcome any adversities that she might come across. Finally, she was able to become one of the best saleswomen in the area and has even won prizes from the company that she works for. She now needs a loan of 4,000 MXN that she will pay in 10 installments to purchase merchandise because the spring season is nearing and her clients will be looking what is in style for the season. She would like to be able to offer them the products as quickly as possible and in that way not loose any clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor José H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de variedad de productos los cuales son comercializados por él mismo y es visitado a diario por su clientela.

Ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio por medio de los créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel y es por este motivo que hoy en día busca la forma de cómo salir adelante mejorando su situación económica y para ello ha acudido una vez mas a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y así comprar sus productos para ofertarlos.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Mayoreo market of the city of Managua, José H. sells a variety of goods which he markets himself to customers who come to him daily. He has managed to build his business thanks to the loans he has received from Ceprodel and because of this he is looking once again to continue to improve his financial situation and so has once again approached Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy more goods to retail.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence D. is 47 years old. She is married with seven children, four males and three females. All are in senior high, junior high or basic schools. Her husband is a retired educatior while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Florence prepares and sells Fante Kenkey, a local dish. ‘Fante’ is a tribe in Ghana. The food is so named because it probably originated from the Fante land. It is produced from corn dough. Florence buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages and sells Kenkey in the local market square. She distributes mostly to retailers. She has been in this business for over 20 years.

She wants a loan to procure maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. Florence also sells palm oil and provision besides the Kenkey business. Florence hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Marlon G. como todo varón nicaragüense se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. 

Actualmente él se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual ha desarrollado gracias  a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel por lo que una vez más espera ser beneficiado con un nuevo crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Mayoreo market of Managua, Marlon G., like all Nicaraguan men, works very hard at his business in order to support his household. He has a grocery store which he has developed thanks to the loans given to him by Ceprodel and which he hopes once again to benefit from. This latest loan will be used to buy merchandise and thus build his business and for this he is requesting your support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Mukaddamhon

texts.ru: Мукаддам работает с МикроИнвест уже 4 года. Ее бизнес заключается в купле продаже сухофруктов. Полученные займы использует целенаправленно и получает хорошую прибыль. Прошлый займ закончился 4 месяца назад и прошел без проблем. Сейчас Мукаддамхон имеет заказ на компотную смесь из сухофруктов и поэтому решила обратиться за новым займом.
texts.en:
Mukaddamhon has worked with MicroInvest for four years. She buys and sells dried fruit. The loans she receives are put to good use and make her a profit. Her last loan ended four months ago and was paid off without any problems. Now Mukaddamhon has ordered a dried fruit mix for making compote, and consequently has decided to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. has been a baker since 1997. She sells bread at Agona, near Elmina. Ama is married with two children and has received no formal education.

Her husband is currently on a pension. She is responsible for helping to financially support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for the baking of bread. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest, in order to promote expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Buy flour to bake more bread.

loans.name: Arlen Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Arlen Carolina M. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de ropa el cual a raíz de sus esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y apoyada de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. 

La razón por la cual una vez más ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel es porque requiere el capital financiero para la compra de la ropa y así seguir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
Arlen Carolina M. works very hard selling at her clothes-selling business which she has been able to build through hard work and with the help of the loans she has taken with Ceprodel. She is once again asking Ceprodel for a loan because she needs the capital in order to buy clothing and continue building her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is 36 years old. She is a married woman with four children, one male and three females. Two of her children are in senior high school while the others are in junior high and primary schools.

She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Joyce is a trader in yams. She procures yams from the north where she claims cost is economical. She sells in the local market. Joyce says most of her customers are food vendors. She has been in this business for nine years.

She wants a loan to procure more yams to supply to more customers. Joyce hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure more yams.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is a young lady who believes that business struggle is the antidote to poverty. She is 26 years old and married.

Bola has operated her restaurant business since 2004. Acquiring the skill took five years. Bola needs a loan of N 120,000 to enable her buy more drinks and sachet water to sell.

Bola is very grateful for the financial support rendered to her by LAPO Microfinance and Kiva. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi T. has been selling bags, towels and rubbers and other items at Agona, near Elmina since 1985. 

Naomi is married with two children and has received a junior high education.  Her husband works as a lecturer.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. 

Her loan will be used to increase her sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest, with the goal of expanding her trade.

loans.use: Buy bags, towels and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is 45 years old. She is married with two children, a boy and girl. Her daughter is a professional teacher while the son is currently at the university. Gifty’s husband is also a teacher by profession.

She is a food vendor. Gifty lives with her children and husband in a family house in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Gifty cooks and sells rice and stew. She cooks the food in her house and sells in a school compound in the community. She buys bags of rice from wholesalers in her community. Gifty has been in this business for 15 years.

She wants a loan to procure more bags of rice. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар 34 года, воспитывает 2 детей. Предпринимательство для семьи Санобар семейная традиция – начиная от матери и сестер все занимаются торговлей. Санобар арендует торговое место в местном универмаге и продает детскую одежду. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает больше 2-х лет. Сейчас подала заявку на займ и собирается покрыть за его счет свои транспортные расходы на дорогу на оптовые рынки.
texts.en:
Sanobar is 34 years old and raising two children. For Sanobar business is a family tradition: her mother and her sisters all work in sales. Sanobar rents a space in a local department store and sells children's clothes. She has worked with MicroInvest for more than two years. She is applying for a loan to help defray her transportation costs to and from wholesale markets.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the business's transportation expenses

loans.name: Jessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jessenia Z. se dedica a laborar en su propio negocio de ferretería teniendo su tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario lo atiende.

Ha logrado salir adelante y así apoyar a sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares ya que es una madre soltera y por tanto hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. La razón por la cual espera el crédito es para la compra de los productos ferreteros para ofertarlos y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessenia Z. has a hardware business in a stall in the Mercado Mayoreo market of the city of Managua where she serves customers daily. She has managed to build her business and in this way support her two small school-aged children as she is a single mother and must take on the role of both father and mother. The reason she is hoping for this loan is to buy hardware goods in order to resell them and keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to retail in her hardware store

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo inició el negocio por tradición familiar ya que la mayoría de su familia se dedica a esta profesión. Comenzó el negocio hace 25 años empezó ofreciendo sus servicios a conocidos ya que la competencia familiar era muy fuerte se cambio de domicilio donde instalo su propio consultorio

Desde que inicio el negocio a la fecha le ha ido muy bien ya que es el veterinario principal de las quintas que hay en la región.  

El necesita un pretsmao por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar principalmente diversos medicamentos ya que como su trabajo es de urgencia a veces no puede acudir hasta que consiga el medicamento para los animales.
texts.en:
Reynaldo followed family tradition in choosing to become a veterinarian, as most of his family members are in the same profession. He began his business 25 years ago, offering his services first to people he knew who were familiar with the strong reputation of his family. Later, he moved into a new home and opened his own office. From the time he began his business until today he has been successful and he is now the primary veterinarian for the farms in his region. He is requesting a loan for 3,000 Mexican pesos, to be repaid in five months. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of medications to have on hand, since he often works in emergency situations but must delay his arrival until he can obtain the appropriate medicines for the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome N. is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three males and two females. Two of her children have completed senior high school. The rest are in senior and junior high schools.

She says she works to make some income to support her husband financially to take care of the family. Salome lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Salome deals in printed fabrics and second hand clothes. She buys bales of printed and second hand clothes from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. She has been in business for eight years. Salome wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hopeful to support her children in school.

loans.use: Buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina M. is married with five dependent children. She has received schooling through junior high. Justina has sold groceries, soft drinks and building materials at Agona, near Elmina, since 2001.

Her husband is employed as an auto mechanic. Justina uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Justina will use the loan to increase her stock, to sell more groceries, soft drinks and building materials to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries and supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 42 years old. She is married with five children, two sons and three daughters. Her children are in junior high school and primary school. Her husband is a police officer.

Ama is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She cooks the food in her house and sells in front of her house in the mornings. Ama buys bags of rice from wholesalers in her community. Ama has been in this business for nine years.

She wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. Ama hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice and food ingredients.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has one child. He offers taxi services using his personal car. Alexander used to work at a plant which was later downsized. Then he worked as a guard at a security company. After that he decided to become self-employed and began using his car as a taxi.

Alexander would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to fix the engine of his car. His business goal is to make enough income to be able to help his son get better education. Alexander is a family man and has decided to work only during the day time in order to spend more time with the family.

loans.use: To fix the engine of the taxi

loans.name: Laura Nohemi

texts.es:
Laura inició el negocio porque anteriormente trabajo en una merceria y le gusto lo que ahi hacia, por lo que hace 5 años se decidio a emprender su propio negocio e instalo una papeleria en su casa, 
inicio con una copiadora, sacando copias, vendiendo lápices, libretas, productos basicos, por lo que le empezo a ir bien, y actualmente realizo adecuaciones a su domicilio para tener mejores instalaciones para sus clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $ que pagara en meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio ya que en un futuro quiere  vender  helados ya que la mayoria de sus clientes son estudiantes y cree que ahí puede tener una fuente de ingresos extra.
texts.en:
Laura began her business because she previously worked in a fabric store and liked the work. So, five years ago she decided to open her own business and started a stationery store in her home. She began by making copies with a photocopier and sold pencils, notebooks, and other common items. Her business did well, and she has since made renovations to her home to provide better facilities for her customers.

Laura is requesting a loan for 5,000 Mexican pesos, to be repaid in five months. With the loan, she will purchase merchandise to be able to continue expanding her business. In the future, she would like to sell ice cream, as the majority of her customers are students and she feels that this would be a good source of additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters. Currently, all her children are in senior high, junior high and primary schools.

She says she works to make some income to support her husband financially to take care of the family. Vida lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. However, he is jobless at the moment because his vehicle has broken down.

Vida deals in cabin biscuits. She buys boxes of cabin biscuits from Kumasi and distributes to retailers who run provisions stores in her community and nearby villages. Vida has been in business for twelve years. She wants a loan to procure more boxes of biscuits. She is hopeful to support her children in school.

loans.use: Buy boxes of biscuits.

loans.name: Ibrokhimchon

texts.ru: Иброхимчону всего 31 год, но он уже владеет достаточно большим бизнесом. У него магазин с товарами повседневного спроса. Бизнес семейный и помогают ему его жена и мать. За товаром он ездит на оптовый рынок за 100 километров от его дома. Иброхимчон старается привозить качественные товары и поэтому у него много потенциальных клиентов. Несмотря на то что у многих конкурентов Иброхимчона не очень хорошая реализация, у него все идет нормально. Для расширения бизнеса подал заявку в МикроИнвест и собирается увеличить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Ibrokhimchon is only 31, but he already owns a fairly large business. His shop stocks goods that are in constant demand. It is a family business, and his wife and mother also help. He buys his goods from a wholesale market which is one hundred kilometers from his house. Ibrokhimchon tries to supply high-quality goods, and consequently he has many potential customers. Despite the fact that many of Ibrokhimchon’s competitors do not have such good implementation of their business plans, everything is going well for Ibrokhimchon. He has applied for a loan from MicroInvest in order to increase the variety of goods in his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu M. is a twenty five year old, married mother of three children, one male and two females. Two of her children are already in basic school. The last born has not yet attained school going age. She works to make income to help her husband financially take care of the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic.

Barikisu deals in all kinds of textiles – headgear, clothes, handkerchief, etc. She buys from Kumasi and sells in her community. Barikisu also treks to villages to sell. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hopeful that she will be able to pay for her children to attend high levels of school.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics and second hand clothes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is a thirty year old married mother of four children: two males and two females. Her last born has yet to start school, while the first three are in basic school. Juliana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason by profession.
She works very hard to help her husband to financially provide for the family. Juliana sells smoked fish in the local market and has been in this business for eight years. She buys the smoked fish all the way from the northern part of the country. She wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, actividad que inicio cuando una amiga  la invitó hace aproximadamente 8 años al principio  le ayudaba a ella a vender y le daba una comisión
pero como  le  empezo a ir  muy bien y le gusto tanto, adquirio su membresía y ahora ella es la que vende los zapatos sin necesidad de algún intermediario.

Ella necsita un prestamo por MXN $4500 que pagara en 5 meses para  comprar los nuevos catálogos de la temporada primavera verano y le hicieron pedidos que superaron sus expectativas entonces este crédito le va a ayudar también en poder entregar la mercancia  a tiempo a  sus clientes
texts.en:
Francisca dedicates herself to the sale of shoes through catalogs, an activity that she began after a friend invited her to approximately 8 years ago. When she began her friend helped her and gave her a commission, but because it began to go so well for her and she liked it so much, she acquired a membership and now she is the one who sells the shoes without any need for an intermediary. She needs a loan of 4,500 MXN that she will pay in 5 months to purchase new catalogs for the spring/summer season. Her clients have made orders that surpassed her expectations and this loan will help her to be able to deliver her merchandise on time to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new catalogs and merchandise.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mariée, mère de 5 enfants Madame Maimouna Traoré a 35 ans et vit dans une famille  polygame  dans le quartier Kouloukoro de la préfecture  de koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).
 Pour  des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire de longues études, comme alternative à cela elle s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle a apprises auprès de ses parents. Son activité est centrée  autour  de l’achat  des déchets d’huile pour la fabrication du savon  traditionnel. Elle est très réputée pour cette activité à Koutiala et reçoit beaucoup de commandes.
Pour  l’élargissement de son activité et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle Maimouna décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  5 ans.  Après  5 prêts de groupe (prêt  solidaire) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.  
Ce prêt servira à acheter,  5 barils de déchets d’huile à l’usine FAMAB  de Koutiala pour  sa fabrique de savons traditionnels chez elle même à kouloukoro. Après la fabrication, elle effectue sa vente à une clientèle essentiellement féminines, au comptant en détail et à crédit. 
Madame Maimouna compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage  utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
Dans l’avenir, son ambition  est  d’ouvrir un magasin de stockage des déchets d’huiles et agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Mrs. Maimouna Traoré, 35, lives in a polygamous family in the Kouloukoro neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).

For societal reasons, she did not have a chance to stay at school for a long time, and as an alternative to schooling, she very soon became interested in income-generating activities that she learned by working with her parents. Her work has centered around buying the waste material left over from producing vegetable oil, to be used in making traditional soap. She has a good reputation for this business and receives a lot of orders.

In order to expand her business and satisfy her clientele appropriately, Maimouna decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is on her first individual loan.

This loan will be used to buy 5 barrels of vegetable oil waste at the FAMAB factory in Koutiala, intended for making traditional soap at her home in Kouloukoro. Once the soap is made, she retails it to a clientele essentially made up of women, for cash or on credit.

Maimouna expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which she intends to use to reimburse the interest on the loan and to contribute to improving living conditions for her family, investing any remainder back into her business.

In the future, her ambition is to open a storage facility for vegetable oil waste and to expand her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of oil waste used in making traditional soap

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is a thirty five year old married mother of four male children. All her children are in basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Grace, as a resourceful wife, works very hard to help her husband financially provide for the family. She trades in palm oil. She procures palm oil in gallons from Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She has been in business for seven years. Grace distributes to retailers in her community. She wants a loan to procure oil in bulk. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder.

loans.use: To procure palm oil

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en: Ganna is married with two sons. She has a small kiosk at the market in Khoost and sells clothing. Ganna has been in this business for 5 years. She is very nice with customers and treats them well. The clients enjoy buying things from her and come back often. Ganna's business has become a stable source of income for her family. Ganna would like to get a loan of 6,000 UAH to increase the assortment of good she sells. She would spend the additional income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods she sells.

loans.name: Tiémoko

texts.fr:
Né vers 1952 à Fono dans la préfecture de Bla, Monsieur Tièmoko est marié à deux épouses, père de 8 enfants et vit avec sa famille dans le quartier Lafiala de la ville de koutiala (  Région de Sikasso ).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire des études, il a embrassé le travail de fabrique de marmites auprès d’un vieux forgeron de son quartier depuis son enfance et il exerce ce métier il y a 39 ans. La marmite est un ustensile de cuisine très important pour les femmes et Tiémoko il reçoit  beaucoup de commandes à travers ses clients, car il peut vendre plus de 70 marmites par mois.  
Pour parvenir à satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle en qualité et quantité, il n’a pas pris du temps à rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui li est à son  premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte acheter sa matière première à Bobo (Burkina Faso) soit,  200  kg d’aluminium et des charbons de bois pour la fabrique des marmites. Monsieur  Tiémoko effectue sa vente chez lui même, au grand marché de koutiala, et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et à crédit 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur  compte avoir un bénéfice de 80 000  FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et assurer une bonne partie des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Born around 1952 in Fono in the prefecture of Bla, Mr. Tièmoko is married to two wives, father of 8 children, and lives with his family in the Lafiala district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).

Not having had the good fortune to attend school, he took up manufacturing cooking pots at a young age, together with an elderly blacksmith in his neighborhood, and he has been doing this work for 39 years. The cooking pot is a very important kitchen utensil for women, and Tiémoko receives lots of orders from his customers, since he sometimes sells more than 70 cooking pots a month.

In order to satisfy the needs of his clientele, both in quality and quantity, he wasted no time in making up his mind to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He intends to buy his raw materials in Bobo (Burkina Faso): 200 kg of aluminum and charcoal for making the cooking pots. Mr. Tiémoko sells from his home, in the big open-air market of Koutiala, and in the weekly fairs of the surrounding villages to a clientele constituted of women and men, for cash or on credit.

With this loan, Mr. Tiémoko expects to have a profit of 80,000 F CFA per month which he will use to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover a good part of his family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of aluminum and charcoal for manufacturing cooking pots

loans.name: Martha Ondina

texts.es: La Sra. Martha L. tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos preciosas niñas, tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio, este negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estrategico donde transita mucha gente, ella tiene una cantidad fija que vende a la semana, todas las semanas vende siempre los mismo y ya tiene medidas las ventas pero si ella tuviera mas productos pues venderia mas y asi siempre tendria el mismo margen de ganancias todas las semanas, por eso es que ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos al por mayor ya que asi como los esta comprando ahorita no tiene precio de por mayor porque compra poco, pero asi tendria mas ganancias, ella desea y sueña tener un negocio grande que sea como un mercadito en donde pueda ofrecerle varios productos a sus clientes y tambien desea generar empleo ya que ella quiere ayudar a las demas personas.
texts.en:
Martha L. is 37 years old and the mother of two precious daughters. She has dedicated herself to the business, which is in a very strategic location with a great deal of foot traffic, for one year. She has a fixed amount she sells every week, but would like to have more products to sell so she can increase her margin of income. For this reason, she needs a loan in order to buy merchandise at wholesale. The small quantities she buys now are not enough to allow her to buy at wholesale, so she is paying higher prices for her goods. She dreams of one day having her own business, such as a small market, where she could offer a variety of products to her customers. She would also like to be able to generate jobs because she would like to help other people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy churros, bread, cookies, juices, soft drinks, soaps, toilet paper, lard, soups, oils, eggs, beans, sugar, coffee, rice.

loans.name: Risitas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Ricitas " esta representado por la señora Mariela  y conformada por 15 personas con ganas de salir adelante. Una mayoría de los socios (as) se dedican al comercio de productos como el pan, ropa, pollos, celulares y prendas de vestir. Los socios (as) de este banco tienen experiencia hace ya varios años en el rubro y son emprendedoras y trabajadoras por lo que no temen a la competencia. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de su mercadería y a la compra de insumos y herramientas que faciliten y agilicen su trabajo para aumentar sus ingresos y darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Los socios (as) no tienen mucha experiencia con grupos solidarios ya que es el primer financiamiento para el grupo pero si tienen muchas granas de trabajar y salir adelante es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda una oportunidad de valerse de capital para mejor sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The “Ricitas” group is represented by Mariela. It is made up of 15 people with the desire to get ahead. The majority of the members do business with products like bread, chickens, cell phones, clothes, and other articles of attire. The members of this bank have several years of experience in the area, are very enterprising, and are hard workers. Therefore, they are not afraid of the competition. The loan is to increase their merchandise. They will buy supplies and tools to facilitate and speed up their work. This will increase their income and give their families a better quality of life. The members do not have much experience with groups as this is their first group loan. They do have a big desire to work and get ahead; that is why the Agrocapital foundation offers them the opportunity to get a loan which will increase their income and help their families have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.en:
Maria Rosario is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is married although her husband is not currently in Guatemala. She is dedicated to making traditional blouses and has done this work for over 15 years. In addition to her sewing business, Maria Rosario also sells corn at the market in San Martín, a small city about 70km from Guatemala City. She is asking for a loan in order to buy cloth and corn in bulk. By doing so she is hoping to increase her profits and help expand her business. Her dream is that her children continue to study so that they will have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Su esposo por ahora no esta en Guatemala. Ella se dedica a fabricar blusas típicas desde hace 15 años. También vende maíz en el Mercado de San Martín. Su crédito lo necesita para comprar telas y maíz para que su negocio sea más grande. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que el día de mañana sean mejores.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of cloth and corn

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru:
Саёхат,"Мелиева Саёхатхон Абдукаюмовна",1979,0,1600,0000,6,20015134,"28.02.2009","Савдо",48,0000

Саёхат исполнилось 30 лет, она замужем. Ее муж нигде не работает и подрабатывает на частных работах. Заработок непостоянный и никогда нельзя сказать что будет завтра. Сейчас Саёхат устроилась на работу к одному богатому человеку и работает у него на даче: смотрит за скотом, работает на огороде. Недавно Саёхат договорилась со своим хозяином и он дал согласие, чтобы она могла купить баранов и смотреть тут же на даче. Сейчас у нее 4 барана и она решила обратиться в МикроИнвест за получением займа и прикупить еще 4 баранов.
texts.en:
Sayohat turned 30 years old, she is married. Her husband does not have a job and takes temporary jobs. The income is not regular and one can never say what will happen tomorrow. Right now Sayohat got a job from a wealthy individual and works at his summer home: oversees the livestock, works in the garden. Recently Sayohat made an agreement with her boss and he gave his agreement that she could purchase sheep and raise them at the summer house. Right now she has 4 sheep and she has decided to turn to MicroInvest for a loan and to purchase 4 more sheep.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four sheep

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el Sr. Santos M. se encuentra casado con la Sra. Ramona Avila, ella se dedica a las labores domesticas, de ellos dependen 4 personas las cuales no son hijos de ellos, ya que ellos tienen el problema de que no pueden tener hijos, entonces los han adoptado.
El Sr. M. se dedica a la venta de refrescos de botella y agua en bolsa, ya que el tiene un minideposito en el cual vende este producto al por mayor, aqui es donde varias pulperias y comedores compran este producto, este negocio le genera los ingresos para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar, pero tiene mucha demanda y necesita comprar mas producto para no quedarse si producto rapido, ya que cuesta que regresen los carros repartidores de las empresas a dejarle producto.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos M. is married to Mrs. Ramona Avila. She is a housewife and they have four adopted children. The Morans are not able to have their own children, so they decided to adopt.

Mr. M. sells soft drinks and purified water in bottles and in plastic packaging. He sells them wholesale at his mini-store. Several small grocery stores and restaurants in the area buy the products. This business provides the income necessary to cover the family’s expenses.

Mr M.’s products have high demand and the loan is needed to buy and maintain a larger stock, so he does not run out of the product very quickly. Also there is a charge every time the distributor truck goes to the mini-store.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and purified water in bottles and plastic packaging

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Palmas" esta representado por la señora Velfi L. y ubicado barrio san Juan D. dios   donD. todas residen en el mismo barrio y se conocen entre si, existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Velfi L.  y la señora augusta, ellas son primas en primer grado, pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. Todos los miembros del grupo tienen sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como cosméticos, comida,   pan,  tubos D. plásticos, zapatos, ropa y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. limpieza. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe gran competencia en especial con la importación D. productos D. marca. El destino del financiamiento es para la diversificación D. sus productos para hacerle frente a la competencia y a la compra D. material y herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar sus productos. Las socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios por la experiencia en entidades similares a la fundación agrocapital.
texts.en:
Vilfi L. is the representative for the communal bank "Las Palmas." The bank is located in the San Juan D. Dios neighborhood, where all of the members live and know each other. There are family ties between Mrs. Velfi L. and Mrs. Augusta; they are first cousins, however they maintain independent incomes.

All of the group members have small businesses that sell things like cosmetics, food, bread, plastic tubes, shoes, clothing, as well as businesses that proviD. services like tailoring and clothes laundering. Within this commercial area there is a lot of competition, especially with importing name brand products. The purpose of these loans is to diversify their products in order to give them an advantage over the competition. Also, they will buy material and work tools to improve their products. The members have experience with solidarity groups because of their experience with organizations similar to the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: R.c Teko (Upper) Group

texts.en:
This will be the first loan the teachers at RC Teko (Upper) are requesting from SMT/Kiva.  With this loan, some of the teachers will invest in businesses in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some of them will use it buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs, while others will use it to pay school fees either for themselves or for their children. 

Ibrahim K. (first row right) is the head master of RC Teko (Upper). He has been a teacher for over nineteen years now. Ibrahim was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. He is age forty-nine, married to a businesswoman and they have five children. One of their child is in nursery, the other is in class II, the other is in Junior Secondary School I (JSS I) and the eldest is in Senior Secondary School I (SSS I). Mr. Kargbo will use his loan to buy house building materials like cements and corrugated iron zincs. This will enable him start building a house and with the help of subsequent loans, he is optimistic that he will be able to complete building a house for himself and children. 

RC Teko School was established by the Roman Catholics in 1977 with the aim of educating the children of military personnel at the Makeni Military barracks, Teko, and to spread the Roman Catholic faith. RC Teko is divided into a Lower and Upper primary schools respectively. The Lower is made up of classes I – III and the Upper is made of classes IV – V. RC Teko (Upper) has a total of sixteen staff and 435 pupils.

Amongst the many constrains that this school suffers are the lack of sufficient class-rooms and seating accommodations for the pupils. However, they do make good grades at the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). They also organize sports for the pupils, and last academic year, they emerged victorious at the Inter Catholics Primary Schools Sports.

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria S. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Julian Gomez que se desempeña como motorista, ellos tinen 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ellos y esta estudiando en el colegio.
ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como sopas marineras, cocteles de curiles, pollo frito, carne asada, camarones empanizados, refrescos de botella, agua,. tambien ella se dedica al alquier de unos apartamentos, ella tiene 28 años de tener su comedor, ella en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder compras mas producto para producir sus comidas ya que la demanda es bastante en estos dias de semana santa y necesita estar bien abastecida para cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes, esta es una epoca en que la gente consume mucho marisco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria S. is 52 years old. She is married to Mr. Julian Gomez who works as a driver. They have 3 children, but only the one in high school is still dependent upon them. Maria sells food like seafood soup, seafood cocktails, fried chicken, roasted meat, breaded and fried shrimp, bottled refreshments, and water. She also rents apartments. She has had her cafe for 28 years. She needs a loan now to be able to buy more products to make her food. There is a big demand during Holy Week. She needs to be well stocked in order to meet the needs of her customers. At this time people eat a lot of seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, chicken, pork, soft drinks, tortillas and seafood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Doris Francisca F. tiene 51 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar y tienen un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos, yuca frita y refrescos, ella tiene 7 años de tener su negocio, ella solicita el credito para comprar mas carnes, verduras y tortillas. su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado ya que esta a la orilla de la calle principal que conduce de choluteca hacia tegucigalpa, es la panamericana y por aqui pasan mucho camiones, trailers, carros particulares y siempre paran a descansar y comer algo, entonces a ella le va muy bien pero no se da abasto para salir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes. por tal razon necesita que le otorgen el credito para poder comprar todos los productos que necesita ella para cubrir con todo.
texts.en:
Doris Francisca F. is 51 years old. She lives with her common-law husband and they have a son. She sells snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, cakes, fried yucca and soft drinks. Doris has been in this business for seven years and she is requesting a loan to buy meat, vegetables and tortillas. Her business is located in a place with high volumes of traffic because it is at the side of the main highway from Choluteca to the capital Tegucigalpa. It is the Panamerican highway and the many trucks, semis, and passenger cars that travel it always stop to rest and get something to eat. Her business is doing very well, but she does not have sufficient on hand to meet the customer demand. For this reason she requires a loan in order to buy all the products she needs to meet that demand.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, beef, pork, wheat and corn tortillas, salsa, vegetables, lard, oil, margarine and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: R.c Teko (Lower) Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of  RC Teko, (Lower), Roman Catholic Primary School in Sierra Leone.  RC Teko was established in 1977 with the aim of educating the children of military personnel at the Makeni Military barracks in Teko ward, and to spread the Roman Catholic faith. RC Teko is divided into a Lower and Upper primary schools respectively. The Lower is made up of classes I – III and the Upper is made of classes IV – V. RC Teko (Lower) has a total of sixteen staff and 435 pupils.

This will be the first loan RC Teko (Lower) is requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, these teachers will be able to invest in something great and gradually, with their monthly salaries, they will repay the loan. Some of the teachers will invest in businesses in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some of them will use their loan to buy furniture, like a bed or chairs, while others will use it to pay school fees either for themselves or for their children. 

Alfred B. C. (fifth from right) has been a teacher for over thirty-one years and is now the headmaster of RC Teko (Lower). Alfred was born in Yoni, a small town in the Tonkolili district of northern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-seven years old, married and has eight children. Three of his children are already grown-ups and three are still attending school. Mr. C. will use his loan to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron roofing, nails, sand and cement.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like corrugated iron zincs, nails sand and cements

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Maria Roa F., de 55 años de edad con 1 hijo estudiaste universitario.  La sra conduce un transporte escolar por la mañana y a la tarde se dedica a vender huevo en la zona de tacumbu.  Ella comenta que cada dia es un desafio para ella porque es madre soltera pero con la ayuda que le da la fundación se esta superando bastante.   Hace un año que esta en el grupo de comité de mujeres y dice que va poner mucho empeño para ir creciendo en su tarea que realiza.

Los integrantes de este comité se dedican a varias actividades productivas y la mayoría quieren un prestamo para comprar mercedaria para vender.  

1	Juana R. de S..	Venta de comidas
	Amelia R.. 	Venta de comidas
3	Nancy I. S. R.	Venta de merceria
4	Cecilia P. V. C. 	Fotocopiadora
5	Andrea V..	Venta de frutas

15	Romina V.. 	        Peluqueria 
16	Milca S. R. 	        Venta de torta
17	Maria Roa F..	Venta de huevo
texts.en:
Lets talk about Mrs. Maria Roa F. who is 55 years old and has one son who is a university student. Mrs. F. drives a school bus in the mornings and in the afternoons she sells eggs in the district of Tacumbu. She says that every day is a challenge for her because she is a single mother but with the help given by this foundation this has almost been overcome. For a year she has been in this Woman's Committee group and they say that she has put in much effort to grow in her tasks at hand. The members of this committee are involved in various productive activities, and most want a loan to buy merchandise to sell. 1 Juana R. de S.. Food Seller Amelia R.. Food Seller 3 Nancy I. S. R. Hardware Seller 4 Cecilia P. V. C. Photocopying 5 Andrea V.. Fruit Seller 6 Rosalba Vazquez. Clothing Seller 7 Laura C.. Undergarment Seller 8 Damacia S.. Drinks Seller 9 Liz Mabel C.. Hardware Seller 10 Arlinda A. Empenada Seller 11 Candida P.. Food Seller 12 Marisol Casserá. Hairdresser 13 Laura C.. Clothing Seller 14 Gladis C.. Cosmetics Seller 15 Romina V.. Hairdresser 16 Milca S. R. Pie Seller 17 Maria Roa F.. Egg Seller

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for retail

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.en:
Maria Jesus is married and has 5 children. All of her kids are in school, the 2 eldest are in high school and the rest are in elementary school. Her husband works in construction in Guatemala City. Maria Jesus weaves traditional fabrics and also raises chickens. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more animals and also to buy food and grain for the chickens. In addition she needs to buy more thread for her weaving. Her dream is to be able to invest more in her businesses and that her children continue to study.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Jesus es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Los dos mayores estudian secundaria y los menores también están en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en construcción en la ciudad. Ella se dedica hacer tejidos típicos y también tiene crianza de pollos. Su crédito lo necesita para comprar mas animales y también la comida de sus animales como concentrado y mucho mas. Además quiere comprar hilos para sus tejidos. Sus sueños son invertir mas en sus negocios y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Thread for weaving and food for animals

loans.name: Hacienda Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hacienda Santa Catarina esta integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras:

La Sra Carmen inicio con este negocio porque era una forma facil de trabajar desde casa y no descuidar a su hijo comenzó hace 6 años con el negocio de venta de  comidas, inicio vendiendo en su casa y actualmente vende sus comidas en los mercados rodantes. 

La Sra. Claudia inicio con este negocio para junto con los ingresos de su esposo darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de  vida, ella necesitaba un ingreso adicional aparte de un salario de su esposo por lo cual inicio con la venta de comidas que le funciono muy bien y asi que en su casa no faltara nada. Comenzó su negocio hace aproximadamente  2 años vendiendo comidas fuera de su casa y actualmente tambien vende en la cooperativa de una escuela cercana a su casa, por lo que sus ventas se han incrementado.

La Sra Esperanza inicio su negocio porque queria ser independiente y tener su propio negocio, comenzo vendiendo afuera de su casa y con los vecinos, acutalmente  tambien vende tambien en mercados rodantes 

Ellas necesitan un prestamo por MXN $16,000 que pagaran en 6 meses  para comprar materia prima   que les hacen falta  y poder continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group Hacienda Santa Catarina is composed of 3 enterprising women: Carmen began her business because it was an easy way to work from home and to care for her child. She began this business 6 years ago by selling food; she began selling at her home, and currently sells her food at local markets. Claudia began her business to be able to, when combined with her husband’s income, give her children a better quality of life. She needed an additional income aside from her husband’s salary, for which she began selling food, which served her well so that her home would lack nothing. She began her business approximately 2 years ago selling food outside her home, and currently she sells in a cooperative at a school close to her house, which has lead to an increase in her sales. Esperanza began her business because she wanted to be independent and have her own business. She began by selling outside her home with her neighbors, and currently also sells at local markets. They need a loan of 16,000 MXN that they will pay in 6 months to purchase basic materials that they need to be able to continue with their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo con la desintegracion de un comitè en la misma zona en la que una integrante del grupo anterior formo con nuevas mujeres su propio grupo. 

El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Julia Azucena Gonzalez que tiene 30 años , tiene 2 hijos  que se quedan en la casa de su suegra mientras ella recorre las calles de Asuncion vendiendo sus mercaderias. 

Madruga todos los dias para comprar frutas y verduras del Mercado de Abasto, una vez comprada las frutas y verduras sale a la calle a ofrecer sus productos y a la vez recoge desechos plasticos para asi venderlos y contar con un ingreso extra.

Llega a la casa por la tardecita despues de una ardua tarea en la calle y luego de recoger a sus hijos controla a cada uno sus actividades escolares para asi tambien no descuidar sus actividades de madre. El credito que ella recibe de La Fundacion Paraguaya es indispensable para la actividad comercial que ella tiene.

La mayoria de los integrantes de este comite se dedican a la venta de varios tipos de mercederia.  

Julia Azucena Gonzalez	Vendedora Ambulante
Margarita R. 	Peluquera 
Neide C.	        Venta de Comestible
Lidia V.  	        Vta de ropas usadas
Silvia R. 	        Kiosco
Romina R.	        Venta de Art. de limpieza 
 Pablina R. 	Vta de ropas
Maura P. 	        Venta de lenceria
Carmen F. 	        Venta de comidas
Mari C.             Peluquera
Juana C.	        Vta de ropas
Virginia V.  	Costurera
Elvira A.	        Vta de articulos de limpieza
Selva P.   	        Vta de comidas
Maria Virgina R. 	Vta de ropas
Deisy O. 	        Vta de cosmeticos
Petrona R.	        Vta de comidas
Maria Elena R.      Vta de ropas
texts.en:
This committee was formed after the breakup of a comittee in the same area which integrated these nine women in the current group. The present committee is in its third year. Let us speak about Mrs. Julia Azucenal Gonzales who is 30 years old, has 2 children who stay in the house of her mother in law while she walks the streets of Asuncion selling her merchandise. She rises early every day to buy fruit and vegetables in the Abastos Market, once she buys the fruit and vegetables she goes to the streets to offer her products and at the same time she collects discarded plastic bottles because she can sell them and make some extra income. She arrives back home in the afternoon after a hard days work in the street and spends time with her children, monitoring all of their school activities because she does not neglect her motherly duties. The credit that she receives from the Fundacion Paraguaya is indispensable for her commercial activities. The majority of the members of this committee work in the sale of various types of merchandise. Julia Azucena Gonzalez Peddler Margarita R. Hairdresser Neide C. Grocery Sellers Lidia V. Second Hand Clothing Seller Silvia R. Kiosk Attendant Romina R. Seller of Cleaning Supplies Pablina R. Clothing Seller Maura P. Lingerie Seller Carmen F. Food Seller Mari C. Hairdresser Juana C. Clothing Seller Virginia V. Seamstress Elvira A. Seller of Cleaning Supplies Selva P. Food Seller Maria Virgina R. Clothing Seller Deisy O. Cosmetics Seller Petrona R. Food Seller Maria Elena R. Clothing Seller

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anelida Renee

texts.es:
La señora Anelida Renee C. L. tiene 36 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo de estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella ya que su esposo falleció en un accidente.
Anelida tiene una bodega, inició su negocio en Otuzco donde vivía con su esposo vendiendo gaseosas y luego abarrotes, al fallecer su esposo decidió regresar a cruz de pargo y poner su bodega donde vende abarrotes y cerveza; su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito de 700 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de abarrotes y cerveza para aumentar su capital.
Anelida tiene el gran sueño de comprar su casa propia y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Anelida Renee C. L. is 36 years old and lives in the village of Milán, in Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. She finished several years of school but had leave her studies when her parents no longer had the economic means to support her. She has two children who depend on her economically, since her husband died in an accident. Anelida has a shop that she opened in Otuzco, where she lived with her husband. They sold soft drinks and later groceries. When her husband died she decided to return to Cruz de Pargo and establish a shop where she sells groceries and beers. She runs the business from her home. She used the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her banco comunal, “Luchando por el Progreso,” to purchase groceries to stock her shop. She will use this loan of 700 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, to buy groceries and beer to increase her capital. Anelida dreams of buying her own home and owning a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Bertha Fany

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Fanny Z. López  tiene 38 años, vive en el caserío de Sicsa, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo de estudiar debido a que el colegio era muy lejos para que vaya y se quedo en su hogar ayudando a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 03 aun dependen económicamente de ella.
Bertha dedica a la compra-venta de animales, empezó su negocio hace 15 años vendiendo huachos y chanchos, así como venta de quesillo el mismo que  abandono ya que no le era muy rentable. En tiempo de cosecha se dedica a la compra-venta de cereales y papa.  Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra 02 chanchos.
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro.
Bertha sueña con comprar su casa en Trujillo y conseguir que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Fanny Z. L. is 38 years old, lives in Sicsa which is in Salpo, part of the Otuzco province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed elementary school but had to stop going to school after that because high school was too far from home and she stayed home helping her mother with household chores. She has three children all of whom still depend fully on her. She has bought and sold livestock for the past 15 years. She began her business selling orphaned livestock and pigs as well as cheese but stopped selling cheese since it wasn't very popular. During harvest season she buys and sells cereals and potatoes. She runs her business from her home. With her first 300 sol loan from the "Luchando por el Progreso" bank she purchased two pigs. With the 1800 sol loan, which she intends to repay in 4 months, she will buy a bull. Bertha dreams with purchasing a house in Trujillo and to see her children finish professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cheese and animals to sell.

loans.name: Irma Ermitana

texts.es:
La señora Irma Ermitana F. S. tiene 63 años, vive en el caserío de Sicsa, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo transición, dejo de estudiar debido a que su madre se enfermo y tuvo que dedicarse a cuidarla. Tiene 05 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Irma se dedica a la venta de quesillo, cuando inicio hace 35 años vendía quesillo por kilos de casa en casa con el tiempo a logrado hacerse de clientes y tiene muchas ganancias, en tiempos de cosecha también se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa, así como a la venta de animales (vacas, huachos, chanchos), su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de quesillo.
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro.
Irma sueña con tener su casa en Trujillo y conseguir que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Ermitana F. S. is 63 years old, lives in Sicsa, Salpo district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. She did not finish elementary school because her mother became ill and she had to stay home to care for her. She has five children, none of whom are dependent on her. Irma sells cheese and when she started 35 years ago she sold it in bulk from door to door and as time has gone by she has acquired and kept regular customers and her net gains are good. During harvest season she also sells grain and potatoes as well as livestock (cows, calfs, pigs) and she runs her business from her own home. With her initial loan of 300 soles from the "Luchando por el Progreso" bank she purchased cheese and with her 1800 sol loan she will invest in a bull. Irma dreams with having a house in Trujillo and to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Maria Marcionila

texts.es:
La señora Maria Marcionila M. A. tiene 55 años, vive en el caserío de Tupac Amaru, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo transición, dejo de estudiar debido a que sufría fuertes dolores en sus pies que le impedían caminar; tiene 03 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella. 
María se dedica a la compra-venta de animales (reces, chanchos y huachos) desde hace 30 años, al comienzo solo vendía animales pequeños como gallinas, cuyes, en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa; así también los fines de semana vende cuajada, por un tiempo también tuvo una bodega que cerro debido a que no le era rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra abarrotes para su bodega.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de una vaca y gallinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Marcionila M. A. is 55 years old and lives in the settlement of Tupac Amaru, district of Salpo, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She only completed primary school, and had to stop studying due to strong pains she suffered in her feet that made it difficult for her to walk. She has three children, but none of them depend on her financial support. María has worked for the past 30 years buying and selling animals (cows and pigs). In the beginning she only sold small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. During harvest time she works selling cereal and potatoes. Also during the weekend she sells cheese curds and for a time she had a small grocery store that has since closed due to it not being profitable. She is developing a business in her home. The first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) was invested in purchasing groceries for her store. This loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy a cow and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and chickens

loans.name: Senaida Anassely

texts.es:
La señora Senaida Anassely C. López tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cruz de Pargo, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, abandono los estudios debido a que no le gustaba el colegio y se dedico a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 
Senaida se dedica a la compra-venta de animales desde hace 2 años junto con su esposo, en tiempos de cosecha a la compra-venta de cereales y papa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de un huacho.
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de huachos. 
Senaida sueña con tener muchos animales para criar y vender, así como tener su casa propia.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Senaida Anassely C. López is 20 years old and lives in the settlement of Cruz de Pargo, Salpo district, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through primary school and abandoned her studies due to the fact that she did not like high school and she started working helping her mother with the chores in the home. She has two small children who are dependent on her. For the past two years Senaida and her husband have worked buying and selling animals. During harvest time she buys and sells cereal and potatoes. She is developing a business in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles from her community bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) was used to buy an orphaned animal. This loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy more orphaned animals. Senaida dreams of having many animals to raise and sell, and also of having her own home. She belongs to the Vaso de Leche of her region (is provided with food assistance).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Señora Mirtha tiene 32 años, esta casada con el Sr. Anibal Figueredo, tienen un hijo en edad escolar. Se dedican a la fabricacion de prendas desde hace quince años. Adquiriò este oficio de la madre quien tambien era costurera. Iniciò sus labores con una maquina familiar y actualmente ya cuenta con  catorce maquinas industriales, dando empleo a mas de seis familias. La Señora Mirtha es la encargada de los obreros del area de produccion, mientras que su marido asume la responsabilidad de las ventas hacia el interior del pais. El credito será  destinado a la compra telas para la temporada de otoño-invierno y asi cumplir con la demanda  y continuar ayudando a tanta gente dàndoles la oportunidad de trabajar dignamente. Ella anhela poder expandir sus productos a la mayor cantidad de localidades de nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha is 32 years old and married to Mr. Anibal Figueredo. They have a school-age son. For the past 15 years they have worked making clothing. She learned this trade from her mother who was also a seamstress. She began working with her family's machine and now has fourteen industrial machines, providing employment to six more families. Mrs. Mirtha is in charge of the workers in the production area, while her husband assumes responsibility of the sales in the central part of the country. The loan will be used to buy fabrics for the fall-winter season to supply for demand and to continue helping so many people by giving them the opportunity of having a dignified job. She desires to be able to expand and sell their products to even more locations in their country.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, brooches, needles, etc.

loans.name: Julia Nelsa

texts.es:
La señora Julia Nelsa R. Germán, tiene 45 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”  y vive en el sector Bella Vista de Milán en la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Julia estudió hasta segundo grado de primaria, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la falta de apoyo familiar.
Se casó a los 18 años y actualmente tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales dependen de ella tres.
Julia tiene varias actividades económicas, porque ella dice que tiene que vender de acuerdo a la época, desde la venta de animales mayores, venta de cereales, hasta ropa y calzado.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró cereales.
Con este crédito de 2,000 soles que será cancelado en 4cuotas lo invertirá en compra de animales y algunos cereales.
texts.en:
Julia Nelsa R. G. is 45 years old and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras". She lives in the Bella Vista de Milan sector of the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Peru. Julia finished second grade but could not continue beyond that because her family couldn't afford the expenses. She married at 18 and has 6 children three of whom are still dependent on her. Julia has three main economic activities because she says that she has to sell according to the season. She is involved in the sale of grown animals, grains, and even clothing and footwear. Her first loan for the purchase of grains was for 300 soles which she repaid in 4 installments. With this 2000 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase more livestock and some grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock and certain grains.

loans.name: Liliana Flor

texts.es:
La señora Liliana Flor Sánchez R. tiene 20 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras y vive en Milán caserío de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque tuvo su hija que actualmente tiene 4 años.
Liliana vende ropa gruesa, ponchos, pantalones, etc. de acuerdo a lo que se usa en la localidad.
El primer crédito fue de 200 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en la compra venta de ropa de bebé.
Con este crédito de 900 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en uniformes para escolares.
Liliana sueña con tener un carro para su transporte.
texts.en:
Liliana Flor S. R. is 20 years old and a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. She lives in the Milan settlement, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. Se completed ninth grade but did not go on with her studies because she had her daughter, who is now 4 years old. Liliana sells warm clothing, ponchos, pants, etc. according to what is worn in the area. Her first loan, which she used to buy babies clothing, was for 200 soles and was repaid in 4 installments. With this 900 sol loan, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy school uniforms. Liliana's dream is to own a car to move around in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El sr Hugo esta casado con la sra Lidia Acosta , tienen un hijo menore ,viven en casa propia , hace 6 años que se dedica a la costura con la ayuda de su señora.

Se inicio en esta actividad en una empreda del mismo rubro y con su ahorro pudo comprar sus primeras maquinas.

Su gran sueño es tener un local propio para su taller de costura y seguir dando mas fuente de trabajo para su barrio.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo is married to Mrs. Lidia Acosta, they live in their own house, and they have one child. For six years he has worked as a tailor, with the help of his wife.

He began sewing for a tailoring company, and with his savings bought his first machines. His great dream is to have his own sewing shop, and create some jobs for others in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread

loans.name: Adria Iris

texts.es:
La señora Adria Iris R. V. tiene 46 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 2do de primaria debido a que donde vivía solo había hasta ese grado, tiene 08 hijos de los cuales 4 aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Adria tiene una bodega y se dedica a la venta de menú, empezó vendiendo pan antes de casarse y luego abandono para dedicarse a su hogar, al tiempo empezó a vender bizcochos y gelatinas, con el tiempo fue surtiendo su bodega con abarrotes y con sus ganancias empezó la venta de menú, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega. 
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en aumentar su capital de su bodega y comprar zapatos para campaña escolar. 
Adria tiene el gran sueño de comprar una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adria Iris R. V. is 46 years old and lives in the village of Milán, Salpo district, province of Otuzco, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until her second year of elementary school owing to the fact that where she lived only offered school to this grade. She has eight children of which four are dependent on her financially.

Adria owns a grocery store and dedicates herself to offering a menu of food. She began by selling bread before she married, and later gave it up to dedicate herself to her home at which time she began to sell sponge cakes and gelatins. With time she supplied her store with groceries and with her earnings she began to offer a menu of food and during harvest times she also sold cereal grains and potatoes. She developed her business in her home.

With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank “Mujeres Trabajadores” (Women Workers) she bought groceries for her store. With this loan of 2500 PEN, which she commits to pay in four months, she will invest in the capital of her grocery store and buy shoes for a school fundraising campaign. She has a big dream of buying a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for her grocery store and the purchase of shoes

loans.name: America Miriam

texts.es:
La señora America Miriam R. E. tiene 34 años, vive en el caserío de Bellavista, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para apoyarla, tiene 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
America tiene una bodega y una pequeña panadería que funciona solo en meses de verano debido hay que mas demanda de pan, con las ganancias que obtuvo puso su bodega que lleva ya 4 años, asimismo en meses de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa; también cría animales para la venta. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para preparación de pan. 
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega y abonos para siembra de papa. 
America sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y comprarse una casa en Trujillo. 
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Ms. America Miriam R. E. is 34 years old. She lives in the village of Bellavista in the Salpo district of Otuzco province in La Libertad, Peru.

She finished primary school and then left her studies because her parents didn’t have the means to support her financially. She has two dependent children.

America has a general store and a small bakery that is only open in the summer as those are the months when the demand for bread is the highest. With her earnings from her bakery, she opened the general store, which has now been in operation for four years. During harvest months, she sells grains and potatoes. She also raises animals to sell. She built her business in her own home.

With her first loan of $95.00 (300 PEN) which she received from her communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadores" (“Working Women”), she bought ingredients for making bread.

With the loan of $575.00 (1800 PEN) which will be repaid in four months, she will invest in groceries to stock her store and fertilizers for planting potatoes.

America dreams of seeing her children become professionals and buying a house in Trujillo.

She is a member of her local Vaso de Leche (Glass of Milk), a program that provides food to vulnerable citizens in Peru.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her store and fertilizer for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Pioneras esta representada por L. señora Rosemary  y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades económicas D. ventas D. productos como batidos, alfombras, cosméticos, fruta y abarrotes. Los socios (as) tiene  ingresos diarios pero en días particulares L. venta es mínima y L. competencia granD. en especial con los juego D. los precios, pero L. mayoría D. las socias ya saben como salir adelante para llevar el pan d cada DIA a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para L. adquisición D. materiales insumos para mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos y poder hacerle frente a L. competencia en precios y calidad. El grupo lleva cursando su segundo ciclo con L. institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que saben como administrar sus propios fondos sin desperdiciarlos.
texts.en:
