Mrs. Rosemary is the representative of the group "Las Pioneras" (The Pioneers), maD. up of 12 members who work selling different products like milkshakes, carpet, cosmetics, fruit, and groceries. The members have daily income but on certain days sales are down, especially because of price competition. However, the majority of the members already know how to get ahead to proviD. the daily bread for their families. The loan is to acquire supplies to improve the quality of their products and be able to take on the competition in price and quality. The group has completed two loans with this institution and shown themselves to be punctual and responsible with their payments since they know how to manage their money without wasting it.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Señora María tiene 62 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores ,ella empezó vendiendo los remedios medicinales en canastas por la calle y luego de mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de sus hijos logro montar un pequeña local en el mercado del barrio .Ella le provee de remedios a las despensas del lugar donde vive .Es un sacrificio para ella porque se tiene que levantar en la madrugada para realizar sus compras en el mercado de Abasto En el futuro espera tener un negocio mas amplio y comprar un vehiculo para poder realizar sus ventas en el interior del pais .
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old, and she has two grown children. She started out selling medicinal remedies in baskets on the street. Then, with much effort and with the help of her children, she was able to set up a small place in her neighborhood market. She provides the remedies to the small stores in the area where she lives. It is a sacrifice for her because she has to get up at dawn in order to make her purchases at the Abasto market. In the future she hopes to expand her business and buy a vehicle so that she can make sales in the interior of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies like camomile tea, boldo fruit,anise,flax seed, barley etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz tiene 23 años es soltera  y vive en la casa de sus padres en Itaugua y es madre soltera ,una nena  de 3 años.

La Sra. Luz se dedica a la compra y venta de chipas en la ciudad de Caacupe hace 5 años, sus ventas lo realiza en un puesto fijo que tiene cerca de la Basilica de Caacupe.

Este credito es para la compra de chipas en mayor cantidad a  menor costo diariamente.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Luz is 23 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home in Itaugua. She is a single mother with a 3 year old daughter. Luz has been buying and selling "chipas", a type of corn and cheese bread, in the city of Caacupe for 5 years. She has a stand near the Basilica de Caacupe. This loan is to buy chipas in greater quantity and at a lower daily cost. Luz has made great progress in her life and thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chipas (corn and cheese bread)

loans.name: Deymi Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Deymi Miriam S. R. tiene 24 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, no continuo debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medios económicos. Se caso a los 20 años y tiene 01 pequeña hija que depende económicamente de ella. 
Deymi se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicio su negocio hace 4 años vendiendo madejas de lana y abasteciendo de pollo y pescado a las bodegas, con las ganancias obtenidas decidió iniciarse en la venta de ropa, el cual le es muy rentable y desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de madejas de lana, pollo y pescado.  
Con el crédito de 700 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de  ropa para campaña escolar. 
Deymi sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes muy surtida.
Ella pertenece al Vaso de Leche de su sector
texts.en:
Mrs. Deymi Miriam S. R. is 24 years old. She lives in the village of Milán, Salpo district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state, Perú. She finished high school, but did not continue her education as her parents could not afford it. She married when she was 20, and has a young daughter whom she supports. Deymi sells clothes. She started her own business 4 years ago selling skeins of wool and supplying chickens and fish to small shops. With her earnings she decided to start selling clothes, which is a very profitable business and she does from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras", she purchased skeins of wool, chicken and fish. With a loan of 700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothes for the back to school promotions. Deymi dreams of having a grocery store with ample selection. She belongs to the Vaso de Leche (Glass of Milk) program in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for the back-to-schol season

loans.name: Domitila T.

texts.es:
La señora Domitila T. A. R. tiene 51 años, vive en el caserío de San Luis, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 2do de primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que sus padres se enfermaron y no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Domitila no tiene hijos, se dedica a la fabricación y renovación de calzado, empezó ayudando a su hermano en la fabricación de calzado, al casarse decidió junto a su esposo poner su propio negocio que le ha sido muy rentable y que lleva mas de 28 años, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa, su negocio se desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de material para calzado.
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en ampliar su capital con la compra de material para fabricación de calzado. 
Domitila tiene el gran sueño de comprarse un carro y una moto.
texts.en:
Señora Domitila T. A. R. is 54 years old and lives in the San Luis country house in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco in the region of La Libertad in Peru.

She was in school until the second grade and left her studies as her parents became ill and didn’t have the financial means to keep supporting her. Domitila does not have any children and dedicates herself to making shoes. When she got married she decided with her husband that she would start her own business which has been very profitable and is now 28 years old. In times of harvest she also sells cereals and gruel - her sales take place at her home.

With her first loan for 300 soles which she received from her communal bank, “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Working Women”), she purchased materials for shoes. With the loan for 2500 soles, which will be paid off in 4 months, she intends to increase her capital for buying materials for the fabrication of shoes.

Domitila’s big dream is to buy a car and a motorbike.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of materials to make shoes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carloes tiene 26 años, es soltero. Originalmente es de Caaguazu pero actualmente se encuentra viviendo con sus tios en San Lorenzo. Cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de Aparatos celulares, activaciones, servicio tecnico y venta de accesorios en general. Empezò con un pequeño puesto de activaciones en su domicilio hasta que en el año 2006 pudo abrir su propio local de ventas. Hoy en dia ya cuenta con una clientela formada y necesita este credito para aumentar su stock de mercaderias. Su sueño es poder acceder a estudios universitarios y tambien adquirir su propio terreno o vivienda .
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 26 years old and single. He is orignally from Caaguazu but currently lives with his aunt and uncle in San Lorenzo. He has a business buying and selling cell phones, activations, technical service and accessories. He began with a small activation stand in his home until he was able to open his own shop in 2006. He now has an established customer base and needs this loan to increase his inventory. His dream is to be able to go to college and also to buy his own land or home.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phones, cell phone batteries, plastic, leather and rubber covers, earpieces, new faceplates, general accessories

loans.name: Flor Jovina

texts.es:
La señora Flor Jovina M. L. tiene 35 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 1ro de secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que se caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 06 hijos de los cuales 05 aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Flor tiene una Bodega, al principio se dedicaba con su esposo a la compra- venta de animales, hasta que decidió vender sus animales y abrir una tienda de abarrotes, hace ya 5 años , negocio que abandono por 1 año debido a que se enfermo y que luego empezó nuevamente, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de  abarrotes y útiles escolares. 
Flor tiene el gran sueño de ver a sus hijos profesionales
texts.en:
Señora Flor Jovina M. L. is 35 and lives in the town of Milán, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through her first year of secondary school and abandoned her studies because she got married very young and had to dedicate herself to her home. She has six children, five of whom still depend on her economically. Flor has a grocery store. At first she helped her husband buy and sell animals until she decided to sell her animals and open a grocery store. She opened it five years ago but later put it on hold for one year because she got sick. She started it again and has her store in her house. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women), she invested in the purchase of groceries for her store. With this credit of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries and school supplies. Flor has the great dream of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and school supplies

loans.name: Margarita Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Francisca G. L. tiene 36 años, vive en el caserío de San Luis, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo primaria completa debido a que su padre no la quiso apoyar para seguir estudiando y se quedo en casa ayudando a su madre a cuidar a sus hermanos, tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 03 dependen de ella económicamente. 
Margarita se dedica a la compra- venta de animales hace ya 14 años, al comienzo vendía verduras, negocio que abandono ya que no le dejaba muchas ganancias, ahora  se dedica a la compra-venta de reces, cerdos y huachos, así también en tiempos de cosecha a la compra-venta de cereales y papa, su negocio se desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de verduras para la venta.
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro. 
Margarita sueña con comprarse un taxi.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita Francisca G. L. is 36 and lives in the town of San Luis, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She only studied through elementary school because her father didn't want to support her education any futher. She stayed at home helping her mother take care of her brothers and sisters. She has five children, three of whom depend on her economically. Margarita has bought and sold animals for 14 years. She started off by selling vegetables, but she abandoned this business because she didn't earn a lot of profits. Now she buys and sells cows, pigs, and guinea pigs. At harvest time she also buys and sells cereal and potatoes. She has her business at her home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from the communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women), she invested in the purchase of vegetables to sell. With this credit of 2,500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a bull. Margarita dreams about buying a taxi. She belongs to the "vaso de leche" program (glass of milk- a nutritional program in Peru) in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Maria Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Florinda R. V. tiene 45 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir educándola. Tiene 07 hijos de los cuales 05  aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
María se dedica a la venta de pollo y verduras, inicio su negocio a los 18 años, el mismo que dejo cuando se caso y que luego de 14 años empezó nuevamente  hasta el momento, asimismo se dedica a la compra-venta de animales. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de verduras y pollo para la venta.
Con el crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pollo y verduras. 
Maria sueña con comprar su casa en Trujillo y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Señora María Florinda R. V. is 45 and lives in the town of Milán, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school but didn't keep studying because her parents didn't have the economic means to keep educating her. She has seven children, five of whom still depend on her economically. María sells chickens and vegetables. She started her business when she was 18, but stopped it when she got marred. After 14 years, she started it again and still buys and sells animals. She has her business at her house. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women), she invested in the purchase of vegetables and chickens to sell. With this credit of 200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of chickens and vegetables. María dreams about buying a house in Trujillo and seeing her children become professionals. She belongs to the "vaso de leche" program (glass of milk- a nutritional program in Peru) in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the sale of chickens and vegetables

loans.name: Martha Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Martha Nelly M. R. tiene 37 años, vive en el caserío de Bellavista, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, no continuo sus estudios debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Martha tiene una bodega y se dedica a la venta de menú, inicio vendiendo menú hace ya 8 años, con las ganancias obtenidas puso una pequeña bodega que abandono durante 1 año por problemas económicos y que luego volvió a abrir, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa. Desde hace 3 años también a la venta de zapatos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito de 2000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega y zapatos para campaña escolar.
Martha manifiesta que sueña con comprar una casa en Trujillo y tener una bodega y un restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Nelly M. R. is 37 and lives in the town of Bellavista, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school but didn't continue her studies because she had to dedicate herself to her home. She has two children who still depend on her economically. Martha has a grocery store and sells meals. She started selling meals eight years ago and bought a grocery store with the profits. She stopped running the store for one year because of economic problems but later opened it again. She also sells cereal and potatoes during harvest season. For three years she has sold shoes as well. She has her business in her own home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras," she invested in the purchase of groceries for her store. With this credit of 2,000 soles, which will be canceled in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store and shoes for the school year. Martha tells us that she dreams about buying a house in Trujillo and having a store and a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store and shoes for the school year.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Felicita del Socorro A. C. tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Felicita tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Felicita es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años de que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Felicita son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. El financiamiento solicitado por Doña Felicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de más productos para su pulpería como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y granos básicos. Sus sueños son que la economía del país mejore para que le permita su negocio salir adelante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 14.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro A. C. is 48 years old and single. Felicita has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a grocery store, which she has worked in for over 10 years. Her goal is to get ahead with her business because it is the primary source of income for her and her family. She is seeking funding to buy more products for her store like sweets, natural beverages, bread and basic grains. Her dream is that the national economy will improve, allowing her business to advance. The amount she seeks is 14,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Belinda

texts.es: Belinda tiene 46 años, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, en su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla, Lima. Se dedica a la atención de sus cabinas de internet que instaló en su propia casa, suele dedicarle todo el día, pero en horas de la tarde y de la noche es cuando es más concurrido su negocio, ya que por la zona en la que vive es la única que está cercana a un colegio de la zona, por lo que los niños y jóvenes hace cola para utilizarlas. Por ello está pensando en agrandar su negocio y comprar más computadoras para poder satisfacer a toda su clientela e ir creciendo poco a poco. Por otro lado tiene un negocio paralelo, ya que gracias a su arduo esfuerzo pudo adquirir un motocarro, el cual alquila de lunes a viernes generando buenas ganancias, además su hijo mayor trabaja con la moto los fines de semana, es por eso que también ha pensado en adquirir otra, para tener más ingresos. Belinda tiene muchas ideas de negocio pero para eso necesita de un capital que le permita hacer de sus pensamientos una realidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará computadoras de segundo uso para sus cabinas públicas de Internet, y si es posible, dar la cuota inicial para adquirir otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Belinda is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in their own house in the district of Ventanilla, Lima. She works in an internet cafe that she installed in her home, and normally works there all day long, however, she gets more business in the afternoon and night. Hers is the only such business in the area, and because she is close to a high school, the children and teenagers wait in line to use the computers. For this reason she is planning to expand her business and buy more computers to satisfy all of her clientele and continue to grow little by little. She also has another business. Thanks to her hard work she was able to buy a car, and this car is rented out Monday through Friday earning good income. Her oldest son uses the car for work on the weekends, and for this reason she has thought about buying another car to have more income. Belinda has many business ideas but she needs the capital to permit her to change her thoughts into reality. With the money she is requesting she will buy used computers for her internet cafe, and, if possible, make a down payment on another car.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo Zenón y sus 4 hijos; Bryan de 24, Antoni de 19, Aron de 15 y Alexander de 9 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa, en su casa, ya que trabaja por pedidos, siendo un trabajo muy esforzado, bebido a que debe caminar casa por casa de sus clientes llevando prendas y cobrando. Realiza este trabajo porque le gusta la costura, quiere crecer en su negocio y además busca la manera de solventar los gastos de sus hijos que están estudiando. Lo bueno  es que tiene buenas ventas, especialmente en ciertas  temporadas donde la demanda es muy buena. Actualmente quiere fijar su labor en la temporada escolar, y en las próximas fiestas por el día de la madre. Carmen se encuentra en su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y siempre es muy responsable en los pagos, ya que todo su grupo es muy cumplido. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para elaborar prendas por el día de la madre y la otra cantidad la utilizará para comprar útiles escolares y venderlos por esta campaña de inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and lives with her husband, Zenón, and their four children: Bryan, 24; Antoni, 19; Aron, 15; and Alexander, 9. She makes and sells clothing in her home, working to order. It is very tough work, as she must walk house to house delivering the clothes and collecting payments. She began this business because she enjoyed tailoring. She hopes to expand this business as well as find a way to cover her children's educational costs. The good news is that her sales are strong, especially in certain seasons where the demand is good. Now she wants to focus her work on the school season, and the upcoming Mother's Day festivities. This is Carmen's third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very responsible with her payments; he whole group is very accomplished. She will use this loan to buy greater quantities of cloth to make Mother's Day outfits, and also to buy school supplies to sell for the start of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clothes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 26 años vive con su esposo Andi y su pequeño 7 años de edad, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace dos años y medio, incursionando en este negocio porque requería de una actividad que le permita atender su casa y a su pequeño hijo, ya que se encuentra en periodo escolar y requiere de gran atención en sus estudios. Es así que la venta de cométicos por catálogo se adapta perfectamente a lo que necesita, pues es una actividad que puede realizarla desde casa y mantenerse ocupada hasta que llegue su pequeño del colegio, sin descuidarlo; además las ganancias son buenas, ya que a Carmen le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientas dándole consejos y tips de belleza, logrando que cada vez tenga más pedidos. Carmen ha puesto una vitrina en el negocio de su madre (bodega) y ahí también obtienen más pedidos, espera que con el tiempo, llegue a vender más productos y ser directora de esa línea de cosméticos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, ella siempre ha sido muy puntual en su grupo “Cristo Morado”, ya que todos los miembros están muy bien organizados. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para abastecer la vitrina que colocó en el negocio de su madre.
texts.en:
Carmen is 26 years old and lives with her husband, Andi, and their seven-year-old son in their own house. For two and a half years, she has sold cosmetics. She entered this business because she needed a job that would allow her to stay at home and attend to her son, since he is in school and needs a lot of attention in his studies. Selling catalog cosmetics adapts perfectly to her needs, as it is an activity that she can carry out at home and will keep her busy until her son gets home from school, without neglecting him. Furthermore, the wages are good, and Carmen really enjoys talking to her clients, giving them advice and beauty tips, and earning more orders every time. Carmen has placed a display case in her mother's business (grocery store) and has obtained more orders there; she hopes that, with time, she will sell more products and become a manager of this cosmetics line. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always been very punctual in her group, "Cristo Morado"; all of the members are very organized. With this loan, she will buy a greater quantity of cosmetics to supply the display case in her mother's store.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: G.s Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Pablo II esta conformado por Gregoria C. Moreno y Petrona de los Milagros C. U. ambas integrantes poseen diferentes actividades económicas en el caso de Doña Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración de repostería. La edad de Doña Gregoria es de 55 años. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que empezó a comercializarlas en el mercado y mas tarde con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado establecerse en su vivienda. La Señora Petrona de los Milagros C. U. tiene 32 años, la actividad económica de Doña Petrona es la elaboración de bordados de manteles, toallas y sabanas. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio a comercializarlos con pequeños vendedores ambulantes ya que ellos le realizaban los encargos correspondientes. Es por eso que ambas recurren al financiamiento para mantener activos sus negocios para invertirlos en capital de trabajo en caso de Doña Petrona en la compra de hilo, cintas, tijeras y telas. Y Doña Gregoria lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como huevos, azúcar, mantequilla entre otros. La Señora Gregoria C. Moreno solicita la cantidad de C$ 6.000 cordobés y su amiga Petrona de los Milagros solicita la cantidad de C$4.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ms. Gregoria and Ms. Petrona de los Milagros form the Pablo II Solidary Group. Each of them has a different activity. Ms. Gregoria is 55 years old. She makes pastries and has been doing it for more than 15 years. She started selling them at the markets, but with help from previous loans, she has established herself at her home.

Ms. Petrona de los Milagros is 32 years old. She embroiders linen goods and has been doing it for seven years. She started by selling them to peddlers who place different orders. The two of them request the loan to be able to continue with their businesses and to buy necessary supplies. Ms. Gregoria requests C$ 6.000 cordobés to buy the necessary ingredients for the pastries, like eggs, sugar and butter, and her friend, Ms. Petrona de los Milagros is asking for a loan of C$4.000 córdobas to buy thread, ribbon, scissors and fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eugenia Felicitas

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Eugenia es casada tiene 55 años, dos hijos de 21 y 14 años, este último está en la escuela estatal.
Eugenia estudió corte y confección y trabajó en una fabrica por trece años, hasta que se casó y se independizo, ella confecciona en su casa ropa a medida y sale haber a sus clientas a otros distritos.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, ella va a incursionar en el negocio de la crianza de chanchos, va comprar 10 lechoncitos y comida para  chanchos.
Desde que está en Finca su economía ha mejorado antes no podía comprar telas para ofrecer a sus clienta, ahora compra telas al por mayor, hilos, aprendió a sobresalir en el negocio y ser independiente, también aprendió a tener amigas, era muy tímida. 
El sueño de Eugenia es ver a sus hijos  realizados como profesionales y dejarles un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank Amistad Unida (“Unified Friendship”). Eugenia is married, 55 years old, and has two children ages 21 and 14, of which the latter is in state school. Eugenia studied cutting and tailoring and worked in a factory for thirteen years, until she married and became independent. She tailors clothing by measurement in her home and also leaves to see her clients in other districts. Eugenia needs a loan of 2,400 PEN; she will be venturing into the business of raising pigs, and will be purchasing 10 piglets and pig feed. Since she has been with Finca her economic situation has improved, before she was not able to purchase fabric to offer her clients, and now she is able to purchase wholesale fabric and threads. She learned to stand out in her business and to be independent; she also learned to make friends, as she was very timid. Eugenia’s dream is to see her children become professional and to leave them a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eugenia needs a loan of 2,400 PEN; she will be venturing into the business of raising pigs, and will be purchasing 10 piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Fransisco Javier

texts.es: El Señor Francisco Javier A. Z. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Francisco tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es el servicio de transporte de materiales de construcción. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Francisco inicio este negocio  por cuenta propia por que tenia que buscar la manera de salir adelante con su familia. Los propósitos de Don Francisco son de mantener a sus clientes ya que por la situación económica buscan lo que les resulta más favorable. El financiamiento solicitado por Don Francisco es para capital de trabajo por lo que comprara llantas, batería usada y combustible. Sus sueños son de darle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un buen lugar para el día de mañana. La cantidad que Don Francisco solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier A. Z. is 40 years old and married. Francisco has 3 children and they all are studying. Francisco works in construction materials transportation services; he has dedicated himself to this business for over 10 years. Francisco began this business on his own account because he had to find a way to get ahead in life with his family. Francisco aspires to keep his clients given that because of the economic situation they are looking for the most favorable conditions. The loan that Francisco has requested will be used as work capital to purchase tires, a used battery, and fuel. His dream is to improve his housing to give his children a better place for the future. Francisco is requesting 10,000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase tires, a used battery, and fuel.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Rita es casada tiene 48 años, tiene una hija de 26 años que estudia en la universidad.
Rita trabajaba en el mercado con su mamá, vendiendo pollo, hace quince años  decidió independizarse, ahora ella tiene su puesto donde vende pollo. 
Rita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de bolsas por millares de 10 a 15 millares.  
Desde que está en Finca, las charlas de negocio que se da, porque le ha ayudado a tratar mejor a sus clientes, también le  gusta el compañerismo, le gusta las conversaciones entre las socias por que surgen nuevas ideas de negocio.
El sueño de Rita es reconstruir su puesto de pollo y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the United Friendship Community Bank. She is 48 years old and married, and has a 26-year-old daughter studying at the university. Rita worked at the local market with her mother, selling chicken. It has been 15 years since she decided to go out on her own, and now she has her own post selling chicken. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of 10,000-15,000 bags. Her business has been strengthened since she joined Kiva partner Finca because their talks have helped her better serve her customers. She also likes the companionship and the conversations with the other members because they suggest new ideas for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10,000-15,000 bags for her chicken stand

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja Andrés y su único hijo Jeremy, de 4 años de edad, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por pedido, al saber que podía trabajar desde casa decidió dedicarse a ello, ya que requería de una actividad que no le quite mucho tiempo y le permita pasar más tiempo con su hijo, el cual es su adoración. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede ir de casa en casa visitando a sus amigas y ofreciendo sus productos; además ha puesto una vitrina en la bodega de su madre donde se exhiben mejor, y recibe más pedidos. Jessica está muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le permite generar un ingreso extra al sueldo de su esposo, pudiendo darse sus gustitos personales, como ella dice, y mejorar la economía de su hogar. En el futuro quisiera tener una boutique en su domicilio y obtener mayores ganancias. Este es segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, además que el banco comunal en el que trabaja, llamado “Cristo Morado”es muy unido haciendo más fácil y bonito su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old and lives with her husband, Andrés, and her only son, Jeremy, who is 4 years old, in her own home. She makes a living selling beauty products by order. Knowing that she could work from home she decided to do it, since she required an activity that wouldn't take up too much time and allow her to spend more time with her son, whom she adores. She really enjoys her work since she can go from house to house visiting her friend and offering her products. Furthermore, she has set up a display case in her mother's general store, to better exhibit her products, and she has received more orders. Jessica is very pleased with her job because it allows her to generate extra income on top of what her husband earns, so she can treat herself to personal pleasures, as she says, and improve the economic situation of her household. In the future she would like to have a boutique in her home and increase her earnings. This is her second loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her payments. Furthermore, the community bank she works with, called "Cristo Morado", is very helpful to her business. With the money she is requesting she plans to purchase a larger quantity of beauty products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of beauty products

loans.name: Lidia Felisa

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Bancomunal Amistad unida.
Lidia es casada tiene 41 años, cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 16 y 10 años, el mayor trabaja y los tres últimos estudian en la escuela estatal.
Lidia empezó  hace cinco años a traer uvas de cañete  a venderlas en su casa,  cada vez traía mas,  actualmente vende fruta  en su casa, ahora ella compra en el  mercado mayorista. 
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de mercadería  de fruta compra plátano por millares y sandia por kilos.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a invertir para su negocio,  aprendió a ser responsable con los prestamos, en el Bancomunal tiene más amigas.
El sueño de lidia es agrandar su negocio, comprar una camioneta para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the United Friendship Community Bank. She is a 41-year-old married mother of four, ages 20, 18, 16 and 10. The eldest works and the youngest three attend a state school. Lidia started bringing grapes from Cañete, Peru, to sell out of her home five years ago. Every time she brought more back, and currently sells fruit from her home that she buys wholesale. Lidia is requesting a loan of 1,2000 soles for the purchase of fruit, buying bananas by the thousands and watermelon by the kilo. Since she started working with Kiva partner Finca, she has learned to invest in her business and to be responsible with her loans, and she made many friends in the community bank. Lidia's dream is to grow her business and purchase a van for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit, such as banans by the thousands and watermelon by the kilo

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 44 años, se reconcilió con su pareja y ahora viven con sus dos hijos Luz Mercedes de 17 y Juan de 15 años de edad, en su casa propia. Se dedica a su bodega, pero en determinados momentos cuando no está, sus hijos la atienden y ahora su pareja es la que pasa más tiempo en ella. Por otro lado, también se dedica al trabajo de estibador en uno de los mercados cercanos a donde vive, le gusta su trabajo porque que le da libertad y puede pasar más tiempo con su familia. Suele trabajar de 6am a 2pm como estibador y el resto del día en su bodega. No fue nada fácil para Juan y su familia poner su tienda, nos cuenta que todo nació por la iniciativa de su hija que comenzó a vender adoquines (barra de hielo elaborados en base a jugos de frutas), por la ventana de su domicilio, al ver que las ventas eran buenas decidieron comprar gaseosas, galletas y demás golosinas para los niños que salían del jardín (institución de educación inicial) que se encuentra al frente de su casa. Ahora su negocio va prosperando y ha crecido mucho, Juan y su familia esperan seguir progresando y en el futuro expandirlo mucho más en cuanto a tamaño, para así poner una pequeña librería que administre su hija que está pronta a salir del colegio. Él es un socio antiguo de Microfinanzas Prisma y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Cristo Morado”, pues dice que más que un grupo, es como una gran familia donde todos se apoyan, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar la tienda e iniciar su ampliación.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old and is back together with his partner. Now they live in the home they own with their two children, Luz Mercedes (17 years old) and Juan (15 years old). Juan works at his small grocery store, but at designated times his children take over for him. Now his partner is the one who spends the most time there. In addition, Juan also works as a longshoreman in a market close to where they live. He likes his work because it gives him freedom and he is able to spend more time with his family.

He usually works from 6am to 2pm as a longshoreman and then works the rest of the day at his grocery store. It wasn't easy for Juan and his family to open the store. He told us that the entire idea was born from an initiative of his daughter, who began selling adoquines (bars of ice made from fruit juices) from their home. Once they saw that sales were good, they decided to buy soft drinks, crackers, and some candy for children that go past the garden (an early childhood educational facility) in front of their house . Now their business is prospering and has grown a lot. Juan and his family hope to continue growing their business substantially. In this way they will be able to establish a small bookshop that will be run by their daughter who is about to finish high school.

Juan is a long-time member of Microfinanzas Prisma and is very happy to be part of the communal bank "Cristo Morado." He says that it is more than just a group; it is a big family where everyone supports one another. Juan has always been very punctual with his payments. With this loan, he will buy greater quantities of supplies to establish and grow the store.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and increase merchandise

loans.name: Yanet Liliana

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Yanet es casada tiene 39 años, un hijo de 11 años que estudia en la escuela estatal.
Yanet trabajaba en una librería con dedicación exclusiva, tuvo que dejar el trabajo porque su hija es enfermiza, tiene soplo al corazón y es asmática, no podía dejarla sola mucho tiempo. Se le presentó la oportunidad de  vender productos por catalogo, ella empezó para probar, han pasado casi dos años y le va muy bien.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que está en Finca, ha podido juntar un capital que le permiten cubrir gastos, comprar más ofertas, ahora tiene más amiga.  
El sueño de Yanet es comprar su casa, y poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Bancomunal Amistad Unida. Yanet is married and 39 years old. She has an 11-year-old son who goes to public school. Yanet worked full-time in a bookstore but had to quit her job because her daughter is sickly. She has a heart murmur and asthma, and Yanet couldn't leave her by herself that long. She got the opportunity to sell products from a catalog, and decided to try it out. It's been almost two years and she's doing quite well. Yanet needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy beauty products by catalog. Since she's been with Finca, she's been able to get together the money to cover her expenses, take advantage of discounts, and now she has more friends. Yanet's dream is to buy a house and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy catalog beauty products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 52 años, convive con su pareja José, quien es mecánico y sus 2 hijos; Jhony de 28 y Khaty de 22, en su casa propia, ya que su hija mayor, Jessica de 27 conformó su propia familia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual puso en su propia casa, abre a las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual cosecha muy buenos ingresos, ya que siempre trata de abastecer su tienda con las necesidades de su clientela. En muchas ocasiones cuando sale a comprar mercadería o por alguna urgencia, su hija Jessica la ayuda con la atención, ya que no puede cerrar su bodega porque es muy concurrida, lo que le produce buenos ingresos económicos, es por eso que Rosa está pensando en ampliar, y para esta época escolar vender materiales de librería en una parte de su tienda y así hacer que en el futuro sea una gran tienda muy bien surtida. Rosa es la presidenta de su banco comunal llamado “Cristo Morado”, y siempre ha organizado muy bien a su grupo, siendo más que un grupo, una gran familia. Con el dinero que solicita comprará arroz, azúcar y diez cajas de bebidas, además de comprar útiles escolares para este periodo de inicio escolar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old. She lives in her own home with her partner, José, a mechanic. Their 2 children, Jhony who is 28, and Khaty who is 22 live with them; their grown daughter Jessica, 27, has started her own family. For the last 12 years Rosa has taken care of her grocery store which she set up in her own home. The store is open from 6 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night. She gets a very good income from the store. She always tries to stock her store with what her customers need. Many times when she leaves to buy merchandise or for another urgent matter, her daughter, Jessica, helps her with the store. She cannot close the store because it is very busy, and that’s why she has a good income. Because of the good business, Rosa would like to expand her store by selling bookstore type of merchandise during this school season. In the future she will have a great, well stocked store. Rosa is the president of her community bank, Cristo Morado. She has always well organized her group which is more like a big family than a group. With the loan she will buy rice, sugar, 10 boxes of drinks, in addition to buying school supplies for the start of school this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Eugenia siempre le gusto trabajar, comenzó trabajando como ambulante en el mercado, hasta que pudo comprar un puesto en el mismo mercado, y se puso a vender fruta, también ella estudio repostería y actualmente hace postres.   
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para compra de fruta al por mayor, e insumos para los postres.
Desde que está en Finca, le ha ayudado a invertir, ha recibido charlas que le han orientado en el negocio, aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamos y pagar puntual.
El sueño de Eugenia es poner una dulcería en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Bancomunal Amistad Unida. Eugenia always liked working. She worked as a street vendor in the market until she could buy her own stall there, and started selling fruit. She also studied pastry baking and currently makes desserts. Eugenia needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy bulk quantities of fruit and supplies for the desserts. Since she's been in Finca, she's received help with investing, has been in discussions that gave her guidance in business, learned to be responsible with loans and make her payments on time. Eugenia's dream is to start a sweetshop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and baking supplies

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela es socia del Bancomunal  Amistad Unida.
Rafaela es casada tiene 53 años, tres hijos de 35, 32 y 26 años, que trabajan.
Ella puso su bodega después que se caso, empezó poco a poco, su negocio ha crecido cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para  ampliar su negocio, quiere comprar artículos de librería cuadernos, hojas, para empezar a vender en su bodega. 
Desde que está en Finca tiene un respaldo económico, aprendió a ser más ordenada en su negocio, en las reuniones se siente como en familia.
 El sueño de Rafaela es ver a sus hijos casados.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a member of the Communal Bank Amistad Unida (“Unified Friendship”). Rafaela is married, 53 years old, and has 3 children ages 35, 32, and 26, all who work. She opened her small convenience store after she married; she began little by little, and her business has grown with the help of her eldest daughter. She needs a loan of 1,600 PEN to expand her business, she would like to purchase bookstore supplies such as notebooks and paper to begin selling in her convenience store. Since she has been with Finca she has had financial backing, and has learned to be more organized in her business; in the bank meetings she feels that she is amongst family. Rafaela’s dream is to see her children marry.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rafaela needs a loan of 1,600 PEN to expand her business, she would like to purchase bookstore supplies such as notebooks and paper to begin selling in her convenience store.

loans.name: Moen

texts.en:
Mrs. Moen N. is a villager in Check village in the Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kum Choeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to purchase gasoline and pesticides. Thus, Mrs. Moen N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and for hiring laborers to work in the field.

She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 50 years old and the mother of six children: one is a farmer, two are laborers and the remaining three are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides and hire laborers

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou M. lives in Prachum Angk Village, Kandal Province with her husband and two year old child. She is a hard working woman. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sohpal (pictured with her), is a policeman. He has difficulty getting to work because he has no vehicle.  To solve this problem, Mrs. Chanthou M. is requesting a loan to buy motorbike for her husband drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon K. lives in Prachum Angk Village in Kandal Province. She is a 65 year old widow with three children: one is a construction worker, one a tailor, and the third attends a local school.

Mrs. Phon K. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces problems on her plantation because she does not have rice seed or fertilizer, and her field is far from the irrigation system. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizer, as well as a water pump and gasoline which she will use to irrigate her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.use: Purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pump machine, and gasoline to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom K. lives in the village of Prachum Angk in Kandal Province. She is 40 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Chhum Thy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They earn too little to support their family, so Mrs. Sokhom K. would like to buy more land on which to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To buy another piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Mrs. Tara Duch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Tara D. is the 29-year-old village bank president. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Pech Buntha, is a hard working man. Mrs. Tara D. has two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 27, is a villager living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where he makes a living driving a motor taxi. He also earns additional income by working at the fish market. He is a very responsible man to his family and he especially makes sure his one young child gets the highest education and enough food. His wife currently works as a garment worker.

Nub S. has requested a loan of $1000 in order to buy a trailer to connect to his existing motorcycle to provide a taxi service (Tuk Tuk). He plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and a plot of land

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is enthusiastic and determined to give full support to her husband, a tricycle driver. They are blessed with 3 children: 2 are already in school and the other one is a baby.

Both Marites and her husband try hard to improve their lives. She helps him find ways to earn a living for the family. Currently, she buys and sells corn. Sometimes she finances fertilizer for the farmers; those loans are payable within 15 days. Today, Marites needs capital amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase corn and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and corn

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Chab Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank, which consists of twenty-eight members, is located in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Chanthy C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to add to her business to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Horm Chamnab, is a worker in a bread shop who gets a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Chanthy C. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sam Srey Oun, who is a group guarantor, is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to add to her business

loans.name: Nusratillohocha

texts.ru: Нусратиллохоча занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов – абрикосов и компотной смеси. Компотная смесь это несколько сортов сухофруктов, которые смешиваются в один и готовятся по особому заказу. Нусратиллохоча каждый базарный день выходит на рынок и начинает активно закупать сухофрукты оптом. Если есть возможность продать подороже, то тут же на рынке продает, если нет, то увозит домой и, отсортировав, продает на следующий базарный день. Нусратиллохоче 48 лет, он женат и имеет 4 детей. Он планирует расширить свой бизнес, и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Nusratillohocha purchases and sells dried fruits – apricots and compote mixtures. The compote mixture is comprised of several kinds of dried fruits that are mixed together and prepared for special orders. On every market day, Nusratillohocha goes to the market and actively purchases dried fruits at wholesale prices. If he has an opportunity to resell them for more money, he sells them at the market right away. If not, then he takes the fruits home, sorts them and sells them at the next market day. Nusratillohocha is 48 years old, is married and has 4 children. He plans to expand his business and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita B. is 37 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She lives in Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon in the southern Philippines. Her husband works as a security guard in a company.

Merlita has a variety (sari-sari) store and also sells ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes. She started the business with a small amount of capital that came from their savings. Currently, Merlita's store and RTW business are good, but she wants to increase the stock in her store to meet the demands of her customers and generate more income. She is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 from HSPFI (a Kiva partner). If her loan is granted, this will be her 13th loan cycle. She dreams of seeing her children finish school and earn degrees in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Sris' Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sris P. is the leader of a group of six members who all live in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She sells fruit that is grown near her house. She also is a rice middlewoman. Now she wants to expand her business to earn more income to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more rice to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Men Ly, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sris P. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is just four years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en:
Voeung S., 45, has been a worker at a Cambodian Port for more than three years and currently gets a salary of $150 per month.  Her husband works with her at the same place.  (Voeung's husband, Sarann, is pictured.)  

She has two teenage children who go to school.   

Mrs. S. usually hires a neighbor's taxi to go to work everyday.  She hopes to reduce the cost of transportation.  Voeung is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mrs. Tom Seab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank consisting of ten members is located in Prachum Angk village, in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Tom S. is the 50 year old Village Bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Hae Sat, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their living, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine to start a new business to earn more income. She has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able.

Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of their loan terms. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and use funds for other purposes to earn more income.

loans.name: Abduraufu

texts.ru: Абдурауфу 51 год, женат и имеет 2 детей. Постоянной работы не имеет и работает на различных частных работах. Кроме этого занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов по базарным дням. Ему помогает его старший сын. Но основной доход Абдурауфу приносит его занятие электросварочными работами. Абдурауф выезжает к клиентам на дом если есть необходимость в электросварке, или изготавливает заказ дома если клиенты привозят ему сырье. Абдурауф подал заявку на получение займа и собирается обновить свой сварочный аппарат и купить металл для изготовления различных металлических решеток.
texts.en:
Abduraufu is 51 years old, he is married and has 2 children. He does not have a permanent job and works at a variety of private jobs. In addition, he purchases and sells dried fruits on market days. His eldest son helps him. But the main income Abduraufu makes is from his welding jobs. Abduraufu travels to clients’ homes if the are in need of welding or he makes their orders at home if the clients bring him the raw materials. Abduraufu applied for a loan and plans to update his welding equipment and to purchase metal to make a variety of metal lattices.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S. is 36 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City, in Cambodia. She is a worker in the garment industry, getting a salary of $80 a month. (S. was not available for photographing, so her husband is in the photo instead.)

She currently is responsible for two children who are still young who attend primary school. To help support the family's foods needs, her husband works as a local barber. To reduce the cost of transportation, Pov is requesting a $1000 loan to purchase a motorcycle so she can use it to ride to work and for family needs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Madali

texts.ru: Недавно Мадали имполнилось 50 лет. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Работает в средней школе, кроме этого занимается предпринимательством – куплей продажей сухофруктов. Это приносит ему основной доход. Кроме того его жена шьет на дому и тоже вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Мадали решил получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Recently Madali turned 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He works in a secondary school, in addition he is an entrepreneur – purchases and sells dried fruits. This is his main source of income. In addition, his wife sews at home and also contributes to the family budget. Madali decided to take out a loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Khat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
TwenT.-fO. people living in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Chan K. is a 47-year-old village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ur Thy, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5 acre) field of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from those careers, they use the rice to make wine to sell. In this business, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy rice to make wine in order to do well. Thus, Mrs. Chan K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make wine for her business. She has two children, one of whom stays at home to do housework and the other is attending the local school.

Mr. Soklorn M. did not come to get his loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

While most of the members in this group loan have monthly-payment loans, nine members have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make wine for her business

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 33, sells fish-paste and fresh fish in a mobile business. She can generate a daily income of approximately $5 per day and has been running the business since 2005. Her husband makes a living selling a little cloth in the neighborhood, as well as assisting his wife selling fish. The family have two children who are single and attend school. They also help in the family business when they are not studying. Sen M. is looking for a loan in order to increase her family's business capital.

loans.use: To increase her family's business capital

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru: Замирахон работает преподавателем в школе. Это отнимает массу времени и только по выходным дням она занимается мелким предпринимательством – куплей продажей косточек от абрикосов. Бизнес мелкий, но приносит доход. Замирахон 47 лет, замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Замирахон слышала про МикроИнвест и решила обратиться за получением займа и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Zamirahon works as a school teacher. This takes up the majority of her time and she works on her entrepreneurial venture only on the weekends – purchasing and selling apricot pits. The business is small but it makes a profit. Zamirahon is 47 years old, is married and is raising three children. She found out about MicroInvest and decided to turn here for a loan – she plans to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Yoeung S., 43, is currently living in a medium-sized wooden house with six occupants. She has given birth to four children who are single and still live in the family home. Two of them are employed: one is a garment worker and the other is a local building worker. S. now cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland, which she can plant twice a year. Her husband works as a construction foreman.

S.'s house is too old so her family's living arrangements are not comfortable. Therefore, she would like to request a $700 loan in order to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Ismon

texts.ru: Исмон занимается мелким предпринимательством, ему 39 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Жена работает и еще помогает мужу в его бизнесе. Вместе они выходят по базарным дням и занимаются куплей продажей сухофруктов. Узнав про МикроИнвест, Исмон решил обратиться за займом. Первый займ решил подать на маленькую сумму, чтобы приобрести опыт работы с заемными средствами. Далее собирается увеличивать сумму.
texts.en:
Ismon is a smalltime entrepreneur, he is 39 years old, is married and has three children. His wife works and also helps her husband with his business. Together they go to the market on market days and purchase and sell dried fruits. After finding out about MicroInvest, Ismon turned here for a loan. He decided to initially take out a small loan in order to gain experience with borrowed funds. In the future he plans to increase the loan size.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea H., born in 1942, is the widowed mother of six children; three of them are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home. She currently runs a business by mobile transportation selling a little clothes and medicines at her client's house. Chea H.'s investment is going very well and she has gained more income, because she is skilled in communication. To earn additional income and to make her business more successful, she is asking for a loan to accrue business capital. (She and her daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To accrue her business capital

loans.name: Mr. Reaksmi Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of twenty-one members, is located in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. The members plan to use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. The members selected Mr. Reaksmi K. as the village bank president.  He is a hard-working man because he breeds pigs and uses rice to make wine to sell. Since his breeding pigs business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to add to his business. His wife, Mrs. Phal Malay, is employed in a garment factory. Mr. Reaksmi K. is 27 years old and the father of a child who is enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Sokthet H. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture instead.  

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn P. lives in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a chicken middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to add to her business in order to earn more income to support her family.  Mrs. Norn P. is a 45-year-old widow with three children; one works in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky S. is a farmer in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Since her breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ky S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens, piglets, and pig feed for her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

She is a 61-year-old widow with three children: one is a construction worker, another stays at home to do housework and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda A. is engaged in selling fish. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. She started her fish business so long ago that she can't remember exactly when.  Her husband, Narceso A., is a fisherman. He is the one who goes out to sea trying to catch more fish for Melinda to sell. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. In that way, she could sell more and earn more for her family. She is sure she will be able to provide better for her family's needs by seeking a loan for additional income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ratt

texts.en: Mrs. Ratt K. is a villager in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. She wants to expand her poultry business to earn more income. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy more ducks for her poultry business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Khut Run, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Ratt K. is a 50-year-old mother of four children; two of them work in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. Her husband appears in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en: Mrs. Rith S. lives in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she makes thatch to cover the roofs. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns less income than she needs to support her family's living conditions. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Rith S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed and earn more income. She is 44 years old and a widow with one child who works in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia E. is a fish vendor. She is 51 years old and has seven children. Her life is in the sea. She has been catching fish ever since she was just a kid. She married a fisherman, Leoregildo E.. They work together for the good of their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Kiva's partner CEVI. She will use the loan to repair their old boat and to buy fishing materials. Some of the loan she will also use to buy more fish from other fishermen to sell. In that way, she believes she will sell more fish and earn more to provide their daily needs.

CEVI is a nonprofit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses. They provide all their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and to repair a boat

loans.name: Oen

texts.en: Mrs. Oen K. is a villager in Khlaugh Tvea village in the Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pich Keam, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Oen K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse with cart to transport passengers to earn income. She is a 34-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a horse with cart

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy S. is a villager in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Ngel Touch, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman.

The couple has four children, one of whom is a beautician while the others are attending the local school.

Thuy requests a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of money to buy more cosmetic supplies for her child's business.

She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy more piglets, pig food, and cosmetic supplies for her child's business.

loans.name: Somun

texts.en:
Mrs. Somun Y. (right) was born in 1969 and lives in Trapaing Veing village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mom Houl, is a worker who has been hired to dig a well.

Although they try to work hard, they earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their lives, Somun decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets for breeding.

She has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey Y. was born in 1979 and is married with four single children who are employed as garment workers.  Her husband works in construction to help cover the family’s expenses. He earns $3 per day.  Chey sells Khmer fritters in her village, and has also cultivated rice for years. With the mature rice season approaching, Chey is hoping to buy a rice cultivating machine which she will rent to other farmers. She is requesting a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha A. is 49 years old and lives at Purok 8 Kabayugan, Laligan in Valencia City. She has six children: four of them are married while the other two are still under her care. Her husband died 14 years ago, so Editha is the one who acts as both father and mother in her house. She continues living despite the hardships in life.

Editha has been a businesswoman for a long time. She started selling ready-to-wear items and personal products quite a long time ago. At start of her business she had a capital of PHP 1000 pesos. But due to the demands of her business Editha needs additional capital of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional personal products and ready-to-wear items.

loans.use: To purchase personal products and ready-to-wear items

location.town: Purok 8, Kabayugan, Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidn

loans.name: Lubajja Traders (B) Group

texts.en:
Abdul is the father to 18 children, all from the same wife! He and his wife support these children with a fish-mongering business, a poultry business (mainly run by his wife) and a small farm. Abdul has been in the fish-mongering and farming businesses since he was a teenager.

Although he knows how to grow other products, these days Abdul primarily grows coffee, beans, maize and matoke (green fruits that look like bananas). He usually works the land alone, but occasionally he employs people to help him during planting or harvesting. Since his oldest child is now 40, his children are his day-to-day source of help in running his businesses.

Abdul is requesting a loan of 500,000 USH to make a large purchase of fish for resale. Someday, Abdul would like to open a retail shop where he could sell his fish, products from his farm, and other retail items.

loans.use: Purchasing a large stock of fish for resale

loans.name: Lubajja Traders (A) Group

texts.en:
Betty is a widow with five kids and three businesses! Her children range from 12 to 22 and all are currently in school. Betty manages to pay school fees at private schools for all five of them.

Betty works alone rearing cattle, pigs, and poultry. In her cattle business, she has two dairy cows and six cows that she is raising to sell for meat. Her two dairy cows produce 10 liters of milk per day, which she sells at 200 USH per liter to the community around her.

In addition to these cows, she currently has five pigs, two males which she will soon sell for meat and three females that she will keep to continue to grow the business.

In her poultry business, she has three layers (chickens that are kept for laying eggs) and four broilers (chickens that are consumed for food). In addition to this work, which she does on her own, she is working to expand her farm. She has created a work schedule for herself where she does agriculture in the morning and her other work (except her morning milking) in the afternoons. She is employing someone now to help with her agricultural work.

Now Betty is asking for a loan of 300,000 USH. She needs to purchase some chemicals to improve her farm. Betty hopes one day to move from her father’s place, where she and her children live now. She would like to build a very large house where she and all her children can live.

loans.use: To purchase some chemicals to improve yields on her farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Fuscabio is a farmer. She grows rice and helps her husband manage their small farm to support their entire family’s needs. She has eight children and all of them help much to increase the yield. Aside from rice, she also owns a small shop where she buys and sells junk/scrap materials. She earns almost the same income from both her businesses. She wants to increase her farm size and needs a loan of PHP 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy four bags of urea fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will definitely give her better yield.

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. Now, Erlinda has access to CEVI’s credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase four bags of urea fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn O. is a pig grower. She has a piggery in her backyard since 1998. She is 29 years old and has two children who are all in school. She meets the needs of her family by raising pigs. Her husband is a farmer, and she thinks that along with her husband’s income, she needs to contribute something to increase her family income. She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy feed for her pigs. She will also use a part of the loan to buy fertilizers for her rice farm.
